loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 47 years old and married with four school-aged children. 

Marilyn is engaged in a retailing business of selling rice in their village. With the business, she usually earns 3,200 PHP a month, which is  essential in supporting her family needs.

Marilyn joined the trust group program of ASKI to gain access to financial assistance for her to improve her family's living standard through her business. 

At present, Mariyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be spent to purchase more rice to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Onjela

texts.ar: اونجلا عمرها 28 سنة هي متزوجة وام لولدان تعمل في صالون كوافير لها في عملها 11 سنة تحب عملها وتبدع فيه لأنها تجيده بشكل جيد تريد من خلال تحسين عملها الى تطوير المحل وتربية اولادها في ظروف مادية جيدة تريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء معدات للمحل كراسي وصبغات واكسسورات ومكنة بخار تسعى الى تربية اولادها بشكل جيد من خلال تقديم كل ما لديها من عطف وعمل حتى تتمكن من تأمين ظروف معيشية جيدة لهم فهي امراة عاملة كادحة وتحب عملها وقد استطاعت ان تطور نفسها من خلال العمل لها زبائن من محيطها وجيرانها ولكنها تعاني من المنافسة الشديدة في محيطها وهي تحلم بأن تمتلك مكان اكبر حتى يتسع لعدد اكبر من الزبائن
texts.en: Onjela is a 28-year-old wife and mother of two wants to give her children everything she can to ensure a good upbringing for them. For the past 11 years, Onjela has been working at a hair salon, a job that she very much loves and excels at. She enjoys the patronage of many neighbors and fellow townsmen, although competition is not inconsiderable. Accordingly, Onjela was interested in obtaining a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase a few items for the shop, including chairs, dyes, hair accessories, and a hair steamer. Onjela ultimately hopes to one day own a larger shop.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, dyes, hair accessories for her hair salon.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a dairy farmer from Nyamira in western Kenya. He has been in the farming business for 20 years and sells his milk to the local market. He earns additional income from his small scale farming of tea, coffee, bananas and sugarcane, which are all sold locally. 

Jeremiah has requested a loan of 45,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will enable him to pay school fees for his children and improve his family's livelihood. He faces the challenges of diseases and lack of capital for expansion. He plans to expand his farming in the future by acquiring another piece of land.

Jeremiah is 42 years old and married, with 4 children whose ages range between 17 and 23. Three of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rony

texts.es: Rony es un hombre de 37 años que vive con su conyuge en el Municipio de Soledad, muy cerca a la ciudad de Barranquilla. Proveniente de Pedraza en el departamento del Magdalena, lugar de donde trajo la idea de vender queso, carne y pescado una vez llegò al departamento del Atlàntico, de su natal población, empezó esta actividad entre vecinos, los  que gradualmente aumentaron sus pedidos, refirieron nuevos clientes y con ello ha logrado actualmente su extensión al mercado de la ciudad de Barranquilla, por lo que su capital de trabajo ha resultado ultimamente insuficiente para atender la demanda y ha acudido a su primer financiamiento con la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo para comprar en mayor volumen queso, carne y pescado, poder  disminuìr los costos de transporte y especialmente para responder a su ya buen número de clientes, con precios competitivos, lo cual haria de esta inversiòn todo un èxito. Su sueño es tener un vehiculo para trabajar  en la compra, promocion y distribuciòn de sus productos y para usarlo con su familia los dias de descanso. Mientras esto ocurre Rony persistente en su diaria labor,  manejando una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor al 35 %, que muy seguramente a lo largo del tiempo incrementará y generará mejores utilidades y con ello un mayor bienestar familiar
texts.en:
Rony is a 37-year-old gentleman who lives with his wife in the town of Soledad, which is near the city of Barranquilla. Just outside of Pedraza, which is in the Department of Magdalena, is where he came up with the idea of selling cheese, meat, and fish that comes from the Department of Atlàntico, his birthplace. Rony started his business by selling to his neighbors and gradually gained more orders. They referred new customers to him and now he has extended his market into the city of Barranquilla. As of late, his operating capital has been insufficient in helping him keep up with demand. Therefore, he is requesting his first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo so that he can buy large volumes of cheese, meat, and fish in order to reduce his transportation costs, respond to a large number of customers, and offer competitive prices.

He hopes this investment will be a success. His dream is to have a vehicle for his work so that he can buy, distribute, and promote his products and to allow his family to use on his days off. In the meantime, Rony continues with his daily work routine. He is able to maintain a profit margin of at least 35% from his sales. This figure is likely to increase over time as he generate better earnings by which he can improve the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to purchase cheese, meat, and fish in bulk.

loans.name: Sangimurod

texts.ru: Сангимурод проживает в городе Кургантюбе. Возраст, 47 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Сангимурод зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Sangimurod lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube.  He is 47 years old, married and has three children.  His son is currently in the Russian Federation.  Sangimurod earns a living by breeding cattle.  He breeds livestock at home and has been involved in this type of business for over 15 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Luna works hard to support her family.

She has a shells crafting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Luna is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials like nylon for her shells crafting business.

Luna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like nylon for her shells crafting business

loans.name: Shaimbubu's Group

texts.en: Summertime is usually a time when price jumps for local beef products. It is caused by keeping all livestock in highland pastures called jailoo for fattening. Shaimbubu, 64, is the leader of this group. She is a widow and has a 29-year-old son who is a construction worker. Shaimbubu is retired and gets a monthly pension of around 3,200 soms and an additional 1,400 soms from cattle breeding. At the moment, just like other shepherds, Shaimbubu has sent her livestock of eight head to jailoo in order to keep them in natural conditions so they grow big. Meanwhile, she is busy with her orchard which produced plenty of apricots this year. Since the fruit is very perishable, she tries to sell quickly at the best price offered. Shaimbubu has been in this business for 31 years and is happy with what she has been doing. She asks for a loan so that she can finance the purchase of new livestock, which she plans to also send to jailoo. ====================================== Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young and ambitious socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Benkola E Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKOLA E sont des femmes mariées qui ont  une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et ont en moyenne 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Baou, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, gombo, le pois de terre et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce premier prêt, MAGNINI MOUTAGA, la première assise à droite, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Baou, de Koula, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 30 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the “Benkola E” group are married women averaging 30 years of age, with two children. They live mostly in polygamous families in Baou, a village in the rural community of Banco, Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the goal of being better able to manage their activities at the beginning of the winter season. They grow, among others, rice, gumbo [okra],  ground-beans and peanuts [ground nuts]. They are on their first collaboration cycle with Soro Yiriwaso.

With this first loan, Magnini Moutago, seated first on the right in the photo, plans to purchase agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers] and small tools and pay the cost of working the field and weeding a peanut field about 0.5 ha [about 1.25 acres] in size. 

After harvesting, the produce is sold at the markets of Baou, Kola, Banco and N’Golobougou, to a customer base composed of both men and women. The group members expect to earn an average monthly income of 30,000 West African franks per agricultural cycle.

loans.use: to pay for labor, small tools and agricultural inputs [such as fertilizers]

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Kelly Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Kelly Edith; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un camión que hace servicios de carga pesada llevando frutas, verduras al por mayor a diferentes lugares como puerto Maldonado y Sicuani, la socia también se dedica al negocio de música junto con su esposo y que él es cantor de un grupo musical, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento del camión como para comprar repuestos de carro y también para comprar llantas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank "Cusco." The bank is located in the district of Cusco,  which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

She is Sra. Kelly Edith. She is 24 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children. She alternates her daily activities with her transport business. She has a truck which provides heavy cargo service, carrying wholesale loads of fruits and vegetables to places such as Puerto Maldonado and Sicuani. She also works with her husband in the music business. He is a singer in a musical group. Through these businesses, this bank member is raising her children. She is applying for the loan to maintain her truck by buying spare parts and also tires.

This communal bank member is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to maintain her truck by buying spare parts and also tires.

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Señor De La Cruz Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “TRABAJADORAS DE SEÑOR DE LA CRUZ” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Berta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, elaboración de mantas, costura de deportivos, tejido de buzos de lana, venta de verduras, confesión de faldas, venta de ropa.

La señora Berta, indica que seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace tres años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de una hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y la calle Tumusla y que posterior a la elaboración lo comercializará en las en el desaguadero. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Trabajadoras de Señor de La Cruz Communal Bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes community center.  The group is comprised of eight members, and it is run by a governing board, which Berta heads.  The businesses of the members are varied.  Among the businesses is knitting sweaters, making blankets, sportswear, knitting wool sweatshirts, making skirts, and selling clothes.

Berta says that she has worked with Pro Mujer for six months.  She joined the group by invitation from a friend.  She currently has a business weaving blankets.  She has been doing this work for three years; she learned from her sister.

The loan she will get now is to increase her capital (to buy wool).  She will get the wool at the 16 de Julio Fair and Tumusla street.

 After she makes them she sells them in Desaguader.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health services.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: María Narciza

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita de la ciudad de Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 55 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos,  seis de ellos ya son mayores de edad y la ultima de  16 años que ella  estudia en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos, él se dedica a las faenas de pesca, nos cuenta nuestra amiga que su esposo junto con otras personas de la localidad salen de pesca a alta mar  por dos a tres días,  luego llegan hasta las costas trayendo  los productos del duro trabajo, y es allí cuando nuestra amiga realiza trabajos de limpieza del pescado para luego llevarlos a vender por toda la zona aunque la mayor parte entregan a comerciantes para que los distribuyan en otras ciudades.   Ellos llevan más de 30 años en este negocio el cual les ha servido de sustento a la familia.
  
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos, combustibles, redes y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Lleva  6 años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro para entregar en otras ciudades sus productos.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank "Banco Comunal Crucita" meet in the Crucita Parish of the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for the beautiful beaches that surround the area and are visited by Ecuadoran tourists and foreigners alike.  It is known by the name “Crucita la Bella” (Crucita the Beautiful).

This is where we meet Señora María.  She is 55 years old and has had seven children with her partner.  Six of her children are grown and the youngest is 16 years old; she goes to school.  Three of her children still live with her.  Her husband makes his living as a fisherman.

Señora María is a housewife who takes care of the loans to help her husband.  He makes his living via the task of fishing.  Our friend tells us that her husband and the other local fisherman go out to the high seas for two or three days at a time.  They then come back to the coast bringing the product of their hard work.  And that is when our friend starts her work of cleaning the fish to bring to sell around the area.  The majority, however, is given to traders who distribute the fish in other cities.  They have been in this business for more than 30 years, and it has served to support their family.
  
This loan is for the purchase of food, gas, nets and other fishing necessities.  Señora María has been with the communal bank for 6 years, and she likes it for the help she gets from the loans.

Her dream is to have a car so they can bring their products to other cities themselves.

loans.use: to purchase food, gas, nets and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria  de 42  años de edad es madre soltera de 2 hijos: el mayor de nombre Oscar que estudia en la universidad y trabaja y le apoya a su mamá con los gastos de la casa y Yubelki estudiando la primaria.

Candelaria trabaja como Auxiliar de enfermeria en el Hospital  Asuncion desde hace 14 años, esta solicitando su 8vo credito para mejorar su casa y a la vez tramitar la incripcion del titulo ya que su casita fue construida por medio de un proyecto con Caritas y le falta legalizarla.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a 42 year old single mother with two children. The older son, Oscar, studies in university, works and helps his mother with the household expenses. The other child, Yubelki is in primary school.

Candelaria has worked as a nursing aide at the Asuncion Hospital for 14 years. She is requesting her eighth loan in order to improve her home. It will allow her process the title documents since her home was built through a Caritas project but it still needs to be legalized.

loans.use: continue to improve her home and process the title.

loans.name: Seba

texts.en: Seba is a 35-year-old married woman with seven children, six of whom are in school. She has a business of selling soda and mango juice in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for seven years. She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to enable her to purchase more soft drinks for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Livingstone

texts.en:
Livingstone is a 39-year-old married man with three children who are enrolled in school. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. Livingstone owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for his family and school fees for his children.

Livingstone has been working as a photographer for the past 11 years. His potential clients are his neighbors, friends, and relatives. Theft is a major challenge for him. He dreams of owning a photo shop since he currently operates door-to-door.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more cameras and film for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it gives loans to low-income earners.

loans.use: To purchase more cameras and film for his business.

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité Kyrey está formado por 15 integrantes D. la ciudad D. Lambaré, todas ellas son mujeres con ganas D. progreso y por sobre todo muy luchadoras. Trabajan por lograr un futuro mejor para sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto y gracias al apoyo D. la fundación y D. Kiva.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Sixta, ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo tipo, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y otros tipos D. ropas. Nos cuenta que siempre tiene mucha variedad por lo que siempre las personas compran D. ella. Gracias a su buena atención y a la variedad que tiene ya pudo formarse una clientela bien definida, por lo que tiene, por decirlo D. una forma, un ingreso fijo.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. fundación paraguaya para la compra prendas D. verano, ya que esa estación está próxima y quiere abastecerse parta tener un buen stock D. ellas. Sus compañeras al igual que Sixta están muy agradecidas por la ayuda que reciben.
texts.en:
The Kyrey communal bank is maD. up of 15 members in the city of Lambaré. All are women who want to progress in life and who are, above all, very hardworking. They are working to secure a better future for their families through group effort and thanks to the support of the Fundación and Kiva.

One of the members is Sra. Sixta who sells all kinds of clothing such as shirts, T-shirts, pants and other items. She tells us that she always has a large variety of merchandise and for that reason people always buy from her. Thanks to her good service and the variety she offers she has a well established clientele. Consequently she has, in a manner of speaking, a steady income.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Praguaya in order to buy summer clothing since the season is approaching and she wants to get her merchandise in and have a good supply on hand. The other members of the communal bank, along with Sixta, are very grateful for the help they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is a mason who contributes to the provision of family basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent.

Rabia has operated a food stall for the past ten years; her potential clients are the local area women. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where there is low demand in some months of the year. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase stocks of wheat flour, beans, and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase stocks of wheat flour, beans, and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима замужем и имеет двоих детей. Её муж работает бухгалтером в «Барки Точик», а она имеет магазин рядом городской больницей. Он взяла эту точку в аренду и занимается продажей хозяйственных товаров. Более трех лет она в этом бизнесе и хочет расширить его. Муслима хотела бы получить займ на сумму 3000 Сомони для расширения своего бизнеса, чтобы максимизировать свою прибыль. Она заранее благодарна всем кредиторам за их доброту и помощь.
texts.en: Muslima is married and has two children. Her husband works as an accountant for the power company Barki Tochik, and she has a shop near the city hospital. She is leasing the shop where she sells household goods. She's been in this business for more than three years, and she wants to expand it. Muslima would like to take out a loan for 3,000 somoni to expand her business and maximize her profit. She would like to thank all of the lenders in advance for their kindness and help.

loans.use: to expand her business.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.ru:
В прошлом году Андрей брал кредит на постройку дополнительной теплицы. Увеличился доход, приобрел автомобиль Фиат, не новый, но в очень хорошем состоянии.
Сейчас Андрею нужны дополнительные средства на отопление, закупку семян и пленки.
Интересно отметить, что в этом году жена Андрея ушла с наемной работы и тоже начала свой бизнес. Она ездит  по селам и торгует фруктами и цитрусовыми. Теперь у Андрея с женой два бизнеса.
texts.en: Last year, Andrei took a loan for the construction of an additional greenhouse. His profit increased and he bought a Fiat, not new but in very good condition. Now Andrei needs additional funds to install heating in the greenhouse and purchase seeds and greenhouse film. It is also interesting to note that this year Andrei's wife started her own business. She travels from village to village and sells fruits and citrus. Now Andrei and his wife have two businesses.

loans.use: to install heating in his greenhouse and purchase seeds and greenhouse film

loans.name: Gisèle

texts.fr: Gisèle est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Gisèle et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Gisèle mène comme activité depuis vingt et un ans environs, la vente de farine de manioc et divers produits (tomate, oignons, piments, gombo, etc.) à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Gisèle vend de l’huile de palme et de l’huile d’arachide. Gisèle s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle et son chiffre d’affaire, Gisèle sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gisele is 46 years old  and is married to one Joseph. The couple has three children, all attending school and who are their dependents. In addition to their own children, the couple has another child under their care. Gisele and her husband handle together the various family expenditures.

Gisele has not attended school. To provide for her needs and those of her family over the past twenty-one years, Gisèle's business activity has been the sales of cassava flour and other products (tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra, etc.) from her home.

As a second source of income, she also sells palm oil and peanut oil. Gisele gets her supplies from Benin.

Wanting to raise the level of her business activities and increase her customer base and turnover, Gisele is requesting for the fourth time a credit loan from ALIDé. All previously received funds were reimbursed in full.

loans.use: Buy food products (tomatoes, onions, peppers, okra, etc.), and cassava flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy kale, tomatoes, onions, carrots and peas.

loans.name: Chut

texts.en:
Mrs. Chut operates a fish-selling business in a local market in the Baray district. She earns around $2.50 per day to cover household expenses. She is 33 years old and a loving mother of two school-age kids. Her husband helps contribute income for the family by working hard on the rice field and also providing motorcycle service to the people around his neighborhood. 

At this time, Mrs. Chut is taking out her second loan from Kiva to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her dry-season rice as much as she can and make a good income from the output. She intends to support her two children until they graduate from a university.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay for a plowing fee.

loans.name: Maseno Self Help Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Joyce.  She is thirty three years old, married and blessed with five children. She is a member of Maseno Self Help Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 and has benefited from Enterprise development and financial management training.
She does tomato farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase pesticides and fertilizer in order to improve on production. She hopes this will increase her sales thus increasing her income. She will use the anticipated income to pay education fees for her children and provide better health care for her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer and improve on production hence more income to pay education fees for her children and provide better health care for her family.

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en:
Oktay is interested in IT technology.He has computer skills. He knows office and design programms. He is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbacar region, was settled in Sumgayit shosse.
Oktay borrowed the loan of amount $400 to buy a computer. He did not have the internet hall and he decided to borrow the loan for the second time. He built the internet hall and bought 2 computers.
He applies for the loan amount $2000 to expand the internet hall, to buy computers. He has been engaged in this business for 6 years.

loans.use: To buy the computers

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna lives in the Mtakuja area of Dar es Salaam. She operates a mobile food vending business. She produces food at home, packs the food and distributes it to various customers she has, especially office workers and school children.

She plans to improve her business by adding sufficient numbers of food serving dishes, packaging materials and a stock of food. Recently, with the help of her friend, she obtained orders to serve two more offices located at the industrial area. More working capital is needed. To facilitate her plan Prisca needs USD550.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent A. is a 31-year-old entrepreneur.  She lives in Manyatta Kisumu, Kenya with her husband and three school-going children. She used the funds from her first two loans to invest in this small shop (pictured) adjacent to her home, where she sells daily necessities, like bread, flour, cooking oil and soap. Over the past 2 years she has increased her daily income by 100% and managed to save a bit of her profits.  Millicent plans to supplement her business with small sale of cereals, especially beans and rice which are in high demand She would like a loan of $600 to purchase additional stock and obtain supplies that are in high demand within her community.

loans.use: Improve stock of food supplies in her grocery store.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Ms. Svay M. is 62 years old and calls Phnom Penh, Cambodia her home. To earn a living, she sells traditional Khmer cakes. Her husband is a farmer. However, they only earn five dollars a day. Together, they have one child.

They would like $600 in loans to repair their house and purchase additional seed. In the future, they would also like to start a business selling clothes.

loans.use: To repair their house and purchase seed.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Nilda (32) lives with her husband Mr. Carlos (35) and their two children, one age 6 and the other age 4. They have lived in their own home for over 6 years in the San Miguel neighborhood, in which they also have a store. Nilda is the owner of a business selling clothing for ladies and gentlemen.

The income which their micro-enterprise generates gives them the possibility to pay all the expenses which their nuclear family generates. The type of work they have involves many sacrifices, since it is a field in which one must travel constantly to other cities and even other countries to satisfy the orders from clients.

With the income they generate selling merchandise and thanks to the fact that they have all the conveniences, the lady has decided to open a beauty salon, which is her profession, taking advantage of the fact that in the area there is no similar business.

The couple is requesting this loan of $600 with the aim of investing in merchandise to supply the shop, which will help them provide greater satisfaction for their customers.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Nilda (32), vive con su marido el Sr. Carlos (35) y sus dos hijos, una de 6 años y otra de 4 años. Viven en su casa propia hace mas de 6 años en la zona de San Miguel, en la cual poseen un deposito de mercaderías. Nilda es dueña de un negocio de venta de ropas para damas y caballeros.

El ingreso que generan en su microempresa les da la posibilidad de poder solventar todos los gastos que se generan en el núcleo de la familia. El tipo de trabajo que ellos poseen es muy sacrificado ya que es un rubro en el cual hay que viajar en forma constante a otras ciudades e incluso países para satisfacer los pedidos de su clientela que ya la tienen formada.

Con el ingreso que se genera en la venta de las mercaderías y gracias a que cuenta con todas las comodidades, la señora decide abrir una peluquería, la cual es su profesión, aprovechando así que en la zona no existe otro negocio similar.

La pareja solicita el préstamo de $ 600 con el fin de invertir en la compra de mercaderías para llenar el depósito, la cual ayudara a la mayor satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, t-shirts, socks, underwear, tank tops, etc.

loans.name: Dayu Inten

texts.id:
Dayu Inten W. has been selling in her kiosk for a while. Each day she goes to the market at 5 am to purchase goods to be sold, with the help of her husband. After obtaining the goods, she opens her kiosk at 7 am. She arranged her merchandise nicely to attract customers. She sells variety of snacks from noodle soup, side dishes, and Balinese traditional salad, Gado-gado. With funding and training help from DINARI, Dayu Inten W. is trying to expand her kiosk. She has many regular cutomers in her village. With $2.20 Profit each day, Dayu Inten can supplement her husband's income to support her family

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, KIva Volunteer

Usaha warung yang ditekuni Dayu Inten W. sudah lama dijalani. Setiap pagi mulai pukul 05.00 pagi sudah pergi ke pasar utuk mencari darang dagangan dengan diantar oleh suaminya. Setelah memperoleh barang dagangan baru membuka warungnya mulai pukul 07.00 pagi . Barang - barang dagangan mulai dipajang dan dirapikan agar terlihat menarik. Barang-barang yang dijual yaitu aneka macam makanan ringan dan mie rebus, lauk-pauk siap saji dan makanan khas Bali, yaitu Gado – gado. Dengan bantuan dana dan pembinaan dari Yayasan DINARI Dayu Inten W. memakai untuk melengkapi usaha warungnya.Usaha warung ini ditekuni karena sudah mempunyai banyak pelanggan didesanya. Dengan keuntungan bersih Rp. 20.000,- setiap harinya Dayu Inten dapat membantu pendapatan suaminya dan menopang perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Increase capital to increase merchandise offering

loans.name: Ganu Maiya

texts.en: Mrs. Ganu Maiya M., 36 yearsold, lives in Bholdhoka, Lalitpur. She lives in a joint  family with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband and two sons. Her sons are studying in grade 10 and 6 respectively. Her husband Mr. Dharma M. and she make traditional brass religious statues. In Nepal, brass religious statue-making work is very famous and the demand is also increasing. So she seeks loan money to buy raw materials like wax, silver, etc. to make brass religious statues to fulfill the demand of statues.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Mugema E (Ii) Group

texts.en: Jesca is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She owns a small restaurant. Jesca is applying for a loan to earn a diploma in catering and use the money to help her expand her business and profits.

loans.use: To buy more catering utensils, particularly saucepans and food warmers

loans.name: Mutekanga A Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Margret M..  She currently operates a stationary shop and is requesting a loan to purchase a photocopier.  Margret is 46 years old and is married to an accountant.  She has three children, ranging from 18 to 23 years of age.  Her children go to school.  Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 60000 in profit.   With the extra profit she will make with the help of a loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children  Margret has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, to the amount of UGX 300000, in order to start a wholesale business.  The loan was paid back on time.  Margret is joined in her small group by Sawuya T., Salama N., Aidah F., and Aisha N..  Sawuya T. has a retail shop and wants to buy a refrigerator.  Salama N. is currently operating a tailoring business and wants a loan to purchase a Nero machine.  Aidah F. has a poultry business and wants to use the loan to expand it.  Aisha N. sells new shoes and wants to increase her stock.

loans.use: To add in business and buy a photocopier

loans.name: Muhtor

texts.en: Muhtor is 46 years old. He and his wife have raised four children. Muhtor has been providing taxi services with his vehicle for 8 years. Muhtor owns both the vehicle and the taxi business license. In order to decrease his expenses for fuel, and consequently reduce the fees for his services, Muhtor plans to replace the vehicle's current gasoline fuel supply system with a system using another type of gas. For this purpose he requests a loan of US $950.00 for 10 months. This is Muhtor's first loan and he thanks everyone for their trust and support and promises to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To modify a taxi to use less expensive fuel

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom D. and her husband married in 1997. They have no children. They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sreymom has been a weaver since 1990. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middle man in the village who will then sell them in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a policeman who operates a motor taxi in his spare time.

She is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase materials for weaving silk.

loans.use: to purchase materials to weave silk

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
The Banco Comunal Maria D. Los Angeles is a new communal bank that has 20 members.

The members work in different businesses such as the sale of sweet treats, groceries, natural products, prepared food, cereals, salchipollo (french fries and fried chicken), vegetables, newspapers, crafts, clothing and preparing fresh juices.

The members need loans in different amounts. Some of the amounts are 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles for a total amount of 9,700 soles in loans at the Banco Comunal.

The loans will be used to purchase chompas (Peruvian alpaca sweaters), blouses, rice, sugar, cooking oil, wheat, barley, squash, carrots, oranges, tangerines, cookies, candy, chocolates and natural products.

The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, establish their business, that their children become professionals and owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Maria D. Los Ángeles es un banco que recién inicia con 20 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. golosinas, abarrotes, productos naturales, comidas, cereales, salchipollos, verduras, periódicos, artesanías, ropa y preparación D. jugos naturales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 9,700 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. chompas, blusas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, trigo, cebada, zapallo, zanahoria, cebolla, naranja, mandarinas, galletas, caramelos, chocolates y productos naturales.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar poco a poco su negocio, establecer su negocio, sus hijos sean profesionales y tener casa propia.

loans.use: The loans will be used to purchase chompas (Peruvian alpaca sweaters), blouses, rice, sugar, cooking oil, wheat, barley, squash, carrots, oranges, tangerines, cookies, candy, chocolates and natural products.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha M. sells fabric and clothing that she has sewn. She is married and has four children, but her husband's income from his job with Ghana Railway is insufficient to pay for all of their family's living expenses.

Fortunately, there is high demand for her goods, so she is looking to capitalize on such demand by expanding her business to thereby increase her profits. Therefore, she is seeking additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: To capitalize on the high demand for her goods by expanding her business.

loans.name: Tuinanau

texts.en:
Tuinanau T., 52, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the Taro and banana business. She sells her produce to her friends, relatives,and local community. Also, during the harvest season, she supplies the public market with her goods 5 days per week.

Tuinanau has had 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD). SPBD loans are Tuinanau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The loan will support her kids at school and her church contribution. Her husband works as a self employed laborer to maintain business.

loans.use: To purchase gromozone chemicals, sting chemicals, weedkiller sprayer machine, shovel, bushknife, claves, and wire for a fence.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr:
Monsieur T. Komlan est né à Notsè en 1984. Il est célibataire sans enfant. C’est un jeune homme très actif qui veut a tout prix réussir dans la vie. L’activité qui lui a toujours passionné est le commerce. Il s’y lança alors en 2007 en vendant les chaussures.
C’est bientôt la rentrée scolaire, et les parents d’élève se procurent des chaussures pour leurs enfants. A cet effet il décida d’augmenter son stock pour répondre à la demande à venir.
texts.en:
Mr. Komlan TSALE was born in Notsè in 1984. He is unmarried and has no children. He is a very active young man who wants to succeed in life at any cost. The career that has always inspired him passionately was commerce. He therefore entered the field in 2007 by becoming a seller of shoes. Soon the school year will start again, and the students' parents will buy shoes for their children. As a result, he has decided to increase his stock to respond to the upcoming demand.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and re-sell shoes

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania M., 39, is married with one child. She has seven years of experience in the taxi business. She serves the public five days per week. 

She has five previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~$208 USD). SPBD loans are Melania's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

The loan will be used to fund her business. Her husband is a driver.

loans.use: Renewal of taxi license, spare parts and new car seat covers

loans.name: Chansorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Chansorn S. lives in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Soem Chhouern, are farmers who have one hectare for cultivating rice to earn a living. In this plantation, they now face a small problem because their field is infertile, which affects their crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Chansorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

Mrs. Chansorn S. is 45 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is present on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support her field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Damata

texts.en:
Damata H. is a 58-year-old married woman with five children. The youngest is still in the basic school. 

For the past two years, Damata has been producing palm oil in her community. Palm oil is produced from palm nuts. She buys the palm nuts or fruits from surrounding villages, which are about five miles away. 

Damata desires to buy palm fruits in bulk on a single trip to cut down on transportation costs. She says in this way, she can produce the oil in large quantities and transport it to other markets. 

The name of her group is “Gyese wobre” (unless you suffer). In this group, the members guarantee one another as collateral.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano N. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2004. She first applied to MicroInvest when she decided to open a business selling food products. Rano started from a small-scale business but now she has a mini-market. She is an executive client so she takes a step-by-step loan procedure and increases the sum with each loan.

Rano has a good assortment in her market, trading in coffee, sweets, oil, preserved vegetables and more. Rano is now applying to Kiva for a business development loan of 4000 STJ over four months. She will use the loan to buy a refrigerator and to open a meat selling department. She plans to trade meat, sausages, salami and other items. She thanks Kiva and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and open a meat selling department in her market.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 23 year old woman who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. Fatima has been working as a photographer in a studio for a year. Fatima is very good at photography and knows how to take nice pictures. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she had difficulty finding the proper place for her studio and she didn’t have the startup capital but now that is no longer a problem.

She has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua to purchase a new camera for her business. This is the first time that Fatima has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a new camera for her business.

loans.name: Digna Mercedes

texts.es:
En el Mercado central de la ciudad de Chinandega la señora Digna Mercedes se dedica a su ardua actividad de sastrería y costurería el cual atiende en su propio local donde a diario es visitada por los clientes que solicitan de su trabajo.

Es importante destacar que actualmente ella ha logrado desarrollar su actividad a raíz de sus esfuerzos y para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel y hoy en día ha solicitado un nuevo crédito  esperando que sea otorgado para la compra de materiales de trabajo como hilos, tijera, botones, entre otros y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the main market in Chinandega, Mrs. Digna Mercedes works in the hard job of tailoring and clothes-making. She receives customers at her own place in the market, where she is visited each day by her clients. It is important to note that she has been able to develop her business through her efforts. She has approached Ceprodel for a loan that she hopes will be awarded to her. With the loan she will buy thread, scissors, buttons and other materials. In this way she will be able to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase thread, scissors, buttons and other materials

loans.name: Nhok

texts.en:
M. is 26 years old and a resident of Pursat Province. She has two children: both of them are attending school. She is married to Phat, 33, who works as a fence pole provider through the commune. M. has been a pig-raiser since 2002 and she earns a good income, for she always sells to the slaughterer four times a year.

To help meet the family's income, she also farms rice on a big field which she inherited from her parents. Recently, as the family is growing up, M. faces a difficulty with transportation. So she is requesting a loan of US$ 400 to buy a motorbike for herself and her family. The loan will help the family gain a better standard of living. (M. was not at home to be photographed but her husband was.)

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for herself and her family

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin has been borrowing from LAPO Microfinance for the past 3 years and she has used her loans to buy one deep freezer where she sells frozen food, like chicken and turkey. Toyin is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Sabo-Oniba. Toyin is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more frozen food to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Greetings from Bonaventure N. from Nyarugenge! Bonaventure is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company so that he may buy another motorcycle taxi. He started this work in 1999. He works every day from 7:00am to 8:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately US $220. He is hoping that this loan will enable him to increase his profit so that he may build a house and more easily pay school fees for his dependent child.

Bonaventure is 33 years old, single, and takes care of an orphaned 8-year-old child. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 Rwandan Francs to be paid back over 8 months.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is married and has one child. He makes a living selling food at a small store in Nikopol city. His location is very good, and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. Ivan has been in this business for 15 years, and knows a good deal about it. Ivan is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Ivan can always figure out how many supplies he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs and it is always fresh. Ivan has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his supplies of items to sell.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan que cuenta con 54 años vive en su propia casa, ubicada por el Stadium de la localidad, vive junto a su esposa de 52 años respectivamente, la pareja cuenta con 4 hijos de 25-22-20 y 15 años. Los mayores ya le ayudan en sus actividades los más pequeños todavía estudian. Juan se dedica al transporte público de carga pesada con dos camiones en la Asociación  "el tiluchi". También tiene su tejería, para lo cual cuenta con un terreno propio y especifico para tal actividad. Ambos con buenos años de experiencia. La competencia es mediana en ambas actividades, ya que están ubicados en muy buena zona y principalmente con buenos años de antigüedad en los mismos, lo que lo hace tener muchos clientes. Juan ha invertido todo su crédito en lo que tenia previsto es decir, en el arreglo de su camión para la zafra azucarera. Este es un préstamo paralelo del cliente y todos los esta cancelando excelentemente. El tiene una deuda en otra institución financiera  que esta pagando de una forma muy puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old and lives in his own home which is located by the Stadium of the town. He lives with his wife who is 52 years old. The couple has 4 children ages 25, 22, 20 and 15. The older children help with the work and the younger ones are still in school. Juan dedicates himself to the public transport of heavy cargo with two trucks in the "El Tiluchi" association. He also has does tile work for which he has his own land specifically for this activity. They both have good years of experience. There is average competition for both businesses since they are located in a good area and have been located there for a good amount of time which allows him to have many clients. Juan has invested his loan in fixing his truck for the sugar harvest. This is a parallel loan for Juan and he has been paying his loan excellently. He has another loan with another financial institution which he is paying punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his truck.

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Ce jeune garçon de 30ans marié et sans enfant est tailleur et a son atelier de couture dans la maison familiale  à Mbour. Il fait de la coupe confection et couture, il a une expérience de près de 10 ans. Dans son atelier il forme quatre 4  jeunes au métier de tailleur. Avec le crédit qu’il sollicite il veut confectionner de nouveaux modèles pour la clientèle.
texts.en:
This young boy is 30 years old, married, and without children. He is a tailor and has a workshop in the family house in Mbour. He does the cutting, producing, and sewing. He has nearly ten years of experience. In his workshop, he is training four young people in the trade of tailoring. With this loan he's requesting, he wants to make new designs for his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid R. is a hard-working man who has made sure from a young age that his family never goes without its daily bread. He is single and responsible for his elderly parents and younger brothers and sisters. Khalid has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. Khalid began this enterprise 4 years ago with starting capital of 100 USD, and with perseverance and dedication.

Over time, he has expanded his business.  Today, his whole family is engaged in the business.  Khalid now needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his inventory. With this in mind, he is requesting a loan of 2000 USD. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs to increase his store's inventory

loans.name: Evgheni

texts.en:
Evgheni likes to raise rabbits, and he has done this for many years because these animals bring him pleasure. It has become a business that he does well. At the moment he doesn't have a large number of rabbits, and he would like to increase their numbers. He wants to buy one more buck and a doe, and he also needs to build more rabbit cages. 

He is applying to Microinvest for a loan in order to increase the number of rabbits and to buy building materials.

loans.use: To buy more rabbits

loans.name: Sol Radiante Group

texts.es:
La asociación "Sol Radiante" se reúne cada dos semanas en el centro focal German Buch, actualmente esta fomada por once miembros, los cuales trabajan hace mas de tres años junto a Pro Mujer. 
Diferentes son los negocios de este grupo, como ser; venta de fruta, elaboración y venta de comida, artesanía en tejidos, artículos de ferretería, y otros.
La asociación sol Radiante desea ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesita capital para comprar productos para sus negocios. (Variedad de frutas, arroz por quintal, lana y otros dependiendo el caso).
texts.en:
The Sol Radiente ("Radient Sun") Association meets every two weeks in the German Buch center. At present the group is formed of eleven members, who have worked together with Pro Mujer for more than three years.

The businesses of this group are varied: fruit sales, food preparation and sales, woven handicrafts, hardware materials, and others. The Sol Radiente Association wishes to expand their sales, for which they need capital to purchase products for their businesses (a variety of fruits, rice, wool and other things depending on the business).

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en: Zenaida R. is from the village of Brgy. 5, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 26 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Zenaida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Zenaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yoeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeurn H. lives in Ank Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to support the rice field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Yoeurn H. is 55 years old widow with five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two adult children. She sells clothing at the central market in Melitopol town. Galina's monthly income is 3,500 UAH per month.

Galina has been in this business for 10 years. Last 6 years Galina has been using microloans. She says that microloans really helped her to develop her business and she is going to use them in future too. Galina is a hard working and optimistic person. She encourages her neighbors to develop their business and become more successful.

This time Galina would like to borrow 11,100 UAH to increase the inventories. More income will help Galina to take better care of her family.

loans.use: to increase the inventories

loans.name: Sancho

texts.pt:
Sancho Filipe C., nasceu na cidade de Maputo, tem 60 anos de idade, casado e pai de 05 filhos de 28, 27, 12, 09 e 05 anos de idade, todos vão a escola, estudou ate 8ª classe do antigo sistema de ensino, parou de estudar porque tinha que cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório. Sustenta apenas três dos cinco filhos pois os dois primeiros têm rendimentos e residências próprios.

Sancho trabalhava nos Caminhos-de-ferro de Moçambique (CFM) .Quando ingressou no serviço militar obrigatório em Boane com 21 anos de idade, depois foi transferido para Cabo delgado (província do norte de Moçambique), onde regressou para Maputo quando tinha 24 anos de idade e voltou a trabalhar nos CFM ate reformar, actualmente vive na casa própria em Boane junto com a família.

 Actualmente é supervisor chefe na empresa de segurança privada de Moçambique (MOSEG), aprendeu esse trabalho nos CFM num curso de formação da policia em 1995, o seu rendimento actual e de 4.500,00mt por mês com o qual sustenta a família e consegue poupar algum para poder melhorar a sua habitação.

Com o empréstimo de 10.000,00mt pretende adquirir cimento, ferro e chapas para concluir a sua obra.

Conheceu a Hluvuku através de um colega de trabalho que também é cliente da instituição. Nunca trabalhou com outras instituições financeiras e este é o seu terceiro empréstimo tendo se beneficiado com empréstimos no valor de 5.000,mt e 8.000,00mt para agropecuária e comercio respectivamente, de salientar que fez o reembolso dos mesmos sem problemas e compromete-se continuar a pagar bem para poder aceder a outros empréstimos e mobilar a casa.
texts.en:
Sancho Filipe C. is a 60 year old Maputo resident. He is married and has five children with ages between 5 and 28, all attending school.Sancho supports the three younger ones. He completed 8th grade but had to drop school to join the army. Sanchos used to work at the Mozambique Rail Company "Caminhos-de-ferrro de Moçambique" (CFM), until he joined the army at 21. He was later tranfered to Cabo Delgado (a province in northern Mozambique), and returned to Maputo when he was 24, getting his job back at the Rail Company where he stayed until his retirement. He now works at a private security firm as the chief supervisor and makes around 4.500,00MT (U$155) per month, money that he uses to support his family and build his house. He is asking for a $375 loan so he can buy construction supplies (cement, iron, and other materials) to finish building his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction supplies

loans.name: Lynneth

texts.en:
Lynneth E., 22, is from the village of Barandias , Pangantucan Bukidnon.  Lynneth is single. To make a living, Lynneth owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for this business comes  from selling specialty food products in the local community. Lynneth has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lynneth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lynneth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Lynneth is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lynneth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios A. is from the village of Sinara Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old. Remedios is widowed and has 2 adult children. Remedios owns & operates a business cultivating, buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Remedios joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Remedios has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds for vegetables. This will be the third loan taken out by Remedios from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables seeds.

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Densmaa is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Uvurkhangai province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two youngest children, 18 and 12 attend a local school and her oldest daughter, 23, helps her operate her clothing retail business. She started her business in 2009.  Densmaa has also run a door to door meal delivery business for four years. She is a very hard worker and has a great personality.  She says, “I want to be able to educate my children and help them lead happy lives.”  Densmaa is requesting an 800,000 tugrug (~$560 USD) loan to purchase more clothing for her business.
------------------------------
About XacBank
XacBank was founded in 2001, and listed its first loan on Kiva in January 2009. It is the largest microfinance organization in Mongolia, but also has mainstream commercial operations. XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to develop and implement new solutions to poverty. It is currently utilizing Kiva’s 0% lending interest rate to return 9% of interest paid from borrowers to them in the form of a savings account at the end of their loans. This not only allows borrowers to gain financially, but also encourages them to save.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing for her business.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta D. C., a sari-sari (variety) store owner, snack vendor, and mother of five children, is posed with her goods displayed during their market day in Barangay Remedios, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental, her beloved place.

Vicenta is married to Gilbert D. C., a farmer and laborer in their local community. With regards to their family income, Vicenta felt some hardships and economic crises so she decided to open up a sari-sari store twenty-nine years ago to help her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. She earns an average net income of not less than P2,500 a month from her business activity.

Vicenta is a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People), a microfinance program of Paglaum MPC. She joined Paglaum MPC a year ago because she is very much interested in our products and services and for our being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

As a new member, Vicenta is given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P4,500 to add to the capital of her sari-sari store and snack vending activity. The future income from this loan will be used for the loan repayments and for savings for her children’s educational expenses needed in the future.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more poultry and increase his profits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell food products

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with a 12-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk. Ruslan runs his retail sale business in one of the local markets called “Skhidnyi” (“Eastern”), where he sells groceries. Ruslan started this business only a year ago. However, he’s already making 5,000 Grivnyas in profit each month.   

Ruslan is seeking a 10,000 Grivnya loan to purchase 200 kilograms of smoked fish. He is an experienced entrepreneur. He has been self-employed for 18 years and has had  transportation services and construction businesses as well as retail sales. The venture Ruslan is running now is the main source of income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish

loans.name: Las Hijas Del Rey Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra trabajando con sus proyectos dentro su tercer ciclo.
Cada una de las integrantes del comité de Las hijas del Rey trabajas de manera independiente para lograr mejores ingresos, pero además tienen un fondo en común con las otras integrantes.
Para comentar un poso mas sobre el comité se  hablar de la Sra. Elsa F., quien tiene 2 hijo es vendedora(comestibles, frutas, golosinas, dulces y otros) ambulante sale por la mañana a hacer sus ventas en la zona del Centro Comercial Luisito Felix Bogado y vuelve a su casa por la tarde. Es una señora muy sufrida que tiene un día a día muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.   
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales precarias. De esta manera ella sostiene los gastos de la casa y de  sus dos hijos que van en la escuela. 
Se detalla las actividades de cada una:
1
Aida M. A. A.
Venta de golosinas y comedor para niños
2
Lorenza Q..
Venta de quiniela
3
Julia R. Q..
Venta de Avon
4
Rosa R. B.
Vta  de Quiniela
5
Maria V. P. P.
Venta de Ropas

6

Venta de frutas 
7

Venta de comestible
8
Benigna I. Q..
Venta de empanadas
9
Norma S. A..
Venta de ropas
10
Nilda M. A..
Modista
11
Lorena F. A. T.
Vta de ropas
12
Monica G.A..
Venta de Quiniela
13
Mirna D. F..
Venta de Quiniela
14
Maria F. F. S.
Venta deAvon
15

16

17

Venta de Bebidas
texts.en:
This group is currently working on activities funded by their third cycle loans. Each member of the group, Las hijas del Rey, works independently to gain greater revenue, but they also have a common capital fund. To elaborate a little on this group, we would like to mention Mrs. Elsa F., who has two children, a door to door saleswoman (food products, fruit, soda, candy, etc.). She leaves her home every morning to make her sales in the neighborhood of the Luisito Felix Bogado Market and she returns home in the afternoon. She is a woman who has suffered a lot, whose days are all very dificult because, upon arriving at home, she then needs to take care of the household chores. She does it all because she is a single mother who wants to allow her children a better future. She has a little home made out of meager materials. Thus, she takes care of the household expenses and those of her children who go to school. The businesses of the other members of the group are: 1 Aida M. A. A. Sale of soda and food for children 2 Lorenza Q.. Sale of sports lottery tickets 3 Julia R. Q.. Sale of Avon products (cosmetics) 4 Rosa R. B. Sale of sports lottery tickets 5 Maria V. P. P. Clothing sales 6 Maria G. P. B. Fruit sales 7 Laura B. F.. Food sales 8 Benigna I. Q.. Empanada sales (regional pastries) 9 Norma S. A.. Cothing sales 10 Nilda M. A.. Designer 11 Lorena F. A. T. Clothing sales 12 Monica G.A.. Sports lottery ticket sales 13 Mirna D. F.. Sports lottery ticket sales 14 Maria F. F. S. Sale of Avon products (cosmetics) 15 Liz Paola S.. Cosmetics sales 16 Juana G. B. Clothing sales 17 Silvia F.. Storage facility for goods 18 Elsa L. F.. Door-to-door sales 19 Celia D. A. Sale of beverages

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as candy and caramels as well as ingredients for food production such as meat, pasta, condiments and eggs.

loans.name: Dairiimaa

texts.en:
Dairiimaa is 57 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Mongolian countryside of Tosontsengel province. For the past 20 years Dairiimaa has been making and selling boots. Five years ago her children began to run the business with her. Because they can’t find a building to move the business into Dairiimaa taught her daughters a how to make the boots so they can do it out of their home.  They make good work boots for the herders in the countryside since they are the main source of business.

With this loan Dairiimaa will buy materials for the boots (sable fur, leather, and other needed materials) and also because of winter conditions needs money to buy feed for their livestock.   Dairiimaa and her family have been living in their fence for 30 years. Her 66-year-old husband doesn’t work, and is on pension. Their grown children live with them to help run the business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making boots

loans.name: Mata De Palma En Desarrollo 6, 7 Group

texts.en:
Amada is the coordinator of her group “Mata de Palma en Desarollo 6,7” (Palm Tree in Development), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her husband.

Amada is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling gasoline (a necessary business in her rural community which is miles from the closest gas station) by purchasing more gasoline to sell.

Amada will use the profits to invest in her home by replacing the wooden walls with concrete block. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more gasoline to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda L. is from the village of Tagoloan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Linda is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Linda makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Linda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Linda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria B. is a 54-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Buenavista, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living through a small sugarcane plantation.

Gloria’s husband helps her in running the business. They have five children who are between 9 and 25 years old. Three of the children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Gloria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income through the sugarcane plantation. Now she earns an average monthly income of 26,000 PHP from her business activities.

Gloria is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP was used to fund the operation of her sugarcane plantation and had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now, for her 10th loan cycle, she is borrowing the amount of 26,000 PHP, which she intends to use on her small sugarcane plantation. Gloria is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a community member who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for farming

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es: El grupo primavera esta compuesta por 6 mujeres y un hombre trabajadoras y trabajador que luchan para la vida hace  6 años comenzaron esta labor D. compra y venta D. ropa tipica, viendo la necesidad D. ampliar sus negocio acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para el apoyo D. su capital y por lo tanto El crédito solicitado será utilizado para ampliación D. capital, D. la actividad a las que se dedican 	cada una D. las integrantes del grupo, por lo que se le considera que  la inversion será rentable, debido a que generaran más ingresos para la familia D. cada interesada
texts.en:
The Primavera group is comprised of six women and one man. They are hard-working, and they fight to earn a living. Six months ago they started the work of buying and selling typical clothing. Seeing the need to expand their businesses, they come to the Asociasión ASDIR for help with the capital in the activity in which each member of the group is involved. Their view is that the investment will be profitable. It will generate more income for each member’s family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
