El Sr. A. D. Cesar Augusto de 27 años de edad vive con su conviviente Diana Huanaco Ramal ellos aun no tienen hijos. Viven en casa de su suegro en Psje. Horno Viejo – Parcona – Ica.

El es chofer de mototaxi (transporte) trabaja desde las 7:00 am hasta las 8:00 pm producto de su trabajo ha ido obteniendo sus bienes. 

Su esposa trabaja eventualmente por lo que no cuenta con ingresos fijos, ellos desean mas adelante tener casa propia y tener sus hijos para brindarle una estabilidad y seguridad.

Ambos son jóvenes con muchas ganas de superacion presenta buenas referencias de sus vecinos y solicitan el crédito para mejorar el ambiente donde habitan.
texts.en:
A. D. Cesar Augusto is 27 years old. He lives with his life partner, Diana Huanaco Ramal. They do not yet have children. They live in his in-law’s house in Psje. Horno Viejo – Parcona – Ica. He is a “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle used for transportation) driver. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. As a result of his work, he has been acquiring his possessions. His wife works occasionally, so she does not have a fixed income. Later on they want to have their own house. They want to have children and provide them with stability and security. Both of these young people have a great desire to get ahead. They have good references from their neighbors. They are asking for a loan to improve the atmosphere where they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve property

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: T. Josephine est née en 1966 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Josephine vit depuis trente cinq ans au quartier Dogoudo à Allada, dans le département de l'Atlantique. Mariée à AHOUANSE Vital, Josephine est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Josephine a trois autres enfants à sa charge, en plus de ses enfants. Josephine vit seule avec ses enfants. Depuis près de vingt ans, Josephine prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagné de sauce) à Allada ; ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et aux besoins de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Josephine vend des glacières. Josephine s'approvisionne à Allada et aussi à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Josephine sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé, en vue de rehausser son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Josephine avait bien remboursé son premier crédit.
texts.en:
Josephine T. was born in 1966 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. For the past 35 years she has lived in the Dogoudo borough of Allada, in the Department of the Atlantic. Married to Vital AHOUANSE, Josephine is the mother of two children, both attending (or having attended) school. She also cares for three other children, in addition to her own, and lives alone with her children. For over 20 years Josephine has prepared and sold food in Allada (rice accompanied by sauce), which enables her to meet her own needs and those of her children. As a side business, Josephine sells iceboxes. She gets her supplies from Allada and also from Cotonou. This is the second time Josephine requests the financial support of ALIDé, to increase her activity level and improve customer satisfaction. Her first loan was repaid in full.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one bag of rice, sauce condiments and three dozen iceboxes

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion J. is a 56-year-old married woman who lives in DSB, Pontevedra, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Adoracion’s husband, Marino, aged 62, is a laborer and they have three children who are aged between 30 and 35. All her children have their own jobs and help their parents in defraying financial and other family expenses.

Adoracion joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000 from her business activities.

Adoracion is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 15,000 for her fourteenth cycle loan which she intends to use to invest in her general store business. Adoracion is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To provide additional working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria, de 51 años edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la hermosa selva cusqueña, donde tienen su propio techo. Victoria se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, actualmente se dedica a vender ropa. En un inicio su negocio le iba muy bien, por ser la única que se dedicaba a este rubro, con el tiempo llegó la competencia y bajó las ventas. Sin embargo continua vendiendo sin cesar, ahora cuenta con gran número de clientes y sus ventas se incrementaron paulatinamente; de todas maneras aprendió mucho de la competencia, ya que así ha logrado mejorar en muchos aspectos de su negocio, como el vender ropa de todos los gustos y preferencias para sus clientes y a un precio razonable. Su punto de venta lo realiza en el mismo mercado de su localidad, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche, no obstante Victoria aspira a ganador, ya que para mas adelante está pensando ampliar su establecimiento en otras zonas con la finalidad de poder posicionarse  en el mercado. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a pagar durante las fechas estipuladas, además agradece a su grupo comunal, por la solidaridad que existe entre cada uno de sus compañeros. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la de compra al por mayor de ropa, con el propósito de aumentar sus ingresos económicos, y así también mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Victoria is a 51 year old widow with five school age children. They live together in their own home in the town of Quimbiri, which is located in the beautiful jungle of Cusco. Victoria is known for being an enterprising and hardworking woman who sells clothing at the moment. Her business did very well at first since she was the only merchant of her kind, but eventually competition arrived and her sales fell. Nonetheless, she is able to maintain a steady level of business and now has more customers and her sales have been gradually increasing. Victoria has learned many lessons from her competition and has already improved several aspects of her business. She now stocks clothes for all tastes and preferences and sells them to her customers at a reasonable price. Her vending post is situated in the local market, where she works from 7am until 8pm. Victoria is determined to succeed and later plans to expand her business to other areas in order to position herself in the marketplace.

This is her second loan with MFP. Victoria promises to submit her payments by the established deadlines. She is grateful to each of the other Communal Bank members for cooperating with one another. The loan she is requesting will be invested in a bulk purchase of clothing so that she can increase her financial earnings and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna N. is currently in the business of selling hair-weaving materials in her beauty salon and is requesting a loan to stock more weaving materials to sell. Anna is 37 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 3 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a pharmacy.

loans.use: Stock more weaving materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve his house he will change the gate to his house

loans.name: Oqtay

texts.en: Oqtay H. is a successful father and dedicated husband. Oqtay began a small grocery store 9 years ago with his savings. He sells watermelons and other seasonal fruits in his own shop. He is assisted by his wife, who helps him to serve his clients. Today his clientele has grown greater and his store has become more popular. His monthly income is about 300-600 AZN. He is asking for a loan of 900 AZN so that he may expand the variety of goods that are sold in his store.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah N. lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of some of her in-laws. Robinah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medical expenses.

Robinah runs a retail shop, working six days a week. She has been in business for over ten years. She sells her wares at retail at the market. She also works as a tailor which acts as an additional source of income. Robinah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Robinah include seasonality and transportation. Her goal for her business is to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old. She is married and has five children; the oldest is 18 while the youngest is 2 years old. All of her children go to school except the young one. 

She has a restaurant in which she sells different kinds of snacks, juice, soda, tea and African food such as green bananas, cassava and potatoes. She has been in this business for two years.

She is requesting a loan in order to expand her restaurant business and hire another employee. In the photo, Beatrice is in a white shirt standing with her mother, who has a cloth tied on her head. They work together.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Esther Clotil

texts.es:
Esther es una madre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío Insculas una zona agrícola del distrito de Olmos, perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque, se encuentra ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y algunas medicinas en una bodega instalada en su domicilio. Este negocio ya lleva funcionando cerca de cinco años y tiene mucha acogida ya que le permite a sus vecinos agenciarse de diversos productos a los que usualmente no tienen acceso rápido debido a su ubicación. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad ella ayuda a su esposo con los gastos económicos de su familia.

Esther desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que sus ventas e ingresos aumenten y así pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Como no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta acción se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Esther es una mujer responsable y bastante activa. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer amable, tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Esther is a 34 year-old mother who lives with her family in the rural Insculas settlement in an agricultural area in the Olmos district, part of the Lambayeque province, located more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells groceries and basic consumer goods and some medicines in a store that is set up in her home.  This business has been running for about 5 years, and is well-received, since it allows her neighbors to buy a variety of products that they usually do not have access to due to their remote location.  With the income she earns from this activity she helps her husband with the family's expenses.

Esther wants to expand her business by buying more products to increase her sales and her income.  In this way she can improve the quality of life of her family.  As she lacks the capital she needs to achieve this objective, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 600 Peruvian soles.  

Esther is quite active and responsible.  The people who know her consider her to be a friendly woman who is calm and reliable.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her store

loans.name: Tufosa

texts.en:
Tufosa is 31 years old from Nyamasare area in Migori town, and she is married to Herman. They have five children who are all in lower primary schools.

Tufosa is in the business of selling medicines and many people prefer to buy from her since she is fairly cheap, compared to the pharmacies around. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD  after being introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a client here. Tufosa wants to use the money to buy different types of medicines, such as painkilliers, antibiotics, cough syrup, etc., to add to her stock.

Her hope is one day to be able to open a pharmacy as her business grows.

loans.use: Buy stocks of medicine

loans.name: Buthayna

texts.en:
Buthayna is the young mother of one daughter and three sons. She is married to Ibrahim who runs a bakery in the city. The family lives in Gaza City in Gaza Strip. The bakery, which is their only source of income, produces different kinds of bread, including locA. breads such as Lebanese, Iraqi, etc. Buthayna and her husband started the bakery four years ago. The bakery supplies a large area around the center of the city as it's the only one producing a large variety of bread. Buthayna came to Kiva's partner, FATEN, for a loan to purchase larger amounts of wheat flour and baking materials as they are planning to double their production and increase their returns.

Buthayna's husband appears in the the bakery photo as Buthayna is very religious - as are most Gaza Strip citizens - and doesn't want her picture posted online.

About Shariah-compliant lending:
 
FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the culturA. context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principA. loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour and baking materials

loans.name: Evelynda

texts.en:
Evelynda C. is a simple woman, a responsible mother, and a loving wife to Clemente C. Sr. from Maradiona, Belison, Antique, Philippines. They are blessed with two children: Clairyvell 3 years old, and Christian Dave 5 months old. 

Like other women, she has dreams of a good future for her family, and that dream pushed her to join ASHI because she believes that the institution could help her achieve those dreams.

In 2009, she decided to join ASHI and got a first loan amounting to Php. 5000.00, which she had successfully fully paid.

At present she is requesting Php 3,000.00.  This amount will be use as a capital to continue her business variety store. She is only proposing a small amount because according to her she still has a baby so she can’t give full attention to her business. But while she has to stay in their house, she wants to earn an income so that she could help support the needs of the family.

loans.use: Working capital for store

loans.name: Sophak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophak M. (shown in the photo), and her husband, Mr. Saroeun Um, have been married since 1984 and have three children: one son and two daughters. The son is a construction worker, one daughter is in university and another one attends grade 12. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penn, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sophak has been selling cooked porridge and Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok in her village since 2000. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia and can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber. Her husband is a motorcycle repairman.

Sophak is asking for her first loan of $700 to pay school fees for her daughter who is in university. She will use a part of her loan to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her daughters and to repair the kitchen where she cooks.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta O. is a 51-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: a sari-sari (general) store business. She lives in Brgy. Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 8000. 

Julieta is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Julieta aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 	

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Francisco Libert

texts.es:
Francisco Libert R. M. tiene 53 años de edad,union libre Vive con la compañera y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes  Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Lourdes Rosaura se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ampliar sus cultivos. 

Le gusta compartir con los amigos.
texts.en: Francisco Libert R. M. is 53. He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his partner and children in the Chillanes Canton, Bolivar province. He has 2 children. The V.R.C. Tres de Noviembre group has 28 members and is 90 minutes from the office, within the limits of the Chillanes Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; the sowing of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Lourdes Rosaura works in agriculture, sowing rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. He purchases his products in Mata de Cacao and sells in the Matilde Esther Market and in Bucay. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice, bananas, corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to expand his cultivation. He enjoys sharing with his friends.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Lynnie

texts.en:
Lynnie C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 45 years old. Lynnie is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling ready to wear clothing and used clothing (or ukay-ukay) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lynnie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Lynnie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stock of used clothing. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of used clothing

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité Nuevo Horizonte nació hace un par de años después de finalizar otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en la misma zona.
Desde el primer fin de semana de su conformación las integrantes están realizando actividades de tal forma a cancelar correctamente el crédito que obtuvieron. Están muy contentas ante la posibilidad de organizarse y progresar de manera comunitaria.
Las señoras que integran este comité se dedican a la venta de comidas en el barrio.
En promedio reciben cada una 1,000,000 Gs., el cual será invertido en la compra de artículos que posteriormente serán vendidos en sus respectivas actividades comerciales.
texts.en: The New Horizon group was started a couple of years ago after another group from the same area ended. Since the first weekend it was formed, its members have been working to pay off the loan they have obtained. They are very happy with their ability to organize and progress as a community. The ladies that make up the group sell food in their neighborhood. On average each member has received $1,000,000 Paraguayan guaranies (~$200 USD) which will be used to buy items that will be sold at their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, wine, beer, sugar, maté, noodles, rice, oil, bread, etc.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Josefina owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. Her main source of income comes from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, canned goods, junk food and toothpaste in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Josefina joined HSPFI in 2006 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods, junk food and beverages. This will be the eleventh loan taken out by Josefina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with her loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase inventory such as canned goods, junk food and beverages

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La Sra. Blanca  tiene como actividad la venta de pan en una zona populosa de nuestra ciudad, esta actividad que realiza es la fuente principal de ingresos para ella su familia, lleva muchos años trabajando de esta manera, es una persona muy dinámica y emprendedora  en esta oportunidad solicita crédito para la  compra un puesto de venta muy cerca de donde vende, de esta manera lograra mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, es un apersona trabajadora, su deseo de la Sra. Blanca es el de comprarse una casita y ahí poder vender pan al por mayor, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Blanca sells bread in a densely populated part of our city.  This activity is her family’s main source of income.  She’s been working this way for many years.  She is a very dynamic, enterprising person.

On this occasion she asked for a loan to buy a sales stand very near where she sells so that she can earn higher income for her family’s wellbeing.

She is a hard working person.  Blanca’s wish is to buy a little house and sell bread at wholesale there.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy a sales stand.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one school-age child. He has been working in grocery stores for 10 years; then he decided to open his own mini market in 2008. He sells different types of goods in addition to selling vegetables. With his business income, he is able to satisfy his family's needs. This will be his third Kiva loan. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new merchandise to increase his sales and therefore his income. He expects that his business will continue to grow in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M. is a widowed man and has five children aged between thirty-four and eighteen years old. He owns a grocery store in which he sells fruits and vegetables to the local people. His business is located at the busy Mkomani market in Mombasa. Mombasa is the coastal region in Kenya known for tourist attractions.

Julius has been in this business for eight years now. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more vegetables to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes that in future, he will grow his business and own a pick-up to better his business. He describes himself as a very faithful man.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Bataa

texts.en:
Bataa is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student, while her younger daughter is a pupil. She manages a food cafe in her town. 

She started her business in 2004 at a rented booth at a local secondary school. She prepares and provides both teachers' and students' meals at her food cafe. She employs two workers, the chief cook and the assistant cook. Her food cafe offers a variety of delicious sandwiches, salads, smoothies, coffee and more. Therefore, students are delighted to receive service at her cafe. 

She is a diligent woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. She says, "After my husband's death it was hard to feed and educate my children. But now we have learned to earn money, which fills our needs." 

Bataa is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT of loan to purchase vegetables, flour and some seasonings for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, flour and some seasonings

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is married to S. M. who has a business selling wheat and rice. He deals in bulk sales and earns a good profit from his business. He is the only earning person in his family. She is the mother of three children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Yasmeen takes care of them very well and tries to give them comfort by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a larger order to fill. Through the loan, he will buy wheat and rice in bulk quantity which enable him to fill the order on time and receive good profit. S. has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Yasmeen is confident that an investment will help him growing his business further. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. She belongs to a small city called Arifwala which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its dairy industry.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Yasmeen.

loans.use: To buy wheat & rice to fill a large order.

loans.name: Erickson

texts.en:
Erickson G. is married with three-school-aged children. Erickson is a duck raiser working in the Philippines and has been doing this work for almost eight years. 

Erickson is asking for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase feed and additional ducks for breeding. Erickson hopes this loan will increase his business operations. Currently, Erickson earns approximately PHP 4,000 each month in this field of work.

In the future, Erickson hopes to strengthen the business he manages and start another kind of business to provide for his children's educational needs  and give them a better future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ducks and feed

location.town: Mabasa, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Rashidah

texts.en:
Rashidah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Rashidah has a business of selling food, which she has had for three years.

To help expand her business, Rashidah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rashidah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Rashidah hopes to start a business of selling charcoal.  Rashidah is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business.

Gloria has been in this business for 15 years. Gloria earns more income from pig fattening.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and kitchen utensils for her restaurant business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four girls: three attend school while one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailor operators. She dreams of owning a retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase cloth materials and a machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and a machine

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice is 28 years old, married to a farmer,she has five children, four of whom are in school.she has been in this business of making local alcohol for three years she request a loan  through BRAC south sudan to expand her business. With the extra profits raised from her loan, Joice hopes to be able to pay her children school fees.

loans.use: to able her purchase more local alcohol for sale

loans.name: Ararat

texts.ru:
Арарат родился в 1955 г.и проживает в городе Капане. Он окончил среднюю школу села Шрвенанц, а после получил техническое образование по специальности радиоэлектротехник. Женат, имеет двух детей: сына и дочь. Дочка замужем и живет отдельно со своей семьей. Жена домохозяйка, сын работает вместе с отцом в автомастерской инкассации банка. Параллельно со своей работой, Арарат занимается частным бизнесом. 5 лет назад он открыл собственную автомастерскую, в которой работает по вечерам, после рабочего дня и по выходным. Имеет своих постоянных клиентов и на полученную прибыль содержит свою семью. 
Сумма кредита необходима Арарату для приобретения домкрата, что позволит увеличить количество клиентов и уровень их обслуживания.
texts.en: Ararat was born in 1955 in the city of Kapan.  He finished a secondary school in the Shrvenants village and then obtained a technical education in the radio elecrtician field.  He is married and has two children, a son and a daughter.  The daughter is married and lives separately with her family.  Ararat's wife is a homemaker, and their son works together with his father at an auto shop.  Parallel to his job, Ararat is involved in a private business.  He opened his own auto repair shop five years ago, where he works in the evenings, after his work day and on the weekends.  He has consistent customers and uses the profits to support his family.  Ararat needs a loan to purchase a hoisting jack in order to increase his customer base and the level of service.

loans.use: To buy hoisting jack for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 31 años, convive con Aidé. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Alexander, Lesly y July. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La siembra de café, plátanos y palta, son los principales sembríos de Wilmer, los cuales fertiliza, cuida y cultiva constantemente, en su hectárea de terreno agrícola. Ya tiene 11 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta a él, es poder solucionar los constantes problemas que se presentan en el periodo del sembrío, según recuerda que hace algún tiempo la maleza que crecía entre sus cultivos afectaron su crecimiento. Por ello, Wilmer, ya comenzó a hacer viveros de café, comenzando con 3 mil plantas; con ello piensa renovar sus plantaciones, y de esa manera tener plantas nuevas y fuertes posteriormente. Además de trabajar en sus tiempos libres en una hacienda agrícola, donde producen café y diferentes frutos oriundos de la zona, ahí espera obtener un dinero extra para su hogar. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza del palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde adquiere nuevas experiencias y nuevos éxitos con el trabajo conjunto que realizará en está nueva constitución de su banco comunal. Razón por la que se compromete en pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Wilmer de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para distribuirlos entre sus diferentes sembríos y así obtener buena producción.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 31, lives with Aidé.  They have three children together: Alexander, Lesly and July.  They live together as a family in their own house located in Unión Popular (Peruvian Central Jungle).  

Wilmer’s main activity is growing coffee, bananas and avocados which he fertilizes and cares for constantly on his one hectare of farmland.  He’s been in this line of work for 11 years now and what he most enjoys is solving the constant problems that crop up during the growing season.  As he recalls, weeds growing among his crops affected their growth.  Because of this, Wilmer has started to build coffee nurseries, starting with 3000 plants, that he plans to use to rejuvenate his plantations to have new, strong plants later on.  He also works in his free time on a large farming estate where coffee and various local fruits are produced; he expects to earn extra money for his household there.

He is a member of the “La Unión Hace la Fuerza” (Unity Makes Strength) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he’s getting new experiences and new successes working as a team that will take place in this new communal bank makeup.  Because of this, he pledges to make his installment payments in a punctual way.  

If Wilmer were to receive your support, he will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of natural fertilizer to spread among his various crops to thus obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Sur

texts.en: Sur, 54 years old, is a farmer who sells vegetables. Her income is $5 per day. She is a single mother with seven children, but only four live with her. Three of her children are working and earning $8 per day, and one more is studying. Every month, she has to spend $55 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $1,000 to buy a corn frying machine for her children. She has a plan to support her son to study Korean until he is able to work in Korea, because he could earn a better income there.

loans.use: To buy a corn frying machine for her children

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es: Josefa casada, su esposo artesano plástico, su hijo mayor de edad trabaja por cuenta propia, unas de su planes es la compra de una máquina de coser siendo un ingreso mas al hogar y también adquirir un motor de mayor capacidad para agilizar la producción. Nuestra clienta trabaja como artesana de plástico junto a su esposo, lo iniciaron hace tiempo atrás siendo su principal fuente de trabajo. Con el préstamo comprara materia prima como: plástico para elaborar taza de pocillos, platos, vasos, panas entre otros productos. Siendo vendido en los distintos mercados del país. Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefa is married. Her husband produces handmade plastics while her grown son is self-employed. One of her plans is to buy a sewing machine so that she can earn more household income. She also wants to acquire a motor with more horsepower to speed up production.

Josefa manufactures handmade plastics along with her husband. They started this business a long time ago as their main source of work. With this loan, Josefa will buy raw materials such as plastic for making cups and saucers, plates, glasses, wash bowls, and other products to sell in different markets throughout the country. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for their support so that she can develop her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making plastic goods.

loans.name: Clara Nelly

texts.es: Clara vive en Bogotá,  la linda capital de Colombia con sus dos hijos en las edades de 7 y 18 años. Allí se dedica a la ornamentación, metalúrgica y fabrica rejas, puertas, ventanas, portones barandas y en general trabajos de ornamentación, negocio en el cual lleva más de 3 años. Su mayor desafío ha sido el cambiarse de local  varias veces y continuar manejando una conexión e imagen  con su clientela. Poco a poco su negocio ha crecido y ha sido apoyado con financiamiento de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, desde el año 2005 cuando inició su experiencia de negocio con su antigua actividad de manualidades, con la cual se vinculó a esta organización. Su meta es tener un stock de productos terminados, para exhibirlos y darlos a conocer en el mercado, pero para lograr esta meta su capital de trabajo resulta insuficiente  y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para responder a trabajos de ornamentación que tiene encargados y con los cuales planea disminuir sus costos,  por la descuentos en compras de contado y en mayor volumen a sus proveedores y de allí resulta una exitosa inversión .
texts.en: Clara lives in Bogotá, Colombia’s beautiful capital, with her two children, 7 and 18 years old.  She works in ornamentation, metallurgy, and manufactures railings, doors, windows, banisters, and ornamentation, a business she has had for more than 3 years.  Her greatest challenge has been changing her location several times, while continuing to maintain contact and an image with her customer base.  Her business has grown slowly, and has enjoyed the financial support of the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, since 2005, when she began her business with her former crafts activities, with which she connected with that organization.  Her goal is to have a supply of finished goods, to exhibit and publicize them in the market.  But to achieve this goal, her working capital is inadequate, and this is precisely the reason for which she comes to credikiva, second financing made to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which she will buy raw materials and supplies to handle the ornamentation jobs commissioned, and with which she plans to decrease her costs, through discounts by paying in cash and buying larger volumes from her suppliers, and this will mean a successful investment.

loans.use: buy raw materials and supplies to handle ornamentation jobs.

loans.name: Johana Lourdes

texts.es: Johana,originaria de Esteli, agradece el apoyo recibido de Kiva  en su primera experiencia con el prestamo , ya que la ayudo en gran manera, mejoro sus ingresos. Ella esta solicitando este segundo prestamo pra invertirlo en su tienda de frutas para comprar variedad de frutas tropicales. Quiere hacer crecer su negocio hacerlo  mas amplio pero para ellos necesita poder surtirlo mas de inventario para vender , sacar adelante a su familia que es lo mas importante para ella.
texts.en: Johana is from Estelí.  She is grateful for the support she’s gotten from Kiva in her first loan which helped her quite a bit; she improved her income.  She is asking for this second loan to invest in her fruit stand and buy a variety of tropical fruit.  She wants to make her business grow but she needs to stock it with more inventory to sell in order to support her family which is what’s most important to her.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Bulimi Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bulimi Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Bramuel is the facilitator of the Bulimi Group. He takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bramuel had a very good maize yield harvesting fifteen bags on two acres of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on two acres of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bramuel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Bramuel intends to educate his children, ensure food security and pay the loan.
In 2012, the members of Bulimi Group will each plant between one and two acres of maize.
Bramuel is pictured with his group members in the photograph above; their Field Officer is on the right.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36-years-old, married with two children, two of whom are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Jane requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to allow her to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale

loans.name: Akhmed

texts.en:
Akhmed lives in the village Algeti, Kartli Region. He is 59 years old and lives with his 31 year-old son and 26 year-old daughter-in-law. Akhmed is leading the agricultural business of the family. His son is a worker in the village and daughter-in-law works as a teacher. 

The family owns 0.20 hectare of land, where potatoes are grown.  Also, they have a greenhouse of 500 sq. meters and grow tomatoes there. Akhmed sells harvested vegetables locally to the greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris (542 USD). 

Akhmed requested credit to purchase a milk cow. He will sell milk locally and increase the income of the family. The family will use increased income for purchasing additional household goods, to improve family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Emiliano Florenciano

texts.es:
El  Sr. Emiliano es electricista, está acompañado con la Sra. Mirtha. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo. Ambos tienen juntos cuatro hijos en edad escolar. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación. Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato y su excelente trabajo en el ramo. Nos cuenta que todo su trabajo es por darle a su familia lo mejor, ya que no quiere que sus hijos, tampoco su esposa pasen por privaciones. Por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas, como ser pinzas, buscapolos, cables, y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Emiliano is an electrician. He is married to Sra. Mirtha, who sells all types of food. They have four children who are of school age. With the help of his wife, Emiliano is able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication.

Today he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with many customers. He provides good service and performs excellent work in this field. Emiliano says that all of his work is aimed at providing his family the best because he does not want his wife and children to experience hardship. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy equipment such as pliers, screwdrivers, cables, and other items to that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy pliers, screwdrivers, cables, and other items.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past one year, she has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) for transport business; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of theft because of insecurity. She dreams of growing her business in the future.

With this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES), she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Nigor

texts.ru: Нигор житель города Вахдат. Возраст, 35 лет. Замужем, имеет пятерых детей. Образование – среднее. Она занимается торговлей. В этой области она семь лет. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Nigor is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  She is 35 years old, married and has five children.  She has a secondary education.  Nigor is involved in sales and has been in this business for seven years.  She is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to increase product turnover

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with 2 children and all go to school. Patience has no additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes door-to-door. She has been in this business for 2 years. She works seven days a week.  Patience has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used clothes and also to build her own house. 

Patience lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 32 years old.  She has three children between the ages of three and eight.  Two of them attend school.  She has spent eight years in the business of selling cooking oil, sugar, and salt.  With the loan she wants to buy more sugar, cooking oil and salt to sell.  She expects to use the profits from the business to renovate her house.  In the future, she would like to have a store in the town where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en:
Mostafa is a 20-year-old young man. He is single and has an internet café, which he established three years ago. It is his only source of income. 

Mostafa wants to purchase computer accessories to resell and wants to pay for maintenance for the current computers in the cafe to become more efficient. He needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN to add to the amount of money he already has. 

When Mostafa gets the loan, he will be able to pay for purchasing computer accessories, so he will have a better collection for sale. The customers’ requests for these accessories are high, and so he will be able to pay for the needed maintenance for the available computers which are used by customers in the café. This will make a positive difference in his internet café, increase his income, and allow him to have better life conditions. 

Mostafa is photographed in his internet café.

loans.use: to purchase computer accessories and pay for maintenance to his current computers.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.ru: Наталье 36 лет, разведена , воспитывает 10-летнюю дочку. В 2002 году, после тяжелого развода с супругом, Наталья поняла, что ей необходим дополнительный источник дохода для своей семьи, кроме работы реализатора в местном продуктовом магазине.  Вложив 20,000 сом (KGS) в качестве стартового капитала, Наталья начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. На сегодняшний день, ее хозяйство приносит около 8,000 сом от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего хозяйства, Наталья обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом  в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и корма. В дальнейшем Наталья мечтает развить большую ферму.
texts.en: Natalya is 36 years old, divorced, and bringing up a 10 year-old daughter. In 2002, after a difficult divorce from her spouse, Natalya realized that she needed an additional source of income for her family, aside from work as a seller at a local grocery store. Investing 20,000 som (KGS) as start-up capital, Natalya started her livestock breeding business. Currently, her business brings in approximately 8,000 som in sales of dairy and meat products. In order to further expand her business, Natalya has asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow and feed. In the future, Natalya hopes to establish a large farm.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and forage

loans.name: Huda

texts.en: Huda is a 32 year old married woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1000 JOD to buy materials to make home improvements. She will be repainting her home and retiling her kitchen. In the future she hopes that her family will be able to buy a home of their own. Huda prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en: One of a breadwinner in the family consisting of eight children, Khun is 50 years old and a villager from Battambang province.  She is a farmer who grows rice and cassava as the main business which she has involved for ages. Now, she is in lack of working capital to support her business. Therefore, she joins a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crops. she strongly believes that she can make more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for his crops

loans.name: Tuiyo -Gaa Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jepkogei. She is 30 years old, married and blessed with 5 children. She is a member of Tuiyo-Gaa Women Group which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.
She does poultry farming as her main activity. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds and add more chicks. This will enable her increase her sales hence more income. She will use the anticipated income to cater for household expenses such as food and clothing.
She is very grateful to Kiva for the help and support and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds and add more chicks that will increase her sales hence more income to cater for household expenses such a food and clothing.

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.en:
Translated English: Doña Alicia lives in Monclava Coahuila and has 3 older children. About 10 years ago she started this business. It began doing full dresses for lady and little by little it has been progressing to make any type of dresses, and even special trousers when ordered. Dona has to work becauser her husband is a worker in a struggling company. His wage does not allow him to cover with all the expenses of the family like dress, food and education. The work of Doña Alicia has allowed them to offer their children an education. Also she hopes. They need a loan of $375 USD to buy supplies like fabric, threads and other tools that use to produce their clothes. She and their family waits for your support and generosity. Apoyalos! SPANISH: Doña Alicia vive en Monclava Coahuila, tiene 3 hijos mayores y hace más de 10 años inició su propio negocio; comenzó haciendo vestidos de gala para dama y poco a poco se ha incorporado para hacer cualquier tipo de vestidos, pantalones o pedidos especiales. Su necesidad de trabajar fue el hecho que su esposo es un obrero en una empresa privada, sin embargo su salario no le permite cubrir con todos los gastos de la familia como vestido, comida y educación. El trabajo de Doña Alicia le ha permitido ofrecer hasta a ahora a sus hijos una educación, sin embargo ella espera también tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Ella requiere un préstamo de $375 USD para comprar insumos como lo es tela, hilos y otras herramientas que utiliza para producir su ropa. Ella y su familia esperan tu apoyo y generosidad. ¡Apoyalos!

loans.use: Purchase Raw Material

loans.name: Georgia

texts.en:
Georgia has been taking sandal-making courses for over 6 months with our organization. She has been one of the most outstanding students of the course, as she has been very dedicated to learning and improving her skills. She started her sandal-making business after three months in the course. Her daughters helped her out with some start-up capital so she could buy supplies and get her business going. She will use the loan to invest in more materials for sandal-making and also to buy a glass display case where she can offer her products to the public.

Georgia has been living in Guayaquil for about 11 years after leaving her home town of Esmeraldas. She left because she wanted to provide her children with better education and opportunities. Currently, one of her daughters is in college and the others are finishing their high school studies.

loans.use: Purchase materials and a display case

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shoes, trousers and tops

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has requested a loan to help further expand her growing grocery business located in the Ivano-Frankovsk region of western Ukraine. Tatyana’s business consists of three market-vending kiosks at one of the produce markets in Ivano-Frankovsk and a little store she recently opened in a village called Nadvirna, just outside Ivano-Frankovsk.

Tatyana is an experienced entrepreneur, having had her own business for about 13 years. Originally, she started out by selling socks and hats that she made herself and later decided to move into grocery sales. Tatyana’s business is not only one of the primary sources of income for Tatyana and her husband and family, but it also supports her parents, who are actively involved in helping with the business. Tatyana has been a great loan client with Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to many more opportunities to help her as she develops her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory for new store.

loans.name: Pa Dura

texts.en: Pa Dura S. is engaged in the buying and selling of chickens in the town market of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  At fifty years of age, Pa Dura has been running his business for the last eight years.  Pa Dura said that although his previous loan enabled him to increase his stock, his business could not expand because the profit went to paying school fees for his eight children and for repayment of his loan.  He hopes to be accorded another loan of US$ 200 to purchase fifty chickens. He thinks this time his profit will be invested back into the business, as he has completed paying his children’s school fees for the semester.

loans.use: Buying and selling of chickens for profit

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar is 27 years old and single. This young man lives in Khachmaz town. He is doing tile cladding on the walls of houses. You can see Bakhtiyar in his own garage, where he keeps all his instruments, in the picture. He has two years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of $600 to buy necessary materials for tile cladding.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for tile cladding

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 34 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo state of Nigeria. Esther earns her income selling onions and pepper, and has been in this business since 1997. She is asking for a loan of US$450 to buy more onions and pepper for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of onions and pepper

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 49 years old and lives with his family in the region of Lebanon known as Borj Barajneh.  Ali has four children, and supports himself and his family by working as a car mechanic. He has applied for a loan to buy supplies for his business, and hopes to use the income generated by these supplies to build a bedroom for his children. This is Ali's fourth loan from Al Majmoua, and are proud of how well he and his small business are doing.

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en: Taleh is single and lives in the town of Khachmaz. Four years ago Taleh started his business of  selling sweets.  He is requesting a loan of $475 to purchase additional inventory to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory of sweets

loans.name: Norkuzi

texts.en:
S. Norkuzi is 52 years old. He is married with four children. Norkuzi sells small cattle. His business is private and has been operating for 6 years. After purchasing the small cattle it's kept in Norkuzi's house. Currently he has 10 heads of small cattle for a turnover of $700. The business generates a stable income and helps improve the living conditions for the family.

Norkuzi is requesting $150 for the term of 9 months. Norkuzi will use the loan to purchase fodder for the small cattle. Norkuzi has had previous loans with IMON and has proved himself as an honest client. He thanks everyone that's supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy.

loans.use: Purchase fodder for the cattle

loans.name: Mary's Bombo North Group

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with 6 children. Mary owns a small grocery store, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma and Veronica, who sell cloth.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business

loans.name: Calixto

texts.es:
Mr. Calixto V. is a 52-year-old married man who lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of Managua. He and his wife live alone now that their two children are married adults who lead their own lives.

Mr. V. is a security guard who works very hard to support his wife. His greatest wish is to be able to finish construction of his house, which is why he is requesting this loan. He would like to purchase construction supplies and finish building his home little by little, just as he has been doing for many years.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Calixto tiene 52 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Laureles Sur de la ciudad de Managua, vive solo en su casa de habitación ya que sus dos hijos son mayores de edad, están casados y tienen una vida independiente a él.

Don Calixto es guarda de seguridad, trabaja muy duro para mantener a su esposa, su mayor sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, es por eso que solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construción y seguir levantando su vivienda poco a poco, a cómo lo ha venido haciendo desde hace muchos años atrás.

loans.use: Purchase construction supplies to finish building his house

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
The business of buying and selling cheese is the most important source of income for Margarita’s family. Since she established her homestead, Margarita decided to settle in the city of Juliaca. She purchases her merchandise in the district of Taraco and sells the goods at wholesale in the Túpac Amaru market in Juliaca. While she puts a lot of effort into this activity, her hard-working husband works as a foreman. Between the two activities, Margarita and her husband try to provide peace and well-being to their three beloved children. The couple would like to give their children the gift of an education. At this time, Margarita needs your support to increase the amount of her investment and, in this way, to increase her profits.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

El negocio de compra y venta de quesos se convirtió en el ingreso económico más importante de la familia de Doña Margarita quien desde que formó su hogar decidió radicar en la ciudad de Juliaca.Margarita adquiere su mercadería en el distrito de Taraco y los vende al por mayor y menor en el mercado Túpac Amaru de la ciudad de Juliaca, mientras ella pone su mayor esfuerzo en esta actividad su laborioso esposo trabaja como maestro de obras y entre los dos tratan de ofrecerles tranquilidad y bienestar a sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desean entregarles el regalo más grande, educación.En esta oportunidad doña Margarita requiere de tu apoyo, con el fin de acrecentar el monto de su inversión y de esa manera incrementar sus beneficios.

loans.use: To raise capital to offer more cheese

loans.name: Mualua

texts.en:
Mualua M., 28, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in the Taxi Service business. She serves the general public 7 days per week.

Maula has had no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Mualua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She will use the loan to buy tires and other car parts for her taxi.

Her husband also runs a business.

loans.use: The loan will be used to purchase tires and other car parts.

loans.name: Rolando De Jesús

texts.es:
Don Rolando is 59 years of age. He lives in the Ducuali neighborhood, is married, and has four children who are now independent. His wife is a homemaker.

Don Rolando is an electrical technician and also sells hardware in the Roberto Huembes market. He has forty years of experience in sales and started as a construction assistant. The requested loan is to improve his home, to build a hygenic bathroom and that way give him comfort and a more decent home for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Rolando tiene 59 años de edad, habita en el barrio Ducuali, es casado, tienen cuatro hijos que son ya independientes, su esposa es ama de casa.

Don Rolando es técnico electricista y también vende artículos ferreteros en el mercado Roberto Huembes, tiene cuarenta años de experiencia en las ventas e inició como ayudante de construcción. El préstamo solicitado es para mejorar su casa, construirá un servicio higiénico y así darle comodidad y una casa más digna a su familia.

loans.use: Construction of a Hygenic Bathroom

loans.name: Cesar Omar

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven preocupado en salir adelante, empezó su negocio cuando su padre se quedo desempleado y sobresalió poco a poco apoyando a su familia vendiendo dulces de tamarindo, y chamoy, inicio vendiendo en las casas y luego en las horas de descanso en la Escuela de la colonia.

El necesita un préstamo por US $350 que pagara en 3 meses para surtir dulces diferentes y ofrecerlos en escuelas primarias, con tu ayuda Cesar saldrá adelante.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man who is concerned with getting ahead. He began his business when his father became unemployed. He stood out bit by bit, supporting his family by selling tamarind sweets and chamoy (a conidiment of Mexican cuisine). He began by selling at people's homes and later at the neighborhood school during recesses.

He needs a loan of US $350.00, which he will repay in 3 months, to buy different sweets and offer them for sale in primary schools. With your help, he will get ahead.


Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Kumush

texts.en:
P. Kumush is 35 years old. She is married with an adorable son of school age. Tursunoy sells the fabrics for sewing national dresses. She has been in this business almost for five years. Tursunoy has very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has her constant customers. Moreover Kumush’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has the wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet. She has two trading places in different markets allowing her to keep the clientele and make a good income. The income that she derives allows her to educate her dearest son on high level. She hopes that she can continue to provide for him so he will be able to receive an adequate education. 

Kumush requests a loan of 3000 Somoni (900 USD) to purchase new fabrics and increase the range of goods she sells. Kumush promises to pay the loan in 4 months without any violation and expresses her gratitude to everyone supporting her. Your generosity can change her life.

loans.use: to purchase new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
MODOU N. EST UN MENUISIER EBENISTE DEPUIS 17 ANS.IL HABITE AU QUARTIER GRAND DIOURBEL.
AVEC LE PRET , IL COMPTE ACHETER DU MATERILE TEL QUE LE BOIS, POUR LA CONFECTION DE MEUMBLES.
texts.en:
MODOU N. has been a cabinet-maker specializing in ebony for seventeen years. He lives in the GRAND DIOURBEL district. With this loan, he intends to buy some material, such as wood, for making furniture.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma is a member of the "Generosidad" (Generosity) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and married with five children. Guillerma sells prepared meals in Ayacucho’s Abastos Market. She starts cooking at 3:00 each morning and then sells her meals until midday. Her daughters help her with the business.

Guillerma needs a loan of 800 soles to buy sacks of rice, oil, and pasta. Guillerma’s dreams are that she will be able to work very hard so that her children have everything they need and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Guillerma es socia del Banco Comunal Generosidad. Guillerma es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Guillerma vende comida en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Guillerma comienza a cocinar a las 3 de la mañana y luego vende hasta el mediodía, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de sus hijas.

Guillerma necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, fideos por sacos. Los sueños Guillermina son trabajar mucho para que sus hijos tengan todo lo necesario y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy sacks of rice, oil and pasta

loans.name: Mr. Cheang Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Seventeen people who live in Ra Village in Kampong Chhnang Province comprise this village bank loan led by Mr. Cheang H., the 47-year-old village bank president and father of seven children, two of whom are construction workers while the others are students in the local school. Cheang is a construction worker and his wife, Mrs. Hum Mean, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates rice and breeds pigs.

Hum wishes to expand the latter business as it is going especially well, so Cheang is requesting a loan to buy more piglets for her. This should result in increased family income and therefore a better life for the family.

This is a group loan consisting mainly of end-of-term loans. Six members have monthly payment loans while 11 have end-of-term loan and. These latter members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans, AMK’s main product, are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for his wife's business.

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: S. Emilienne est une timide, contente femme de 32 ans. Elle s’est mariée avec HOUSSOU-MIMI Dominique, et ils ont trois enfants ensemble, tous scolarisés. Mme S. a fini le lycée. Elle est informaticienne de formation et en 2004 elle a ouvert sa propre boutique pour vendre les ordinateurs et tous les objets du bureau ; elle faire aussi les photocopies. Elle s’approvisionne au Négoce Afrique. Actuellement, elle est enceinte, et pour cette raison elle va utiliser ce prêt pour vendre les cartes de recharge qui sont plus facile de vendre que les objets du bureau. Apres l’accouchement de son bébé, elle va reprendre la vente des ordinateurs.
texts.en:
Emilienne S. is a shy, happy 32-year-old woman. She is married to Dominique Houssou-Mimi, and they have three children together, all of whom go to school. Mrs. S. completed high school. She is a trained computer specialist, and in 2004, she opened her own shop to sell computers and everything office-related, including photocopies. She stocks up at Négoce Afrique. She is currently pregnant, and for this reason, she is going to use this loan to sell phone cards, which are easier to sell than office supplies. After the birth of her baby, she will return to selling computers.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone cards

loans.name: Gliceria

texts.es:
Gliceria es socia del Banco Comunal Estrella.
Gliceria es casada, tiene 45 años y 10 hijos, Gliceria es feriante, viaja a diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gliceria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y frutas.
Los sueños de Gliceria son mejorar su negocio, techar su casa con material noble y comprar en mas cantidad.
texts.en:
Gliceria is a partner with Banco Comunal Estrella (Star Community Bank). She is 45 years old, married, and has 10 children. Gliceria is a market seller; she travels to different markets in the region where she sells fruits and at the markets she buys cereals that she sells in the markets of Ayacucho city. Gliceria needs a loan of 1000 soles ($325) that she will invest in the purchase of wheat and fruit. Gliceria's dreams are to improve her business, roof her house with a strong material, and purchase in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of wheat and fruit

loans.name: Masuda

texts.en:
Masuda K. is an enterprising woman with a big desire to improve the quality of life for her family. She is married and the mother of three children. Masuda has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office. With a lot of effort, she has been able to open her own shop in her home. Her shop has been successful because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. She constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Today Masuda is applying for a loan through IMON International for the first time. She is requesting a loan of $1200 USD with a term of 12 months so she can purchase materials to sew pillowcases and bed-clothes. You can help improve the quality of life for Masuda’s family.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road, the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, its culture is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.
However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and its manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing necessary materials for sewing pillowcase and bed-clothes

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
GRACIELA CHÁVEZ D. GARCÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres D. Éxito” con domicilio en la Av. Bellavista N° 594 del distrito D. Calería, tiene 41 años, 02 hijos, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo independiente.

Con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles,  compró un poco D. cosméticos y los empezó a distribuir entre sus amigas y conocidas, encontrando una actividad rentable. Más adelante  se dedicó a compra D. productos alimenticios, como leche, conservas, mermeladas y otros.
Ella, hoy comercializa todo lo que está a su alcance, cualquier oportunidad D. negocio es rápidamente tomada, así el préstamo D. S/.1,500. Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en compra D. un surtido D. cosméticos que ya tiene pedido, yogurt, y conservas, también comprara un poco D. telas que están D. oferta en Lima.
Comenta: “Manuela Ramos da ayuda a las mujeres que quieren progresar pero se debe tener cuidado con no excederse en el monto a trabajar”.
texts.en:
Graciela Chávez D. García belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres D. Éxito" ("Successful Women"), located at Avenida Bellavista No. 594 in the district of Calería. She is 41 years old, has two children, and her husband has his own work. With her first loan for S/.300, she bought a few cosmetics and sold them to her friends and acquaintances, which was a profitable activity. Later she bought foods such as milk, canned goods, jams, and other things. Today she sells anything that is available. Any kind of business opportunity is quickly taken. She will use this S/.1,500 loan to buy an assortment of cosmetics that have already been ordered, yogurt, and canned goods. She will also buy some fabric that is available in Lima. She says: "Manuela Ramos* helps women who want to make progress, but you have to be careful not to take on more work than you can handle." *Manuela Ramos is the name of an organization that offers microfinancing in Peru.
