Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase assorted cosmetics. Purchase yogurt and canned goods. Purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is a widow with two children. She owns a kiosk at one of the markets in the city of Zaporozhye, from which she sells women's shoes. Tatyana has been in this business for ten years, and the main key to her success is offering a good assortment of shoes. Flexible discount policy also helps Tatyana to retain repeat customers. This business is the only source of income for her family.

Tatyana would like to borrow 10 900 UAH to purchase a spring collection of shoes. Additional income would help her to raise her two children and better provide for their needs.

loans.use: To increase the variety of shoes she sells

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandra L. is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 9 and 11 months. Her husband is a driver/mechanic. The compensation of her husband is not enough, especially as the children grow older.

Recently, she applied for a PHP 6,000 loan for additional working capital for her palay/rice trading business. She relates that a friend told her about Paglaum MPC giving financial assistance to those who need it. She became a member and applied for a loan for additional funds. As of now, she helps in one way or another in the augmentation of their household income. Hard work, patience and determination are the only things they have, believing then that they can send their children to college to finish a degree and have a decent life in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for palay trading

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida C. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Leonida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Leonida also has been engaged in raising pigs. 

Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP (US$225), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Luduvina Z. is a 59-year-old woman from the beautiful city of Antipolo, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is widowed and doesn’t have a child. She is living on her own. But despite the situation, she has not lost determination and the industry to strive for a better living.
Life was not easy for Luduvina after losing her husband. She decided to join ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.) an MFI in the Phillipines to have access to capital for her planned business. From the start of being a member, she tried her luck in putting up a General store where her neighbors can buy the basic needs.
Now on her 3rd loan, she is requesting a loan amounting to 15,000 to be used to pay for soft drinks, additional stocks, and she proposes to buy a second-hand refrigerator.
Luduvina is hopeful that her general store will grow into a mini-mart someday. She also plans to renovate a portion of her house someday if she has enough savings.

loans.use: Additional Capital for General Store and to purchase second hand refrigerator.

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Sonia del Carmen S. tiene la edad de 51 años, Es una mujer casada. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y estudian. La actividad económica de Sonia es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería en general, pero debido a la situación económica que enfrentaba era muy difícil visitar a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo mantener a sus hijos, por lo que empezó a dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para capital de trabajo para la compra de pinturas de labios, pinturas de uña entre otras coas. El deseo de Sonia es de mejorar el servicio brindado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia del Carmen S. is 51 years old. She is married, and has 2 children who are in school. Sonia's business is the sale of cosmetics. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. Before, she was involved in the sale of general merchandise, but due to the economic situation she faced, it became very difficult to visit her customers and also take care of her children. Therefore, she began to dedicate herself to the sale of cosmetics. This loan request is for working capital for the purchase of lipstick, nail polish and other items. Sonia's desire is to improve the service she provides for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es: La señora Gloria Maria, tiene la edad de 55 años, reside en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo en la capital de Managua,  su esposo se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, sus hijos son mayores de edad, doña Gloria trabaja como cocinera en un centro de estudio, lleva elaborando dos años elaborando los ricos platillo. Su meta es poder tener su propia cominería, con este préstamo es su cuarto ciclo en Afodenic el cual comprar materiales de construcción para  terminar de construir el porche para poder estar en mejores condiciones y respirar aire fresco. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios alcanzado para su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Maria is 55 years old and resides in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. Her husband works as a security guard and her children are adults. Doña Gloria is a chef at a student center, where she has worked for the past 2 years making hearty dishes. Her goal is to open her own eatery.

This is her fourth loan cycle with AFODENIC. She will buy materials to finish construction of a porch to improve the condition of her house and allow her family to breathe fresh air. Doña Gloria thanks the institution for the benefits that help her family succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos Mauricio R. reside en Cojutepeque del departamento de Cuscatlán, tiene  49 años de edad, vive con esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Carlos se dedica a su negocio una joyería y relojería la cual se encuentra ubicada en su casa donde lleva ya más de la mitad de su vida desempeñando dicho trabajo, son ya 35 años de experiencia que lo acompañan con los ha logrado  sacar adelante a toda su familia. Ahora Carlos solicita un crédito para surtir su inventario en joyería.
texts.en:
Carlos Mauricio R. live in Cojutepeque in the Cuscatlán department. He is 49, and he lives with his wife and four children. Carlos has a jewelry and watch business, which is located in his house. He has spent half of his life doing this work. He has 35 years of experience, which have helped him get his family ahead. Carlos now is asking for a loan to stock his jewelry inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Jewelry stock

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 41 years old and married with four children.  She resides in Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells frozen food (chicken, turkey and fish).  She has been in this business for the past five years. She has been engaged with LAPO microfinance for the past three years. Iyabo is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more frozen food and expand her shop to meet her customers demands. She thanks Kiva lenders and LAPO microfinance for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more frozen food to sell

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en: Aleksandr was born in 1969. He is married, has 2 children and lives in Baku city. 20 years ago he started building houses. Now  he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy the necessary materials for building houses for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy the necessary materials for building houses

loans.name: Lorenza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lorenza del Socorro L. se dedica a vender refrescos naturals elaborados por ella misma y también se dedica a vender gaseosas, jugos y agua en su establecimiento en el departamento de León donde atiende a sus clientes.

La razón primordial por la que ella ha acudido  a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bebidas y para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los refrescos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que requiere de dicha inversión.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar bebidas

loans.name: Julio Manuel

texts.pt:
Júlio G. é natural de Muecate na Província de Nampula ao Norte de Moçambique, tem 29 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 5 e 3 anos de idade. Para alem destes vive também com 2 sobrinhos em sua casa. Fez 4ª classe apenas. Não foi possível continuar devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos seus progenitores. 

Sai de Nampula com 19 anos, juntamente com os seus pais, devido transferência dos mesmos. Em Nampula fazia uma actividade comercial e chagado ao distrito de boane, preferiu continuar com o seu negócio que aprendera na terra natal quando tinha 12 anos de idade.

Actualmente trabalha sozinho, o seu produto favorito são chinelos onde usa 2.500.00mt na compra de 1 saco de 24 dúzias e vende a 75.00mt o par. Sapatilhas compra a 2.500.00mt a caixa de 50 pares e vende a 60 o par. Faz vendas diárias de 2.500.00mt por dia e ainda consegue poupar 350.00mt dia no Banco Barclays.      

Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.000.00 com qual pretende aumentar o volume da sua mercadoria (comprando mais caixas de chinelos e sapatilhas).
Nunca teve crédito em outras instituições. Conheceu esta instituição no mercado onde vende através de amigos e propõe se apagar sem problemas para poder aceder a mais créditos com intuito de comprar uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
texts.en:
Júlio G. is a native of Muecate in the province of Nampula in the northern part of Mozambique. He is 29; is married; and is the father of two children, who are 5 and 3. Additionally, two nephews or nieces live in his house. He only studied through fourth grade. It wasn't possible to continue studying because his parents lacked financial resources.

He left Nampula when he was 19 with his parents because they were transferred. In Nampula, he sold things, and when he arrived in the district of Boane, he prefered to continue with the business that he learned in his home town when he was 12.

Currently he works alone. His favorite products are flip flops. He uses 2,500 meticais to buy one bag of 24 dozen, and he sells them for 75 meticais a pair. He buys slippers for 2,500 meticais for a box of 50 pairs and sells then for 60 meticais a pair. He makes daily sales of 2,500 meticais and he still manages to save 350 meticais a day in the Barclays bank.

This is his first loan with Hluvuku, and it is for 11,000 meticais. He will use it to increase his merchandise (he will buy more boxes of flip flops and slippers).

He has never had a credit with another institution. He found out about this institution through friends in the market where he sells. He promises to repay the loan without any problems so he will be able to receive more credits, which he will use to buy a vehicle for personal use.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell slippers and flip flops

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo S. is from the village of Biasong. He is 41 years old. Romeo is widowed and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Romeo owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Romeo has had his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Romeo joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Romeo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Romeo is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which he plans to use to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Romeo from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the fishing business

loans.name: Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Roca Fuerte esta integrado por tres personas, dos de llas tienen su puesto de abarrotes en el mercado Los Pinos de la calle 25 y la otra integrante tiene su tienda en la calle 23 de Calacoto, ellas son clientes desde el año 2005, se encuentran en su 16ava secuencia, la Señora Josefina  vende abarrotes y cereales remojados, ella tiene una hija joven que trabaja, y la Sra. Josefina es quien cuida de su nieta, la otra integrante Maria Elena  vende abarrotes en el mismo mercado, ella tiene dos hijos pequeños que van a la ecuela, el esposo generalmente se encuentra de viaje, y finalmente la otra integrante, la Sra. Magaly  tiene el negocio de la tienda ella tiene un  hijo joven , el esposo es profesor y viaja a provincia, todas ellas se conocen y se colaboran, es un  grupo muy bonito y puntual.
texts.en:
The supportive group Roca Fuerte (Strong Rock) is made up of three people, Two have grocery stands in the Los Pinos market on Calle 25, while the last member has her store on Calle 23 in Calacoto. They have all been clients since 2005, and are in their 16th loan cycle. Mrs. Josefina sells groceries and soaked cereals. She has a young daughter that also works, so Josefina takes care of her granddaughter. María Elena sells groceries in the same market as Josefina. She has two young children who go to elementary school, and her husband usually travels a lot. Finally, the last member is Mrs. Magaly, who owns the store. She has a young child, and her husband is a professor who travels around the province. The three women all know each other and collaborate together. They work well together and are always punctual.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise/groceries for resale.

loans.name: Dopé Aimée

texts.fr: Marié et mère de 04 enfants, cette dame exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de trousseau bébé, thermos, biberons et autres choses de bébé. Elle dresse son étalage de marchandises dans le marché local de hedzranawoé. Voulant agrandir son stock, elle  sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 25 trousseaux bébés, 10 thermos et une vingtaine de biberons.
texts.en:
Married with four children, this lady runs a business retailing babies' clothing, thermos flasks, babies' bottles, and other baby items. She sets up her display of merchandise at the local market in Hedzranawoé. Wanting to increase her stock, she is seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 25 babies' outfits, 10 thermos flasks, and twenty babies' bottles.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy babies' clothing, thermos flasks, and babies' bottles

loans.name: Jeramie

texts.en:
At 27 years old, Jeramie is blissfully married to Jay-ar, 29 years old, taho vendor, and they live happily with her two children, Justine and Jaymie, elementary grade school students. Jeramie lives in the mountainous province of Antipolo, Rizal, Philippines, where there is a lot of opportunity to start up a business and to look forward to making a living. 

Jeramie is an underprivileged woman who aspires to rise out of poverty. She totally decided to join ASHI, an MFI and KIVA field partner, to access more capital for the growth of her business. She has been engaged in TAHO vending (“taho” means a kind of food made of soya, ready to eat) for almost two years. She plans to use her proposed loan of 20,000.00 pesos to expand her business and to get involved in selling frozen foods and beauty products at the market in order to earn a good income.

Jeramie desires a joyful life and a good income so her children can finish their studies until college. To realize all of these aspirations and hopes, she is "knocking your good heart" to support her simple dreams by means of supporting her loans.

loans.use: to purchase taho ingredients, frozen foods and beauty products

loans.name: Consuelo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Consuelo está integrado por Consuelo del Carmen F., Judith Elena Muñoz y Bruñilda del Carmen C. tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que han trabajado arduamente toda su vida y aun siguen aquí luchando por sus familias.

En 1981 la señora Consuelo del Carmen F. empezó a vender productos de la Avon  y la Zermat para cooperar en los gastos del hogar y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Ella en sus comienzos vendía pocos productos por encargo luego con años se hizo de clientela empezó a destruir por mayor.  

Esta señora viuda a segura que el trabajar le izo superar la muerte de su esposo y a tener una mejor autoestima.  Además que ahora que está sola porque sus hijos ya tienen sus hogares esto le sirve de distracción y de sustento.

Las otras integrantes son Judith Elena Muñoz quien vende ropa y zapatos  de todos los estilos de manera ambulante y Bruñilda del Carmen C. tiene una tortillería y vende frijoles cocidos alimentos de la dieta nicaragüense.
texts.en:
The "Consuelo" group is formed by Consuelo del Carmen F., Judith Elena Muñoz & Bruñilda del Carmen C., three hard-working, enterprising women who have worked strenuously all their lives & who, despite this, continue to struggle for their families.

In 1981, Ms. Consuelo del Carmen F. began to sell Avon & Zermat products to collaborate with the household costs & to offer her children a better future. At the beginning, she sold just a few products on an individual order basis. Over time, she developed a client base & began to distribute wholesale.

A widow, she is sure that by working by was able to overcome her husband's death & to attain higher self-esteem. Moreover, now that she is alone (since her children their own homes, this helps her keep busy & support herself.

The other members are Judith Elena Muñoz, who sells on the street clothing & shoes of all styles & Bruñilda del Carmen C., who has a tortilla shop & sells cooked beans & other stapes of the Nicaraguan diet.


Translated from Spanish by Joseph Mulligan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, such as lipstick, maybelline, eye-liner, rouge... etc.

loans.name: Daysi

texts.es: Daysi tiene 25 años y vive con su esposo Gilmer de 28 años, con quien tiene 2  hijos;  Angie de 10 y Cristopher de 1 año; todos viven en una casa alquilada. Desde hace 8 años su labor empieza desde muy temprano,ya que se dedica a sembrar arveja, papa (tubérculo peruano), maíz y flor de gladiolos, junto a su esposo, paralelamente elabora panes los que comercializa desde las 6 de la mañana en su pueblo; le gusta más hacer los panes porque le agrada probar sus bocadillos; para esta pareja ambas actividades les resultan bastante rentables, pues explican que la panadería les deja ingresos económicos diarios, mientras que la agricultura es por temporadas  pero les permite comprar algunas cosas de primera necesidad, para más adelante tiene  pensado aperturar una panadería en la ciudad, además de ampliar su pequeña tienda de comestibles  ubicada en su casa , también desea comprar más terrenos, sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este es el noveno préstamo que tiene con MFP, además esta muy contenta con el trabajo en su banco comunal porque aprende bastante  y comparte sus experiencias en cuestiones de ahorro e inversión con los demás integrantes. Con el dinero del préstamo, comprará varias bolsas de semilla de arveja, sacos de fertilizantes y botellas de insecticidas, para cuidar adecuadamente sus tierras; además invertirá en los insumos para elaborar panes, y en la compra de mercadería para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Daysi is 25 years old and lives with her husband Gilmer who is 28 years old. They both have 2 children; Angie who is ten and Cristopher who is 1. They all live in a house where they pay rent. For eight years her work begins very early, since she plants Peruvian potatoes, corn, and gladiolus flowers with her husband. Similarly she makes breads that she sells from 6 in the morning in her town. She prefers to make breads because she enjoys tasting her pastries. For this couple both activities bring in much profit. They explain that the bakery gives them a daily income while agriculture being seasonal permits them to purchase basic necessities. For the future she plans to open a bakery in the city as well as extend her small food store in her home. She also plans on buying more land and plant greater quantities. This is the ninth loan that she has with MFP. Furthermore, she is very happy with the work being done in her communal bank because she learns quite a lot and shares her experiences about savings and investment issues with the rest of the members. With the loan she will buy many bags of pea seeds, sacs of fertilizer, and bottles of insecticide so she can properly tend her land. Furthermore, she will invest in materials to make pastries and in the purchase of merchandise for her food store.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, merchandise, and ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia C., 44 years old, is a fish vendor. She owns a boat, which her husband uses to catch fish. She is childless. Aside from fish, she wants to have another line of business. She wants to augment her family's economic situation. She wants to re-apply for a loan of PHP 12,000 at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy fishing materials and fish to resell.

loans.use: To obtain more fish to resell

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel C. R. tiene 39 años y vive en el barrio Kenedy al sur de Bogotá. Está casado y tiene un hijo de 15 años que estudia su bachillerato y está décimo grado. Tiene una tienda en su propia casa donde vende víveres, abarrotes y bebidas; lleva dos años con este  negocio, que nació porque en el sector  no había otras  tiendas, por eso  lo inició con sus propios recursos. 
Este es su segundo crédito con la Fundación y utilizó el primero para ampliar más el negocio y colocarle sillas y mesas para que sus clientes puedan descansar mientras están donde él. Y ha tenido éxito: ahora puede contar con más clientes. Es más, su tienda se encuentra en una ubicación muy apropiada, queda frente a un parque, donde se realizan torneos de fútbol los fines de semana, lo que hace que las ventas se incrementen. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $1.700.000 para comprar una rocola que servirá para atraer a sus clientes,pues ellos pueden sentarse en su tienda a disfrutar en familia de la musica y bebeidas especialmente cuando hay partidos de fútbol los fines de semana. Más adelante, sueña con ampliar su negocio y con surtirlo más. Es una fuente importante de recursos para la familia y quiere que crezca.
texts.en:
Gabriel C. R. , age 39, lives in the Kenedy neighborhood in the south of Bogotá. He is married and has a 15 year old son who is studying for his high school diploma and is in the tenth grade.

He has a shop in his house where he sells food, groceries, and drinks. He has been in this business for two years. He started in because there were no other shops in his area. That’s why he began it with his own resources.

This is his second loan with Fundación. He used his first to enlarge his business and put out chairs and tables so that his customers can rest while they are there.

He has had success. Now, he can count on more customers. In addition, his shop is in a very good location. It is located in front of a park where there are soccer games on weekends. These make his sales increase.

Currently he is applying for a 1700 peso loan in order to buy a jukebox that will be used to attract customers. Then they will be able to sit in his shop and enjoy music and special drinks with their families when there are soccer games on the weekends. For the future, he dreams of expanding his business and increasing his inventory. The business is an important source of income for his family and he wants it to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a jukebox that will be used to attract the attention of customers who will be able to enjoy the music with their families while relaxing in his shop.

loans.name: Archie

texts.en:
Archie N., 29, is from Labo, Ozamiz City. Archie is married and has no dependents. He owns and operates an internet café with 7 computers. Archie established his business over a year ago and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. 

Recently Archie joined PMPC to access financial services and to help improve his living conditions. Archie is applying for a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to upgrade his computer system. He wishes to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to upgrade his internet computer system

loans.name: Fuerza Y Union Hacia El Futuro Group

texts.es:
LIZET, ES UNA JOVEN D. 22 AÑOS D. EDAD, TIENE UNA PEQUEÑA HIJA D. UN AÑO NUEVE MESES, QUIEN ES L. RAZON D. TODO ESFUERZO Y SACRIFICIO EN SU VIDA. HACE TRES AÑOS INTEGRA EL GRUPO "FUERZA Y UNION HACIA EL FUTURO", JUNTO CON 10 PERSONAS MAS QUE L. ELIGIERON COMO PRESIDENTA D. SU GRUPO. ELLAS RESIDEN POR L. ZONA DEL PARRAL, EN EL DISTRITO D. COMAS
NOS CUENTA QUE CUANDO INICIÓ EN EL GRUPO ELL. VENDÍA COMIDA A SUS VECINOS, CON LOS PRESTAMOS OBTENIDOS FUÉ AMPLIANDO SU NEGOCIO Y EMPEZÓ A OFRECER MENÚ, LUEGO D. CASARSE SU ESPOSO L. AYUDÓ PARA IMPLMENTAR UN ESPACIO D. SU CASA Y AHORA  VEND. SOLO POR LAS NOCHES ANTICUCHOS, PANCHOS, POLLO A L. PARRILL., ETC.
CON SU TRABAJO HA LOGRADO EQUIPAR SU CASA, COMPRÓ SUS ARTEFACTOS DOMÉSTICOS, HIZO CRECER SU NEGOCIO Y SOBRE TODO PUDO APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CUANDO SE QUEDÓ SIN TRABAJO.
SU PRÓXIMA META ES JUNTAR PARA COMPRAR UNA PARRILL. MAS GRAND., COLOCAR TOLDO AL ESPACIO DOND. TRABAJA Y HACER EL PISO.
EL PRESTAMO SOLICITADO LO INVERTIRÁ EN L. COMPRA D. INSUMOS PARA L. PREPARACIÓN D. SANGUCHES Y APROVECHAR L. VENTA EN LOS COLEGIOS POR EL INICIO D. CLASES.
texts.en:
Lizet is a 22 year old young woman. She has a small daughter who is one year and nine months old. Her daughter is the reason for all of the efforts and sacrifices in her life. Three years ago she joined the Fuerza y Union Hacia el Futuro group. She joined ten other people, and they elected her as president of the group. They resiD. in the Parral area in the Comas district. She tells us that when she started in the group she sold food to her neighbors. With the loans that she got she expanded her business and started to offer fixed menu meals. She later married her husband, and he helped her set up a space in her house. Now she sells only at night. She sells kebobs, hot dogs, and grilled chicken, etc. With her work she has been able to furnish her house. She bought some household items, and she maD. her business grow. Above all, she was able to support her husband when he was left without work. Her next goal is to get together enough to buy a larger grill, arrange everything in her workspace, and put down the floor. The loan she is requesting is to buy supplies for making her sandwiches to take advantage of the school sales for the start of classes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for her sandwich sales

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza S. is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Central Lopez, Sagay City. She is married and has one school-age child. To make a living, Liza owns and operates a restaurant serving local foods to customers in her community. Liza has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2003, Liza joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Liza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from NWTF. Liza is now requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF. Liza plans to use the additional revenue to make improvements to her house. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Virginia's Group

texts.en:
Virginia A. is from the village of Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Virginia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. 

Virginia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies, in the local community. Virginia has been engaged in her business for 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,500 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Virginia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Grupo Tzanjuyup Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de señoras,  del paraje Tzanjuyup, del departamento de  Totonicapán, son personas de escasos recursos economicos, pero no se debe de descartar que son trabajadoras, cuentan con un promedio de 3 hijos cada una de ellas, actualmente estan solicitando su segundo prestamo en la Asociacón ASDIR, en su primer prestammo lo utilizaron para la compra de Cerdos, Ganado vacuno, gallinas de engorde y ponedoras, el cual incrementaron  
sus animales, y de esa manera lograron venderlos en un trimestre del año, obteniendo ganacias sobre las ventas y por supuesto ellas lograron ahorrar en dicha organizacion, y por tal razón piensan de nuevamente aumentar sus compras de animales para poder criarlos y engordarlos, y con este prestamo se considera que mejorará sus condiciones de vida, ya que con las ganancias que obtienen podrán aportar un pequeño gasto familiar, con el esposo de cada una de ellas.
texts.en:
The women in this group from Tzanjuyup, Aldea Chivarreto, San Fracisco el Alto, Totonicapán department, know each other very well. They have worked together for the past eight years. They are organized in the following way: Juana Guzmán M. is the president. These five people work in selling packs (?), cosmetics, shoes, plastics, making backpacks and selling traditional clothing. Their stalls are in San Francisco el Alto, Totonicapán. The woman who sells traditional clothing sells from her house. Those who raise animals sell them in San Francisco el Alto. The woman who sells candy sells at the school in Tzanjuyup. They all need to increase their working capital. For this reason they approached the Asosiación ASDIR offices in Pologúa.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mrs. Mom T., 43 years old, lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Chum, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Mom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her farming. Mr. Thy Chum is also a fisherman. This couple has six children; one is a laborer while the other five are students who also support their parents with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza (Grupo 4) Group

texts.en:
Ysera is the coordinator of her group, La Nueva Esperanza (The New Hope), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Hato Mayor, an agricultural area in the east of the country, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here as a single mother, in a simple house, with her four children.

Ysera is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her clothing business and to buy new and used clothing for sale. She will use the profits to make improvements to her house and buy school supplies for her children. She hopes for the success of her business and the well-being of her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy used and new clothes.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic C. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Marivic is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marivic owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Marivic is just starting this business.

In 10,000, Marivic joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Marivic is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services. This loan will be Marivic's sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services.

loans.name: Jacinta Cleopatra

texts.es:
Jacinta de 37 años, vive en la perimetral de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y el estero que conecta al río, a unas cuantas cuadras). Ella tiene una papelería “bazar”, le ha ayudado para poder mantener su casa.

Comenzó vendiendo ropa pero como no tenia suficientes ingresos decidió invertir en papelería para un nuevo negocio, poco a poco con esfuerzo y la ayuda de su esposo pudo readecuar su casa y convertir la parte delantera en una papelería. Trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta el anochecer.    

Para seguir ganando dinero y mantener a sus dos hijos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos y papelería para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 37, lives along Guayaquil’s Perimetral highway (the outlying area of the city, with dirt roads and a stream that connects to the river a few minutes away). She has a stationary store which has helped her maintain her home. She began selling clothes but since she didn’t earn enough income she decided to invest in stationary for a new business. Little by little, with effort and help from her husband, she was able to readjust her home, turning the front of it into a stationary store. She works from 8:00 AM until dusk. In order to continue earning money and taking care of her two children, Jacinta wants to buy notebooks and stationery with the loan for her business. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Notebooks, Stationery

loans.name: Kikoma Women's, Mubende Group

texts.en:
S. Slyvia, a trained midwife, has been providing medical services to her clients at her clinic located in Mubende town, which she set up after retiring from her government job. Here in Uganda one of the common medical problems faced is that there are very few facilities to cater to the sick, and thus very many people here die while giving birth and many more suffer from malaria due to inadequate medical care services. This is where people like Slyvia come in. Her main problem is that she does not have enough quantity and variety of drugs in her drug shop, which is a hindrance to her career and business.

With this loan, Slyvia plans to construct a house extension to accommodate her patients, and to restock drugs in the clinic. This will see her earn more revenue and live a self-sustaining life.

loans.use: purchase of drugs to stock the clinic

loans.name: Donato

texts.es:
Donato nació en la ciudad de Abancay y actualmente vive en la ciudad del Cusco junto con su esposa Doris y sus dos hijos.  Al cumplir 16 años, Donato ingreso al instituto superior “SENATI” (Servicio Nacional de Adiestramiento al Desarrollo en Tecnológico Industrial) en la ciudad de Abancay y aprendió el oficio de la carpintería y ebanistería. Hace varios años atrás, Donato ejerce su profesión en su ciudad natal, pero como existe mucha competencia decidió buscar otro lugar donde pueda trabajar.
 
Decidido a empezar una nueva vida, Donato se mudo a Cusco, Perú,  donde tenía parientes lejanos. Utilizo sus ahorros para alquilar un terreno, donde ahí pueda elaborar muebles de madera. Le pueden encontrar en su taller, que está equipado con pocas  maquinarias, de lunes a viernes, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta 11 de la noche y los días sábados y domingos en la feria de “Túpac Amaru” en del distrito de Wanchaq de la provincia del Cusco donde vende los muebles. 

Con su próximo préstamo, Donato espera recibir $400 USD. Por el momento, su taller esta modestamente equipado con las necesidades básicas. Le gustaría emplear el dinero del préstamo para comprar madera y materiales.      

Donato participa en el banco comunal “El Amanecer” y sus compañeros le han reafirmado la confianza para los préstamos.
texts.en:
Donato was born in the town of Abancay and currently lives in the city of Cusco, along with his wife, Doris, and their two children. When he turned 16, Donato began attending the institute of higher education “SENATI” (National Service for Training and Development in Industrial Technology) in the city of Abancay and he learned the trade of carpentry and cabinet making. Several years ago Donato worked in his trade in the city of Decidido. Starting a new life, Donato moved to Cusco, Peru, where he had distant relatives. He used his savings to rent a piece of land where he could make wood furniture. He can now be found in his workshop, which is equipped with a few machines, Monday through Friday from 8:00 in the morning to 11:00 at night. On Saturdays and Sundays he is at the “Túpac Amaru” market in the Wanchaq district of the province of Cusco, where he sells his furniture. With his next loan, Donato expects to receive $400.00. For the moment his workshop is modestly stocked with the basic necessities. He would like to use the money from the loan to buy wood and materials. Donato participates in the “El Amanecer” [The Dawn] communal bank and his fellow members have reaffirmed their trust in him for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and materials

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim M. was born in 1974 and she lives in Srae Boeng village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 5.5 hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her husband. Mr. Sao Nuon, owns an agricultural machine, but works as a fisherman. 

Her problem is that the agricultural machine is too old to use but she does not have enough money to solve this problem. Mrs. Yim M. is applying for a loan to buy an agricultural machine to use instead of the old one. 

She is the mother of four children who are all studying in school as well as helping with their parents’ businesses. Her husband is shown in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy an agricultural machine

loans.name: Francisca Salome

texts.es: La señora Francisca vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 21,17 y16 años, su esposo trabaja como contador en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Francisca se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de todo tipo. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder abastecer su mercadería y estabilizar su negocio, es cliente nueva de Impro y forma parte de Kiva por primera vez.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca lives in her own home in the district of Tacagua in the city of La Paz. She is married and has three children (ages 21, 17, and 16). Her husband works as an accountant in the city of Cochabamba. Francisca sells electrical appliances of all kinds.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her operating capital so that she can restock with more merchandise and stabilize her business. She is a new client of IMPRO and this is her first loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Ananta Kumari

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Ananta Kumari K.C. She is married and has five children aged 23, 19, 17, 16 and 14. In 1985 she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. With this first loan from Patan BPW, Ananta Kumari wants to purchase seed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

With a Kiva loan, Patan Business and Professional Women borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With these a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence level and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seed

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is 50 years old, married and has six adult-aged children. She is from the village of Upper Lilingayon within Valencia City, Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Fe runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. She also buys and sells vegetables. Fe has been in business for over two years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to obtain working capital

loans.name: Angelito

texts.en:
Angelito R. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 27 years-old and married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Angelito owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes  from buying and selling fish products such as milk fish, anduhaw, gutob, budlisan and galong-gong in the local community. Angelito has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Angelito joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelito is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish o buy and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Angelito from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish.

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Manibadar

texts.en:
Manibadar T. is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Baganuur, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, which is the capital city of Mongolia. They live together in an apartment.

He operates a transportation business for locals between towns.  He owns a large transport truck and transport goods throughout towns and cities. He started his transporting business in 2007 and has found success as a truck driver. In the winter he also purchases and transports coal which he sells to local residents and businesses.

After years of successful operation, he has gained many permanent customers. For the future, he plans to continue to grow and improve his business so that he can enlarge his house and fence. He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase four new tires and an engine for his  truck.

loans.use: To purchase new four tires and engine

loans.name: Suyumkan

texts.en:
Suyumkan K. is an attentive mother of three children in a tight-knit family. They live in Keper-Arik village, in the northern part of Kyrgyzstan. 

After graduating from college, she worked as a laboratory assistant at a local plant. When Suyumkan was 20, she got married and soon became the mother of her beloved children. Her husband worked at the sugar mill but his wage was too low to cover all their family’s expenses. In order to support her family, Suyumkan decided to engage in livestock breeding. She bought one milk cow and one bull-calf and managed to develop a farm with four bull-calves and cows. 

In 2006, using the revenues from selling most of the cattle, Suyumkan was able to buy a car and pay for her son‘s education. Now Suyumkan plans to use this loan of 60,000 Kyrgyz Soms to broaden her number of cattle for fattening and reselling. In the future, Suyumkan dreams to open a small shop with meat and milk products.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Bumtsend

texts.en: Bumtsend B. is 60 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His two daughters are attending secondary school. Bumtsend operates a firewood and coal selling business with the help of his wife in the Tsaiz market, the biggest raw materials market in the city. He has been engaged in this business for the past three  years and has gained much experience. He purchases one truckload of coal at 280,000 MNT and packages them into 450-500 bags to sell at 850 MNT per bag. He sells firewood in addition to coal. He usually operates his coal and firewood trading business during the winter months and manages a mare's milk trading business in the summer months. Bumtsend is a hardworking and honest man. For the future, he says, "I would like to buy a truck for my business." He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase two truckloads of coal and two truckloads of wood at wholesale price for his business.

loans.use: To purchase two truckloads of coal and two truckloads of firewood.

loans.name: Luy

texts.en: The woman in the photo is Mrs. Luy V., age 50, who lives in the province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. She has run this business since 2000. She is married with four children, two of whom are single and two of whom are married. Two of her children share their salary with her every month. Her husband helps her in raising pigs and also works as a farmer. Dry weather is expected in the beginning of this year, and it may affect Mrs. Luy V.’s husband's business. Her husband faces a difficult season if he is not able to irrigate his crops. Mrs. Luy V. is taking out a loan for her husband to purchase a machine that he uses to pump water for his crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine to pump water for crops.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
CORAZON D. JESUS

Rosa es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal “CORAZON D. JESUS” hace 1 año y recientemente por decisión D. todo el grupo le otorgaron el puesto D. presidenta, en la foto sale la presidenta sale parada al medio D. todo el grupo con (POLO D. COLOR BLANDO D. MANGA CORTA CON UN PANTALON JEEN D. COLOR CELENTE) Entre todo el grupo decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su Alcancía Comunal por que a todos les pareció bien y les gusto ese nombre este grupo lo conforman 11 personas las cuales tienen ya 1año trabajando con Edaprospo-prosperidad.
Rosa tiene 39 años D. edad es madre soltera tiene 5 hijos los cuales son dependientes   (4 MENORES D. EDAD Y 1 MAYOR D. EDAD) Rosa trabaja en lo que es compra y venta D. chatarra (compra fierros, clavos, y todo tipo D. metales) D. esa manera ayuda a su hija que esta estudiando (ESTUDIOS SUPERIORES) Rosa piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en el alquiler D. un puesto D. venta D. ropa para su hija pero su sueño D. Rosa es tener un puesto D. venta D. ropa propio en el mercado D. su localidad.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the “Corazón D. Jesús”  (The Heart of Jesus) Communal Bank for one year.  The whole group recently decided to give her the presidency.  In the photo the president is standing in the middle of the group (with a white, short sleeve polo shirt and light blue jeans).  The whole group decided on the name for their communal bank because it seemed good to them, and they liked this name.  This group is comprised of 11 people who have been working with Edaprospro-Prosperidad for one year.

Rosa, age 39, is a single mother.  She has five dependent children (four are minors, and one is an adult).  Rosa works buying and selling scrap metal (she buys iron, nails, and all types of metal).  This way she helps her daughter who is enrolled in higher education studies.

Rosa plans to use the loan to rent a stand to sell clothes for her daughter.

Rosa’s dream is to have her own stand to sell clothes at the local market.

loans.use: To rent a stand to sell clothes

loans.name: Janankan's Group

texts.en:
Janankan J. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Nookat, a small village near Osh. She is 45 and married to a builder. She has two sons and two daughters. The older son and the older daughter are working in Russia and the other children study at school. 

In order to earn additional money to cover family expenses Janankan breeds cattle. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a cow for breeding. In the future, Janankan wants to save money to build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.es:
El comité Esperanza nació mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que también trabajaba por los mismos objetivos.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo, las integrantes fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas.
Las mismoas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Lilian M., presidenta del grupo tiene 35 años, ella está domiciliada en San Lorenzo, y es una mujer casada con 3 hijos, es muy emprendedora e innovadora, durante todos estos ciclos ha demostrado ganas de superación.
texts.en:
The group named Esperanza, meaning Hope, was started with the guidance and support of another group who works with the same objectives. 

This group is in San Lorenzo. The members set themselves a goal of stimulating the development of each individual. 

They are known in their community for being hard working women. 

Mrs. Lilian M. is the leader of the group. She is 35 years old and she lives in San Lorenzo. She is a married woman and she has 3 children. She is enterprising and innovative and through all of the past loan cycles she has demonstrated a great wish for self-improvement.

loans.use: To purchase breads, vegetables, fruits, snacks, sweets, and natural remedies.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie A. is from the village of Poblacion, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Elvie is married and has 1 adult-aged child. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Elvie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elvie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Luisa Antonia

texts.es: La Señora Luisa Antonia se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que tiene este negocio, Luisa tiene cierto tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues los financiamientos le han sido de gran ayuda para su negocio. Ella tiene todas las intenciones de salir adelante, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan diferentes productos, es así como Luisa se ha ganando el cariño de sus clientes. Este financiamiento es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, cremas, tratamientos y ropa.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa Antonia has been selling general merchandise for more than eleven years. She has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for some time since the loans have been a great help to her business. She has every intention of succeeding. Most of her customers always request different products, and Luisa has earned their affection.

This loan will be used to buy shoes, cosmetics, crèmes, treatments, and clothes.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy shoes, cosmetics, crèmes, treatments, and clothes

loans.name: La Unión 1 Y 2 Group

texts.en:
Amarilis is one of the members of the “La Unión 1 y 2” (The Union 1 & 2) Group. They are micro enterpriser's dedicated to clothing sales, sales of natural products, shoe sales, teaching, food sales, etc., in the city of Hato Mayor, one of the country’s most rural cities whose economy depends on agriculture.

Amarilis is the mother of four children, who she has raised with many sacrifices and much effort together with her long-term partner. She will save her profits to invest in her house's concrete block structure. She started building a short time ago, while they are living in part of the house that is still with the old structure. Her favorite pastime is cooking and her main challenge is to finish building her house. 

She currently sells bed and bathroom linens. Amarillis is planning to invest the money from her new loan in purchasing bedding sets, curtains and bathroom carpets. She has been collaborating with Kiva's partner, Esperanza, for five years now and is getting her tenth loan. Each previous loan has been repaid satisfactorily and she has maD. some good investments. 

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti.

loans.use: to buy bedding sets

loans.name: Nurmahmat

texts.ru: Мустафакулов Нурмахмат проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Возраст, 56 лет. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Сын находится в России. Сам Нурмахмат занимается животноводством и растениеводством. При доме имеет участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Кроме того он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. В этой области 13 лет. Кредит просит для закупа крупнорогатого и мелко-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Nurmahmat M. lives in J. Rumy.  He is 56 years old, married, and has six children. His son is in Russia. Nurmahmat works in animal husbandry and agriculture.  At home he has a plot of land where he sows wheat and grows vegetables. He also raises cattle at home. He has been doing this for thirteen years. He is taking out a loan to buy cattle and smaller livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle and smaller livestock

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Luzviminda is widowed and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a tailoring business. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. 

Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Luzviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-two-year-old widow with four children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in dried fish for eight years and with the profits she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her hardship is theft  due to  poor storage  facilities and her vision is  to have a big depot and educate all her children. Mary wants the loan to buy fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Bwashwa Tukore Group A, Kihihi

texts.en:
Amos M., the leader of Bwashwa Tukore group A in Kihihi, is 39 years old, married, and has three children. For over 12 years Amos, who has tea plantations, has operated an agricultural business selling tea leaves from Bwashwa, generating a monthly profit of 300,000/= . He is also involved in the sale of coffee since he also has a coffee plantation, and it is from the coffee sales that he earned the capital for his tea business.

Over the years loans have helped Amos to acquire stock and thereby increase his sales. A very hardworking man, he is now requesting a new loan to buy more manure for his crops, and his goal is to have more acres of tea shamba.

loans.use: to buy more manure for his crops.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat is 46 years old.  She resides in Kampong Chnang province in Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Nat sells fruits, earning an income of USD 7 per day to help cover her family's expenses. Her husband is a taxi driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 100 on food and USD 20 on other necessary expenses. 

Nat is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a stand at the market to sell fruits. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: buy a stand at the market to sell fruits

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Tessie is 51 years old and has one child who is in school.

Tessie has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines. Tessie requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy shirts, slippers and other dry goods to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for 15 years.  In the future, Tessie would like to save to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, slippers and other dry goods to sell.

loans.name: Mize

texts.en:
Mize is a married woman with one child. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

For 10 years she has operated a fried potatoes selling business, selling door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. During the rainy season it becomes hard to operate her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase four sacks of potatoes and five bundles wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of potatoes and five bundles wheat flour.

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian is 26 years old; He has been operating his business for the past two years. He earns a monthly income of about 30,000 KES (~$340) from his calling card business. 

He has applied for 42,000 KES from KADET LTD. This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use his loan to purchase calling cards in large quantities, which will enable him to get more profit.

He plans to use the profit from his business to open up a kiosk, which will be his central selling point instead of hawking around. In the future, he hopes to start a taxi business.

loans.use: to purchase calling cards in large quantities.

loans.name: Potola

texts.en:
Potola comes from the village of Nogha, West Georgia. She is 62 years old and lives with her mother-in-law in the village. 

Potola used to work as cashier, but at the moment, she is retired and is mainly busy with her agricultural business. Potola has four milk cows and two calves. She produces and sells 70 – 80 kg of cheese at the local open market. Also, Potola grows 500 nut trees and sells approximately 400 kg of nuts per year. Along with the above-mentioned things, Potola has a couple of hens and turkeys. She sells eggs at the local market. The total monthly income of the family, including the pension of Potola’s mother-in-law, is 300 Laris. 

Potola plans to increase the amount of hens and turkeys on her farm, but her problem is that the fence of the yard is already old and broken, and there is the risk that some of the hens and turkeys may go through it and get lost. Because of this reason, Potola requested credit for renovation of the fence. After she has a new fence, she will increase the amount of hens and turkeys and will be able to sell more eggs. It will positively impact her income. Potola plans to use the increased income for a house renovation to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase materials for a fence renovation to keep more hens and turkeys.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Felix de 29 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta con servicio sólo luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y turismo.

Felix se dedica a la agricultura, tiene sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra maíz y cafe, actividad que realiza desde hace varios, además de ser productos muy consumido por las personas, una vez que realiza su cosecha lo comercializa en los diferentes mercados de la zona y fuera de ella,  con los ingresos que adquiera puede brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y esposa.

A observar que su negocio va creciendo y a creído necesario solicitar un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para mejorar su cosecha de maíz y  de café, con las ganancias que obtenga podrá pagar su crédito y solventar las necesidades diarias de su familia.  Felix con trabajo y dedicación les brinda lo mejor a sus hijos y con la intensión de brindarles otras oportunidades académicas en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Felix is 29 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. The only service he receives is electricity. Felix resides in the rural section of the District of Pomahuaca, which is part of the Department of Cajamarca. This area is known for its businesses in the agriculture, livestock, and tourism sectors.

Felix is a farmer and has his own land on which he grows corn and coffee. He has been in this business for several years. His products are widely consumed by the locals. As soon as his crops are harvested, he sells them at different markets within and outside of the area. With the income he generates, Felix is able to provide a better quality of life for his wife and children.

Seeing the need for his business to grow, Felix requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 3000 PEN. The funds will be used to buy compost so that he can improve his corn and coffee crops. The revenue he earns will be used to repay the loan and provide for the daily needs of his family. Through work and dedication, Felix will be able to provide the best for his children and give them the opportunity to pursue an education in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase compost for his corn and coffee crops.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San, 56, is a fish seller who makes $7.50 per day. She is living with one niece. Every month, she has to spend $40 on food, $5 on electricity and $20 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy fish to sell. She wants to save up the income she gets from selling fish to repair her house and to buy a store in the market to sell fish.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase passion fruit seeds.

loans.name: Nelly María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 22 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Nelly, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y en la actualidad está en su cuarto mes de embarazo de su  primer hijo. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.

Nuestra amiga tiene una tienda de comestibles en la casa de su mamá, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, en ella vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que empezó con muy poco reuniendo todo el capital que tenia y con la ayuda de los créditos ha ido aumentando de mercadería poco a poco, lleva seis años con su negocio y es allí donde gana sus propios ingresos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, y otros productos de primera necesidad que aún le falta para que sus clientes estén satisfechos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy fuerte y solidario.
 
Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The July 22nd Communal Bank meets every 15 days in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial area, the traditional festivals for St. Peter and St. Paul, and the joy of its people.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Nelly. She is 26 years old, married, and currently in the second month of her pregnancy with her first child. Her husband is an auto mechanic.

Nelly manages a food store at her mother’s house, which is also where she and her husband reside. She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other items. Nelly works every day from 6am to 8pm. She says that she started with all the capital she could obtain, which was a very small amount. With the help of the loans, she has been able to increase her inventory a little bit at a time. Nelly has been in business for six years and this is how she has earns her own income.

This loan will be used to restock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, and other basic necessity products that she is lacking so that her customers will remain satisfied. Nelly has been with the Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because her group is very strong and supportive of one another. Her goals are to move forward in her business and to have it grow day after day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, and other basic necessity products.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María Luisa es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta la atención al cliente, por ese motivo fue que comenzó con su negocio de venta de ropa usada desde hace 5 años, de esta manera ayuda a su esposo que trabaja en un taller eléctrico con los gastos del hogar. La señora María Luisa tiene 2 hijos de los cuales quiere formar unas personas con buenos valores al igual ofrecerles un mejor estudio académico. El negocio es parte de la fuente de ingresos para esta familia, por ello solicita un préstamo para comprar ropa usada de temporada de invierno de diferentes prendas y colores, de esta manera serán incrementadas sus ventas.
texts.en:
María Luisa is a hardworking woman who enjoys dealing with customers. For this reason, she started a business selling used clothes five years ago. This enabled her to help her husband, who works at an electrical workshop, with the household expenses. Sra. María has two children who she wants to grow up to become individuals with good values. She also wants to provide them a good education.

This business is a partial source of income for her family. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy used clothing of various types and colors for the winter season. This will help increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba es madre comunitaria, es decir se dedica a la noble tarea de atender a niños de su barrio en condiciones de pobreza, apoyada por el Estado Colombiano en su programa de nutrición. Ella además de cuidar de niños cuyas madres trabajan o no tienen para su sostenimiento, se dedica al oficio producir artesanías y manualidades, también vende mercancía variada, actividades que inició cuando en condiciones de mujer separada, percibió que los ingresos no alcanzaban para cubrir los gastos de su familia, conformada por 3 hijos en las edades de 8 a 18 años.  Con estas actividades ha logrado salir adelante, desde su propia casa, porque todos sus esfuerzos los ha enfocado en conseguir cada vez mas más, bienestar para su familia. En estos días Elba se propone comprar hilo fino, para elaborar bolsos y mochilas que tiene encargadas, pero requiere tener efectivo disponible y hacer su compra en mayor volumen ahorrando costos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, tercer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización que la ha apoyado desde que inicio en ella mediante la metodología de grupos solidarios, donde aprendió el buen manejo de sus créditos y la importancia de pagar puntualmente, como hasta la presente lo hace. Su sueño es tener un almacén muy grande especializado en bolsos y mochilas artesanales propias de su natal población de San Jacinto a quien le debe su aptitud frente al arte.
texts.en:
Elba is a day care worker.  That is, she works at the noble job of taking care of the poor children in her neighborhood, supported by the Colombian government's nutrition program.  Besides taking care of children whose mothers work or who don't have enough to support them, she works making handicrafts and selling different merchandise.

She began these jobs when she was separated, seeing that her income wasn't enough to cover expenses for her family, her three children between the ages of 8 and 18.  With these jobs she has managed to get ahead, from her own home, because more and more she has focused all her effort on her family's well-being.

Currently Elba plans to buy high-quality thread to make purses and knapsacks that have been ordered, but she needs to have the cash available to buy wholesale, to save costs.  This is why she is asking for a Kiva loan, her third loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  This organization has supported her since she began, through the methodology of the solidarity groups, in which she learned how to manage her loans well and the importance of paying punctually, as she has done all along.

Elba's dream is to have a very big store specializing in artisanal purses and knapsacks traditional to her native town of San Jacinto, to which she owes her artistic ability.

loans.use: to buy high-quality thread to make purses and knapsacks in large quantities.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children.
Clarita  has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Clarita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Clarita  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Damétote

texts.fr:
Damétote est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié å une  revendeuse. Il a 01 enfant âgé de 03ans.
Damétote travaille comme revendeur de chemises et chaussures depuis 2007. Il vend de façon ambulante à ses clients.
Damétote a requis son quatrième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des chaussures. Il veut agrandir l’activité en la diversifiant.
