Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer la stabilité financière de la famille.
texts.en:
Damétote is a 32-year-old man.  He is married to a retail merchant and has a three-year-old child.

Damétote has been working as an itinerant retail salesman of shirts and shoes since 2007.

Damétote requested his fourth WAGES credit loan to buy shoes. He would like to expand his business activity by diversifying his product offerings.

He stated that the profits should provide financial stability for his family.

loans.use: Buy shoes

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 47 years old and married. She has two children aged 15 and 10. Cristita runs a fishing business. This business has been running for four years. Each month, Cristita earns 4,000 PHP.

Cristita has requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat. She hopes to earn more and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Vilma Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo tiene 43 años, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos de las cuales dos son independientes y uno depende de ella todavía. Amparo nació en la provincia de Quispicanchis y ahora radica en la ciudad del Cusco. En la ciudad del Cusco Amparo desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas.   

Amparo se dedica a la venta de ropa y juguetes, ella comprar sus productos en diferentes ciudades del Perú y después los distribuye a las vendedoras de los diferentes mercados de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Amparo pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo juguetes y ropa. 

Amparo se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Amparo is 43 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are independent and one of whom is still dependent on her.  Amparo was born in Quispicanchis province and now lives in the city of Cusco.  This is where Amparo carries out her daily and business activities.

Amparo sells clothes and toys.  She buys her products in different cities in Peru and then distributes them to sellers in the different markets in the city of Cusco.

Ampraro is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Ñahupacman Purisun” community bank, in the city of Cusco.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as toys and clothes.

Amparo is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving and pledges to make her repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as toys and clothes

loans.name: Talente Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Talente Group in Western Kenya! Evelyn is the facilitator of the Talente group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Evelyn takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Evelyn had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Evelyn was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Evelyn and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Evelyn will educate her children and repay her loans.

In 2012, the members of Talente group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr:
Amavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 47 ans. Elle est mariée  å un employé au port avec 01 enfant âgé de 20ans.
Amavi travaille comme revendeuse d’huile et de tomate depuis 2001. Elle vend à ses clients à la maison après achat à Lomé. Elle travaille seule et n’a aucune difficulté.
Amavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de l’huile et de la tomate. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Amavi voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit de prendre soin de la famille.
texts.en:
Amavi is a 47-year-old woman. She is married to a port employee with one 20-year-old child.  She has been working as a reseller of oil and tomatoes since 2001.  She sells to her customers at home after purchasing her products in Lomé.  She works alone without any problems.

Amavi has requested her first loan through WAGES in order to buy oil and tomatoes.  She wants to reinvest in her business.  In the next few years, she would like to enlarge her business.  She says that with the profits she plans to care for her family.

loans.use: to buy cans of oil and cartons of tomatoes.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en: Claudine, age 42, is married to a businessman. They have three children between the ages of 12 and 17. All of her children go to school. She sells different items in a boutique, which she has spent seven years running. With the requested loan, she will buy more soap, sugar, and rice to sell. She plans to use the profits to pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: to buy more soap, sugar, and rice to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace sells charcoal and gari (cassava meal) in Asebu Brebia. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Grace has been selling gari and charcoal for 4 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility bills. Grace will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal and gari to sell. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of gari and bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
An independent young man working really hard to build his career, Ali is a 32-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and three school-aged children. After gaining many years of experience in his present occupation, Ali was able to open his own barbershop. Due to his good business reputation, he has been achieving his goals and building a good career with a fair number of loyal customers.

With his requested loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., Ali will renovate his salon’s decor in order to satisfy customer demand and serve them better. He seeks to expand his business and income to enhance his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to renovate his salon’s decor.

loans.name: Safiétou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe a été crée depuis le 26 Décembre 2011 et regroupe des femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. Madame Safiétou est la responsable. Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée. Son nouveau crédit de 300000 francs CFA lui permettra de se payer 60 caisses de poissons qu'elle va revendre au niveau du marché au détails.Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis bientôt 20 ans. Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de payer les frais scolaires alimentaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes ai niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was created on December 26, 2011, and brings together women from the same village who are united by good social and professional relationships. 

Madame Safiétou is in charge of the group. Mariétou is 52 years old, married, and the mother of six children (3 girls and three boys). She is standing all the way at the right of the photo with her hand raised. Her new 300,000 FCFA loan will allow her to buy 60 cases of fish that she'll resell at retail prices in the market. 

She has a lot of experience as she has worked in this area for 20 years. 

The profits she earns in her business allow her to pay for schooling, food, and healthcare for her children, and to save for the banc villageois.

loans.use: buy cases of fish to resell at retail prices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion works hard to support her child. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Concepcion requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF in order to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water.

Concepcion is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Rabil

texts.en:
Rabil is 30, single, internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin.He settled in Absheron region Sumgayit shosse.
Before he wanted to open his own market, but he could not do it.He decided to borrow the loan $400 and to built his own market. For the second time he borrowed the loan $800 and bought the  foodstuffs. The third loan amount $1400 he spent to expand the area of his market.
Now he wants to built the household shop.

loans.use: To expand his busines

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela works selling plastic items for the home. Rafaela started her business with the support of her spouse, who gave her the money to buy a booth in the outdoor market. At first, she only sold basins, buckets, and chairs. Now she also sells small home electronics and clothing.

Rafaela aspires to sell microwave ovens and dishware. She will use this loan to invest in home electronics and plastic items. She has faith tha twith these new products, her business will grow and permit her to continue investing in merchandise.

Rafaela is married, and she has one daughter, who is grown. She is convinced that her business will see growth.

(Tranlsated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Rafaela se dedica a la venta de artículos plásticos para el hogar. Rafaela empezo su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo quie le facilito el dinero para la compra de un modulo en el mercado.Al principio solo vendia lavacaras , baldes y sillas. Ahora continúa ofreciendo estos productos juntos pequeños electrodomesticos y ropa.

Rafaela aspira vender microondas y vajillas .Ella usara el prestamo para invertir en electrodomesticos y articulos plasticos .Ella tiene FE que con estos nuevos productos su negocio crecera y le permitira seguir invirtiendo en mercaderia.

Rafaela esta casada tiene una hija que es independiente .Esta convencida que su negocio tendrá un crecimiento.

loans.use: She will use this loan to invest in home electronics and plastic items.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Francisca. My main activity if selling home appliances door-to-door and by special order. I have dedicated myself to this type of work for several years, and it generates income for the expenses of my family and also commitments with the suppliers. Thanks to this business I have given an education to my children.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Francisca, mi actividad principal es la venta de electrodomesticos de manera ambulante y por encargo, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de negocio, el que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y demas compromisos con los proveedores, gracias a este negocio he dado educación a mis hijos.

loans.use: To buy plates, soup bowls, spoons, vase sets, curtains, lamps, and silverware sets.

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mr. Phun O. is a 38 year-old taxi driver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He earns about 10 dollars a day. His wife owns a store where she sells rice and Khmer food. They also have five children.

They would like to purchase more rice and equipment for their business. In the future, they would also like to open a larger store. Inthe picture, we can see Mr. Phun O.'s wife.

loans.use: to purchase rice and equipments

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben Jet is 32 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old and has been a LAPO client for a year now. He renders laundry services to the community where he lives and hopes to purchase more laundry equipment in order to increase his services if the amount US $550 is approved.

loans.use: To buy more laundry equipment

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence owns a small restaurant within an open-air roadside produce market. For three years she owned a restaurant at a different location, but then she lost a child at birth and had to close. She is now ready to start again and has operated at this site for one month.

Her restaurant is very neat and clean. She has taken great care in making it bright and inviting. It is a good location. She serves typical Ugandan food: Matooke, a steamed or cooked banana dish; cassava, tubers; sweet potatoes; posho, a maize flour dish; rice; beef stew; fish; beans; peas; and tea. The diet of most Ugandans varies little, but is usually not lacking in nutrients, as all products are fresh and there are plenty of fruits and vegetables grown in adjacent fields.

With her loan, Florence plans to buy a deep fryer, a fridge and some more chairs for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to add a takeaway service so that she can deliver to people in the area. Florence is married with one child, and she cares for 2 orphans.

loans.use: To buy a deep fryer, a fridge and some chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna lives in Mukachevo where she helps take care of her sick mother. Ganna is a small entrepreneur who runs a business selling clothing in the local mall. The type of inventory for sale in her store is always in high demand and she has many loyal customers. She has been in this trade for 12 years. Currently, Ganna has about $1500 in inventory.

Ganna is a people person which is why it’s easy for her to build and maintain relationships with the circle of people around her and her business. Moreover, Ganna is a persistent hard-worker. She is very committed to her venture and invests much energy and effort in it. Presently, Ganna is requesting a loan of $1200 to increase assortment variety for her little store. She believes additional financing will help her venture expand and blossom into a successful, profitable business.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of home product inventory

loans.name: Tupokigwe

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 37 year-old Tupokigwe M.. She is married with five children, aged 6, 9, 14, 17, and 21. In 2000 Tupokigwe established a farming and timber business, and now requires a loan of $175 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming.

loans.name: Dursadaf

texts.en: Dursadaf is 50-years-old and the mother of four children. The Sheydayev family lives in Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Ms. S. started her dairy business four years ago. She is requesting a loan of $725 to purchase a cow in order to increase her milk production and sales .

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production

loans.name: Budumuli East A F Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Kasifa N.. She is currently in the business of selling new clothes and is requesting a loan to increase inventory. Kasifa is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a driver for work. She has 2 children, aged 10 and 14, and both of her children go to school. Each week, Kasifa makes approximately UGX 70000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save and also pay the school fees for her children. Kasifa has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to buy a counter and the loan was paid back on time.

Kasifa is joined in her small group by Fuida K. and Sylvia N.. Fuida K. has a business running a beauty salon and wants to buy a hair steamer. Sylvia N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to stock more clothes.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes in large quantities

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella F.’s business is growing every day. This can be seen by the rapid increase in her daily sales. She used to fry yams and potatoes, but for the past two years she has been selling cooked food, because LAPO Microfinance has come to her financial aid.

She is 43 years old, married, and has 4 children. She comes from Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria. Stella is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more yams, potatoes, and food to sell. She said this will help her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more yams, potatoes, and food item

loans.name: Kapsaos Women's Group

texts.en:
Rose A. is an average Kenyan woman aged 44 and married with 4 children. She also lives with 2 orphan children of her late brother who perished 2 years ago.

Rose started her second-hand clothes business 6 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local hO. in Eldoret town. She purchases at least 5 bales of clothes every week, which she sells to her regular customers at the municipality market. With the little profit that she gets from her business, Rose is still able to feed, clothe and educate her children. With the help of her loan, Rose will be able to purchase more bales of clothes to enable her to increase her monthly sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a collection of shoes to replenish her stock.

loans.name: Dourng

texts.en:
Dourng S., 57, is married to Nut Art and lives in Kampong Cham, close to her five children’s families. She has been working in her own little grocery store for many years, making US $2 each day, while her husband works in the fields as a farmer, making less than US $1 each day. Their children are all married and live with their own families now, but two of their daughters work in the local garment factory and help to support the family.

Dourng S. has asked for a loan of US $500 to invest in her grocery store business and to increase her inventory. She believes that this investment can increase her income in the long-term and can allow her to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Increase grocery inventory

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.en:
Problems and money shortages have never defeated Mahbuba, who has always looked for a way to get past obstacles and continue to improve her situation. Mahbuba is an extremely hard-working and energetic woman. She is 45 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband is an electrician.

Mahbuba started her own business because her husband’s salary was not enough for their family expenses. For more than eleven years, she has operated a store where she sells girl’s and women’s clothing. As a rule she travels to the neighboring town, Istaravshan, to get new garments at very cheap prices. Her store is well known, and people love to visit because it's clean, tidy, and run by someone who is very kind and thoughtful.

Mahbuba hopes that her store will keep growing so that she can maintain a comfortable life for her family, especially for her four children. To make that possible, she has applied for a new loan that she will use to buy more clothing to sell. With this purpose in mind, Mahbuba is requesting 1150 USD for the term of 10 months. She promises to repay the loan with accuracy as she has done with previous loans. Mahbuba is counting on your help. Be an important of the growth of Mahbuba’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for girls and women for re-sale

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
La señora Leonina, socia del BC “Las Moralinas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales. Se dedica a la venta de comidas y gaseosas. El negocio lo realiza en el Jr. Aviación Nº 100, donde acuden los clientes que son amigos, pasajeros y transeúntes de los diferentes terminales terrestres de la ciudad, porque el negocio está muy cerca a ellos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1, 000, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de arroz, azúcar en saco, fideo, aceite en galón, gaseosas de diferentes marcas tamaños y sabores, también comprará los demás productos que necesita para la preparación de los platos a ofertar a sus clientes, además quiere implementar mejor el negocio para ello comprará vasos, servilletas, ollas y baldes para dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

Tiene 38 años, es una mujer responsable, cautelosa  y  trabajadora. Su meta es incrementar el negocio y surtir más, porque gracias a este negocio puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos quienes están estudiando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leonina, member of the "Las Moralinas" Community Bank, lives in the San Martin province, in the Morales district. She sells food and soft drinks. She operates her business on Aviacion Street, where her clients, friends and travelers are close by. With the loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, noodles, oil by the gallon, soft drinks, and other products that she needs for the preparation of foods. Also, she would like to improve her business by purchasing glasses, napkins, pots and buckets. She is 38 years old, and is a responsible, cautious and hard-working woman. Her goal is to expand her business and supply more, because thanks to this business she can cover her children's expenses, who are currently in school.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, noodles, oil by the gallon, soft drinks, and other products that she needs for the preparation of foods.

loans.name: Aleksandra

texts.en:
Aleksandra V. is 21 years old. She comes from Derventa and she is not married. Aleksandra works in a flower store and besides that, she is the owner of part of this store. Her flower store is well-positioned and the business will expand.

Aleksandra became an owner recently and she wants to develop the business. She needs a loan for that, so she has requested one through WWI in the amount of 600 KM. Aleksandra will invest this loan in her flower store, buying needed equipment.

loans.use: To buy equipment for flower shop

loans.name: Hujamurod

texts.en:
Hujamurod rents a little store where he sells foodstuff. He buys his goods in another city which is away from his town about 100 miles. He goes for goods every week. His family members help him at the store. His products are popular in his town for being cheap and fresh. That’s why he has many regular clients.

He wants to take a loan for purchasing more goods and have more profit. And with bigger profit he plans to pay for his daughter's wedding.

loans.use: Expanding his business

loans.name: Rosa Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene una tiendita a la cual le esta invirtiendo mucho tiempo, esfuerzo y dedicación, demostrando responsabilidad.
Ella esta solicitando este credito para invertir mas en su negocio y asi lograr incrementar  las ventas del negocio atrayendo mas clientela por la variedad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Rosa has a small store in which she is investing a lot of time and effort, demonstrating responsibility. She is asking for a loan to invest more in her business and in this way increase her sales by attracting more customers through having a variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business.

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Mr. Lek C. lives in Sduk Thom village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. He earns little income, so he cannot provide a better life for his children. In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a plot of land for growing rice to expand his rice revenue to support the household. His wife, Mrs. Hor Heang, is a pig breeder. Mr. Lek C. is 49 years old and the father of three children who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is also presented in the picture with him.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a plot of land for growing rice to expand rice revenue to support the household.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Né en 1970 à Dassou Kondji dans la préfecture des Lacs, Mr Komlavi H. est menuisier de formation, activité exerce régulièrement et qui lui réussit très bien très bien. Compte tenu des demandes pressantes de ses clients pour la fabrication des meubles, il sollicite un financement pour acheter des planches en grande quantité afin de disposer d’un stock permanent. Cela lui permettra de répondre aux commandes des clients, d’augmenter ses bénéfices et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Dassou Kondji, in Lacs prefecture, Mr. Komlavi H. is a cabinet-maker by training. It is steady work that is succeeding very well for him. Given the pressing demand of his customers for making furniture, he is requesting financing to buy lumber in large quantities in order to have a constant stock. This will enable him to meet the demands of his customers, to increase his profits, and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make and sell furniture

loans.name: San Juan De Orcasitas Group

texts.es:
El Banco San Juan D. Orcasitas inicia su tercer ciclo con  18 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. San Juan D. Orcasitas que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. comidas, cosméticos, golosinas, bebidas, repuestos, abarrotes en general y fabricación D. ladrillos.

Como es el caso D. Agustina que es casada, tiene 42 años y 1 hijo, Agustina tiene un recreo llamado Valle Orcasitas en donD. venD. comida, bebidas, además su local cuenta con piscina y campo deportivo. Además Agustina se dedica a la compra y venta D. tara.

Mientras que Cirila es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Cirila compra tara en las diferentes comunidades y luego lo venD. a los intermediarios, además Cirila en época D. producción D. Tuna, compra tuna y lo transporta a la ciudad D. Lima para comercializarlo.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. tuna, tara, cuy, gallina, cochinilla, azucar, arroz, fideos, aceite y para el pago D. los peones.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener capital propio, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y trabajar para salir adelante.
texts.en:
San Juan D. Orcasitas Bank has started its third cycle with eighteen partners, all of whom are from the community in the area of San Juan D. Orcasitas – thirty minutes form the city Ayacucho. The partners are involved in different businesses, like selling food, cosmetics, sweets, drinks, replacement auto parts, groceries, and making bricks. In Agustina’s case, she is married, forty-two years old, and has a son. Agustina sells food, and beverages at a playground called Orcasitas Valley, and also at the local pool and a sports field. Agustina also buys and sells tara, a product from a kind of tree in Perú. While Cirila is married, thirty-nine years old, and the mother of three children, she purchases tara from different communities and then sells it between her suppliers. In addition, Cirila buys prickly pear when it is in season and transports it to Lima to sell it. The partners need loans of different sizes, like S/.300, S/.450, S/.600, S/.900, and totaling at S/.9,450 worth of loans from the communal bank. Their loans will be used to buy prickly pears, tara, guinea pigs, chickens, young pigs, sugar, rice, noodles, and oil, and to pay employees. These small businesspeople dream of improving their businesses, having their own financial resource, raising their children with a good education, and working to stay afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying prickly pears, tara, guinea pigs, chickens, young pigs, sugar, rice, noodles, and oil, and paying employees

loans.name: Nwaka

texts.en: Nwaka O. is a hair stylist who also sells salon materials like hair cream. She needs the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell. She is 25 years old and single. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Rosy

texts.es:
La socia ROSY; tiene 26 años de edad y es casada ella tiene 2 hijos de (6 y 3) años de edad; la socia es natural del Cusco.

La socia Rosy, alterna sus actividades domésticas con el comercio de compra y venta de ropa y artículos de decoración par el hogar, ella viaja hasta la frontera con Bolivia y trae ropa al por mayor, y artículos para el hogar, lo cual ella vende en las ferias semanales (sábado y domingo), en el mercadillo llamado el “altiplano”, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y traer ropa para implementar su pequeño negocio.

L asocia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado por este medio y se compromete a realizar con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Rosy is 26 years old, married and has two children, aged six and three. She is a native of Cusco. Rosy alternates her domestic activities with the buying and selling of clothing and home decor. She travels to the Bolivian border, bringing wholesale clothing and home items, which she sells at weekly fairs (Saturdays and Sundays), at the "Altiplano" flea market. She seeks this loan so she can travel and bring clothes to carry out her small business. She is grateful for, and values, this loan and promises to pay her debt in the allotted time.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sell clothing and home decor

loans.name: Raihonoi

texts.ru: Райхоной – молодая женщина 27 лет, замужем и мать одного ребенка. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. У нее есть дойная корова, которая дает молоко для их семьи и ребенка. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, так как молодая семья нуждается в большей прибыли. За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Raihonoi is a young, 27 year old woman, she is married and has one child. Her husband purchases and sells livestock at the livestock market and she fattens large livestock at home. Raihonoi has a dairy cow who provides milk for their family and child. She helps her husband in growing his business, since a large family needs a lot of income. They would like to use their loan to increase their livestock headcount and increase their income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
Casada y tiene 2 hijas que la apoyan en el negocio.

se dedica a la venta de " antojitos mexicanos". ella vendia solo los sabados y domingos y ahora y como le ha hido muy bien , tambien abre los lunes y miercoles.

Comenzo como ayudante en un negocio de comidas y observo que dejaba bunas ganancias y decidio poner su propio negocio.

es muy conocida en su localidad y tiene muchos clientes.

Ella quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para brindar un mejor servicio. Apoyemos esta compra.

Apoyemos este caso tan prometedor, casos de exito como este comenzaron de cero.
texts.en:
She is married and has two daughters that help her in the business.

She works selling Mexican snacks. She used to only sell on Saturdays and Sundays but since it has gone very well, now she also opens on Mondays and Wednesdays.

She began as helper in a food business. She saw that it earned a good profit and decided to start her own business.

She is very well known in her area and she has many customers.

She wants to buy tables and chairs to provide better service. Let’s support this purchase.

Let’s support this very promising case. Successful cases like these began from zero.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 22 years old and a resident of Barangay Minallo Naguillian, Isabela. She is married to Richard P. and they are blessed with a young daughter, Andrei Lhei P., who is 3 years old. Bernadeth is very happy to have her child and is doing her best to give her a better future.

Bernadeth’s primary business activity is hog raising. She is requesting to avail of a second loan of at least PHP 7,000 to have additional working capital for the maintenance and growth of her business. She will utilize part of the loan to purchase additional piglets to further increase her income. Her first loan was a great help to her and she is hoping to avail of another loan from lenders to continue her success. She hopes that she can send her only child to school someday by saving more money from her income.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay the rent for retail business and to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Cerefino

texts.en:
Mr. Cerefino is 47 years old and is married to Mrs. Silvia, with whom he has two older children.

Mr. Cerefino has been a taxi driver for more than twenty years. He currently has two vehicles in his service, which take different customers of Mariano Roque Alonso to neighboring areas. He began his service when he sold a truck that he used in his construction job. He saved a little bit more and then purchased another car.

Mr. Cerefino is asking for this loan in order to repair and maintain his two automobiles.

loans.use: To repair his two taxis

loans.name: Qorimakis Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal se denomina “QORIMAKIS”, Nombre quechua que significa, manos de oro, Este banco comunal está conformado por 11 miembros, los que viven en el distrito de Huanchaq, ellos se reúnen una vez al mes en el local principal en Cusco de Arariwa, en el mismo centro del distrito de Huanchaq.

Nuestros miembros son socios que están en su tercera fase, todos ellos realizan diferentes actividades, entre las que resaltan el comercio minorista, nuestros socios invierten sus dineros en cuatro socios están relacionados con la artesanía, ellos mismos elaboran manualmente la arcilla, la cuál la convierten en bellísimos productos decorativos, utensilios y mucho más, otro pequeño grupo invierte el dinero en la compra y venta de papa, verduras, restaurante, licores y venta de ropa, y una de las socias la Sra. Roxana tiene una agencia de turismo y tiene transporte turístico y de este modo ellos desean seguir mejorando su calidad de vida del de ellos y de toda sus familia, por lo que solicitan el préstamo, para continuar en sus negocios.

Nuestros socios valoran y agradecen el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
This group is called "QUORIMAKIS," a Quechua name which means "hands of gold." The group has 11 members who live in the Huanchaq district. They meet once a month at a central site in Cusco de Arariwa, in the district of Huanchaq. Our members are in their third loan phase. They pursue a variety of activities, among which the business of retailing is prevalent. Our members invest their money in four members who work at handicrafts. They transform potter's clay into beautiful decorative products, utensils, and much more. Another small group invests money in the purchase and sale of potatoes and vegetables, restaurant liqueurs, and clothes. One of the members, la Sra. Roxana, has a travel agency and transports tourists. All the members wish to continue to improve the quality of their lives and the lives of their families. They apply for this loan to continue with their businesses and improve the quality of their lives. Our members value and are grateful for the help given through these loans, and they promise to make loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business investment

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Julienne F.  est une femme mariée, mère de 4 enfants avec 4 autres dont elle a la charge. Elle tient une boutique où elle fait un commerce de divers produits alimentaires. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et d’assurer une scolarité à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Julienne F. is a married woman and the mother of four children, plus she has four others to support. She has a shop where she does commerce in various food items. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions and to ensure her children are educated.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For running a grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en: Rafail has a business selling metal. He is applying to Kiva for his second loan, and is requesting 2,000 AZN to buy metals and other necessary items to improve his business. Rafail is very thankful to Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To buy metals and other necessary items for his metal sales business

loans.name: San Martin De Porres Group

texts.es:
En la zona de Villa Exaltación, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “San Martín de Porres” que cuenta con trece socias.
Un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar junto a Pro-Mujer, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas.Son varias las actividades que realiza esta asociación; Asunta y Silvia se dedican a la venta de ropa, Jhovanna, Flora y Eusebia venden  comida, Clara es costurera, Victoria vende repuestos de vehículos en la feria 16 de Julio, Teofila vende habas y maní confitado de forma ambulante.  Esta asociación necesita comprar mercadería, afirman que precisan capital para poder reactivar sus negocios.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA

loans.name: Chroeun

texts.en: Mrs. Chroeun S. lives in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She owns five hectares to cultivate rice to earn a living. On this farm, she now faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds for cultivating so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice seeds. Her husband, Mr. Khuon Theoun, is a horse driver who makes a small income to support the family. Mrs. Chroeun S. is 28 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school and the other is just eight months old. Her husband is presented on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more rice seeds

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn P. is from the village of Tugas Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Janelyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Janelyn runs a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products and dried goods in the local community. Janelyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Janelyn joined GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Janelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Janelyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional products to sell

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz A. is 52 years old. He is married and has three children. Aziz sells different kinds of detergents like soap, shampoo, toothpaste, shaving cream, washing powder and different food goods in his own store. Aziz is not alone in this business, his wife actively helps him with sales.

Aziz requests a loan of 1606 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and to push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Aziz 's main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday his son will become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To increase the number of products he sells.

loans.name: Kervy

texts.en: Kervy is a young mother to two children. She is 23 years old and her oldest child is only 2 years old. She has been married to her husband Ronnie since 2007. Living in Agusan Del Sur, she maximized her resources and taught herself farming. She plants rice on her field and always aims for an abundant and high-quality harvest. According to her, her rice farm needs additional capital. She has applied to CEVI and asked for a loan of PHP11,000. With this loan, she will buy fertilizers and all the necessary supplies for her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lily

texts.en:
Lily R., currently in the business of selling soft drinks in a restaurant, is requesting a loan to purchase beers, packaged juice, powdered milk, etc. to sell. Lily, 32 years old and married to a man who is currently a student, has one child who attends school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house to rent out.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase beer, juice, powdered milk, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Sebastiana

texts.en:
Maria Sebastiana G. T. is 58 years old and lives in the Isla Trinitaria zone of Guayaquil. This zone has scant basic services, but luckily Ms G.'s cane home has electricity and water.
Maria used to work as a cook in a restaurant. The gruelling schedule of this job left her tired from being on her feet all day. Five years ago, she was able to change careers by setting up a small grocery store. The top-selling products at her store are rice, sugar, and oil. This new position has allowed Ms G. to spend more time with her family and she is now less tired. She has two children, aged 16 and 19. The 16-year-old helps maintain the store from 6 am to 10 pm.
Ms G. is requesting a loan to buy more rice, cola, and sugar for her store. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and secure her cane home.

loans.use: To purchase rice, cola and sugar for her store

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
El banco comuna Las Caleras está formado por un grupo de mujeres que saben que en la vida nada es fácil pero con sudor y sacrificio pueden llegar a tener muchas cosas para poder entregarle lo mejor a su familia, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca siendo esta la tercera ciudad más importante del Ecuador, que se distingue por su belleza arquitectónica y su gente que es muy cálida y amable.

La Sra. María L. es socia del banco comunal Las Caleras, se lleva con todas sus amigas del banco comunal, tiene una pequeña tienda panadería, desde que era pequeña trabajo en el oficio de la panadería el cual aprendió y su horario de elaboración es de 5:30 a.m. a 8 o 9 a.m., y el resto de tiempo de dedica a su tienda, nos comenta que sufre de cáncer al seno pero que está a punto de terminar su tratamiento y se siente muy bien y da gracias a dios de su recuperación, lleva 10 años trabajando con el bankito y los prestamos le han beneficiado en su hogar y negocio.

María vive en Las Caleras, tiene 51 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 30, 26, 25, 23 años de edad, sus hijas de 26 y 23 años son divorciadas, su hija de 26 años actualmente se encuentra estudiando en la Universidad, su hija de 23 años se encuentra trabajando para pagarse sus estudios en la Universidad Católica, y sus dos hijos varones son solteros y viven en el extranjero razón por la cual le pueden ayudar económicamente, siendo gracias a ellos que ha podido construir su casa propia, su esposo trabaja en un taller pequeño pero propio de carpintería,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le hace entrega lo va a invertir en su tienda comprando productos para surtirle más como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc., y también en su panadería comprando huevos, harina, etc., su gran sueño es de ya no tener deudas.
texts.en:
The community bank Las Caleras is a group of women who know that nothing is easy in life, but with a great deal of effort and sacrifice they can obtain many things to improve the lot of their families. They live in Cuenca which is the third most important city in Ecuador. It is known for its architectural beauty and its warm and friendly people. Sra. María L. is a member of the Las Caleras bank, and she gets on well with all her friends there. She owns a small bakery and store where she has worked since she was a young girl learning the trade. She does the baking from 5:30 to 8 or 9 am. and the rest of the time she works in the shop. María has breast cancer, but she has almost finished her treatment and feels very well. She thanks God for her recovery. She has been a part of the community bank for ten years, and the loans have been a great help in both her home and business. María lives in Las Caleras. She is 51 years old, married, and has four children aged 30, 26, 25, and 23. Her 26- and 23-year old daughters are divorced. The 26-year old is currently studying at university, and the 23-year old is working to pay for her studies at the Catholic University. Her two sons are single and live overseas so can help her financially. Thanks to them she has been able to build her own house. Her husband has his own small carpentry business. With the loan from Kiva partner Fundacion Espoir, María is going to buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles etc so that her store has more stock. As well, she will buy eggs, flour etc for her bakery. Her greatest desire is to be debt-free.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, oil etc for her bakery

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng S. (pictured here), 38, and her husband, Mr. Ang Un, 43, were married in 1987 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of them work in a garment factory, one is a security guard and the other two attend school. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Leng has been a garment-factory worker for six years, while her husband has been a construction worker for 10 years. Because their children commute to school far away, they take a motor remoque or motor taxi very often. A remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer on the back. Taking a remoque or motor taxi to school is expensive for the family. Therefore, Leng is asking for her first loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children to drive to school

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de Chinandega, la señora Reyna Guzmán se ha dedicado desde hace 20 años a la venta de abarroterías como jabones, ase, cloro, cepillos dentales, entre otros productos.
Ella es una dama muy trabajadora y comprometida con el bienestar de su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos ya que ella es madre soltera. Es de importancia destacar que ella está solicitando el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para ofrecerlos porque la competencia ha ido incrementando y ella no se puede quedar atrás sino que debe proyectarse buscando la manera de mejorar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Reyna G. has been running a general store in Chinandega's central market for 20 years. She sells a number of products, including soaps, bleach and toothbrushes. Reyna is an extremely hard-working woman, and she is very dedicated to her family. She is a single mother of two. Reyna has asked for a loan because she needs to increase her inventory and product selection. She's facing increased competition and must find a way to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving inventory and selection

loans.name: Chann Kaev Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann K. is 56 years old and a married woman who lives in Prey Chambak village, Takeo province. She is the leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK. The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes: to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their businesses.
 
Mrs. Chann K. is a silk weaver who can make a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income and improve her family's standard of living, she now wants to enlarge her business. Thus, she is now requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR from AMK to purchase more silks for weaving. 

Her husband, Mr. Chi Nget, is a laborer and earns a small salary. This couple has four children, one of whom is a laborer, another is a silk weaver, and the other two are students in the public school.

loans.use: To purchase more silks

loans.name: Gloria Quety

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo de 19 años de edad en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace veinte años tiene instalado en el mercado de la ciudad de Ferreñafe un puesto de venta de comida, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de platos durante el almuerzo. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido al buen trato que brinda y a la buena sazón con la que prepara la comida que ofrece.

Gloria nos comenta que la idea del negocio nació debido a la necesidad de contar con un ingreso familiar más estable que les permitiera salir adelante a ella y a su familia. Su esposo trabaja como agricultor y esta actividad solo les brinda ingresos por temporadas.

Gloria desea ampliar su negocio preparando más variedades de platos, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer amable y que gusta mucho de lo que hace, se esfuerza diariamente en su negocio para sacar adelante a su familia. Su hijo se encuentra estudiando la carrera superior de Computación y eso la llena de orgullo. Gloria ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos. Su mas grande anhelo es poder tener un restaurante turistico.
texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 19 year old son in the city of Ferreñafe, which is located twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

For twenty years, she has managed a vending post at the market in the city of Ferreñafe where she sells food. She offers her customers all types of dishes for lunch. Her business has been well received because she provides good service and for the great flavor of the prepared foods that she offers. Gloria says the idea for her business resulted from a need to obtain a more stable income for her family so that they could all get ahead. Her husband works as a farmer, but his work only provides seasonal income.

Gloria wants to increase her business by preparing a wider variety of dishes. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to be used for purchasing supplies needed to achieve her objective. She is a friendly woman who enjoys what she does. Gloria strives daily in her business so that her family can move forward. She is proud that her son is studying for his college degree in computer science. Gloria previously worked with our Institution and has demonstrated that she is a punctual and responsible client with her payments. Her greatest wish is to open a restaurant for tourists.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients needed to prepare more dishes

loans.name: Vick

texts.en:
Vick P. is from the village of Langcataon, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Vick is married and has 2 infant children. To make a living, Vick owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Vick has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 13,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Vick joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vick has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Vick is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her offering of products. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Vick from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her offering of products

loans.name: Olesya

texts.en:
Olesya is married with a 17-year-old son. She owns a retail business that sells men's clothing. Olesya has been in this business for 2 years. She runs this business together with her husband Mykola. Their monthly income is 6,000 UAH.

Olesya used to work as a salesperson in a similar business at the same market. After she got enough experience, Olesya decided to start her own business. Today she has 2 business locations at the market. Olesya's dream is to move to a small store to do retail business. Olesya would like to borrow 7,500 to purchase 60 pair of jeans.

loans.use: To purchase 60 pairs of jeans

loans.name: Flor De Mayo Group

texts.es: Doña Fidelina Angélica S., es presidenta del grupo Flor de Mayo, hace 6 años se conocen son originarios de la Aldea Chinimabé Momostenango,  Ella cuenta con 5 hijos 2 varones y 3 mujeres, actualmente ella se dedica a la Fabricación de almohadas de algodón, así mismo se dedica a la Elaboración de delantales, blusas, entre otros, cuenta animales domésticos, ella necesita un aumento de capital para el trabajo que actualmente realiza, pero para poder acceder a un prestamos en la Asociación ASDIR, fue necesario reunir al grupo de señoras quienes integran 5 personas, ya que ellas también tienen el mismo objetivo de aumentar el capital de negocio con la que cuentan.
texts.en:
Fidelina Angélica S. is president of the Flor de Mayo group. They have known each other for six years. They are from the Chinimabé Momostenango neighborhood. She has five children, two boys and three girls. She currently makes cotton pillows. She also makes aprons and blouses, among other things. She has domestic animals as well. She needs to increase her working capital for the work she currently does. But, in order to access a loan from the Asociación ASDIR she needed to join a group of women. There are five of them that make up the group. They all have the same objective of increasing their business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Myla

texts.en:
Myla P. is from the village of Alimannao, Peñablanca, Cagayan. She is 29 years old. Myla is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Myla  provides water refilling services to local community members. Myla has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $375 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myla is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es: Melissa tiene 22 años, es una joven madre que vive con su pequeña hija en casa de su madre. Hace mas de 6 años se dedica en la venta de productos comestibles en una tienda que tiene y que esta en sociedad con su mama. Paralelo a ello, ambas también se dedican preparando y ofreciendo comida, aprovechando el espacio amplio que tiene su establecimiento, de esa  manera plasman sus grandes dotes culinarias.  Melissa se siente contenta con las actividades que realiza, pues le permite trabajar al lado de su madre y al mismo tiempo velar por su bebe, el cual requiere todavía de sus cuidados. En un futuro desea seguir mejorando e implementando su negocio. Por ahora le pone mucho esfuerzo de su parte para así llegar a cumplir sus tan ansiadas metas a favor de su familia. Es el primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con el pago de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita quiere implementar su tienda con bebidas y demás alimentos, además desea comprar ingredientes para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Melissa is 22 years old, and a young mother who lives with her baby daughter in her mother’s house. For more than 6 years, she has dedicated herself to selling food products from a small store that she runs with her mother. Concurrently, both also work preparing and selling food, taking advantage of the ample amount of space they have in their establishment. In this manner, they can showcase their excellent culinary skills. Melissa is content with the activities she carries out, as they permit her to work alongside her mother while caring for her baby who depends on her. In the future, she wants to continue to improve and expand her business. She puts forth a great effort in order to reach the desired goals she has for the benefit of her family. This is her first loan with MFP, and she commits to be punctual with her installment payments. She will use the funds to stock her store with beverages and more food products and, in addition, she would like to buy ingredients for making her prepared dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to stock her store, and ingredients for making her prepared foods.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila L. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 64 years old and married. To make a living, Leonila owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling delicacies and candies in the local community. Leonila has been in business for more than 20 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es: Stephanie tiene 19 años, vive solo con sus padres y sus abuelos en la propiedad que poseen. Siendo una joven estudiante, aprovecha las amistades que tiene para comercializar las prendas de vestir que vende. Es así que desde hace mas de 6 meses se dedica en la venta de este producto, de esa manera logra tener un control de los productos que vende y de ja a crédito. Además siempre esta al tanto de las nuevas tendencias de la moda para que pueda ofrecer a su clientela buenas opciones de consumo es por eso que viaja cada quincena a la ciudad de Lima de donde se abastece de mercadería. Pro tanto anhela aumentar su capital de trbajo para así tener mayor rentabilidad y poder solventar sus propios gastos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP,  esta muy contenta de ser parte de su grupo comunal porque todas son muy  puntuales en sus créditos, es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del crédito que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir para dama para abastecerse.
texts.en:
Stephanie is 19 years old and lives with her parents and grandparents in their home. Being a young student, she benefits from her friendships that allow her to sell more clothing. More than 6 months ago she began to sell these products, and in this way she has control over the products that she sells and requests loans for. She is always on top of new fashion trends so that she can offer her customers good options for purchase. For this reason she travels to Lima every other week to restock her merchandise. She desires to increase her wares to earn a greater profit and be able to pay her own bills. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very happy to be part of the community bank because they are all very punctual with their loans. She is very responsible with her payments and thanks the people who will provide the loan she is requesting--a loan that will be very useful for her business' progress. She will use the requested loan to invest in purchasing more women's clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Women's clothing

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children who all attend school.She has been operating her business of selling Kikoi (traditional clothing) for the last five years door to door to her neighboring community.

She rents a house with no electricity and piped water. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of Kikoi's. Fatuma faces the major challenge is transport. She hopes to open a boutique in future and improve her business. She decided to join Yehu so as to get a loan to improve her business. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and transport.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of Kikoi's (traditional clothing).

loans.name: Victor Alfredo

texts.es:
Victor Alfredo C. V. tiene 24 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la provincia de Los Rios.  

 Victor es un socio de la ventanilla rural Lucha Para Triunfar. Son 13 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. 

Victor se dedica a la agricultura. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el canton de Ventanas. 

El apoyo de esta prestamo lo ayudaria en pagar unas deudas. Su sueno es comprar una propia casa. 

Le gusta jugar deportes como futbol indor y boli.
texts.en:
Victor Alfredo C. V. is 24 years old. He lives with a woman in the Ventanas canton in the Los Rios province. Victor is a member of the rural bank Lucha Para Triunfar. There are 13 members in total, and most of them work in agriculture. Victor works in agriculture. He buys and sells his products in the Ventanas canton. The support of this loan would help to ay off some debts. His dream is to buy his own house. He likes sports such as soccer and volleyball.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his agriculture

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson Y. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Samson is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Samson owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting mangoes for sale. Samson has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Samson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. Samson is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Samson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Zayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Zayra es una mujer muy trabajadora, de pocos recursos económicos, su negocio es la venta de tortilla que vende hace mucho para lograr el sustento de cada día.
Su casa es de madera y deseado mejorar la infraestructura con las divisiones de los cuartos para lograr mejor privacidad la cual no la tenía.
Este cambio lo logra a través de un financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo en donde comenzó pero no logro terminar ya que contaba con poco financiamiento por su condición.
Ya es su segundo ciclo en donde lograra el objetivo de cerrar completamente su cuarto.
Para esto comprara: bloques, cemento, puertas para concluir la mejora.
texts.en:
Zayra is a very hard working woman with few economic resources. She has sold tortillas for a long time to earn her daily support. Her house is wood and she wants to improve its infrastructure by dividing the rooms for more privacy, which she currently lacks. This change was made possible thanks to a loan that Afodenic granted to start the work but she wasn’t able to finish it because she only got a little financing due to her condition. This is her second cycle where she hopes to finish closing off the room. To do this she will buy: concrete blocks, cement and doors to finish the improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy concrete blocks, cement and doors to finish the improvement and complete closing off the room.

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor son del Distrito D. Pilpichaca, las principales actividades son la crianza D. alpacas.
Maximina es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Maximina venD. comidas en la feria D. San Felipe y su comunidad, además venD. golosinas, Maximina solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Maximina tiene un terreno en San Felipe y desea construir una casa para implementar un restaurante y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Dios es Amor (God is love) are from the Pilpichaca district. Their main work is raising alpacas. Maximina is a single woman with one son. She sells food at the San Felipe market and her group also sells candies. Maximina is asking for a loan to buy rice and sugar. Maximina has a lot in San Felipe and she wishes to build a house to set up a restaurant and thus improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia T. is from the village of Mibando, Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 45 years old, married and has five adult children. To make a living, Cecilia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Cecilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Cecilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan that Cecilia has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: C2896 Dukore Group

texts.en:
Jeanne was born in 1983. She is married with two children. Jeanne owns a small business selling various products such as salt, rice, sugar, cosmetic products and so on. Jeanne has five years of experience. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day. Jeanne is the leader of a group of three people with different businesses. 

Jeanne and her group are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. She will purchase additional products needed by her customers. With this loan, Jeanne and other members of the group will be able to expand their business which is the best way to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen V. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 42 years old. Helen is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, detergents, sugar, snack foods and canned goods in the local community. Helen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Helen is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu O. is a 32-year-old clothes and shoes dealer in Mtwapa, Mombasa. She is divorced but supports three children and she has been in this business for the last four years with an income that is able to take care of and provide for her family.

With this, her first loan from KADET, she hopes to purchase bales of clothes for resale and use the anticipated profits to educate her children and expand her business.

In the future, she hopes to own a big store and sells more clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline T. is a widow who lives in Sitio Kan-upla, Sto. Niño, Malabuyoc, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a peanut products business and a fish vending businesses. She has 5 children who are between 9 to 25 years old, 1 of her children has a family, 2 are working and 2 are currently going to school. Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 6 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 19000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 24000, increasing the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29500, which she intends to use to pay for the  purchase of raw materials. Evangeline T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: C5503 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Marie Louise is 26 years old and married with two children aged one and three years old.  Marie Louise is the president of a group called C5503 TUZAMURANE. The members of this group all sell fish for a living. This is Marie Louise's second successful year in her business, which employs one other person and is open from 8am-10pm every day.

Marie Louise has requested a loan to buy more fish for her business.  With this loan, she hopes to earn more profits to continue to invest in the business.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Pedro Rodolfo

texts.es:
Pedro Rodolfo R. B. tiene 59 años de edad, Es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Pedro Rodolfo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es mejorar la calidad  de sus productos.

Le gusta escuchar la palabra de dios.
texts.en:
