Pedro Rodolfo R. B. is 59 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 4 children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Pedro Rodolfo is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and makes his sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his rice, banana, corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to improve his quality of his products.  He enjoys listening to the word of God.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Meng

texts.en:
Meng P. is 32 and married with a child. She lives with her family in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Meng is employed at the local factory and earns a daily income of 2 USD. Her husband produces traditional cakes and earns a daily income of 3 USD to help cover the family’s expenses. Each month, the family has to spend 40 USD on food and 60 USD on other necessary expenses. 

Meng is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase supplies to improve her husband’s cake production business. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner. In the future, Meng would like to use any additional income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cake production supplies

loans.name: Aracely Guadalupe

texts.es:
Aracely, tiene 54 años D. edad, resiD. en Jucuapa departamento D. Usulután, se dedica al destazo D. cerdos y venta D. queso, vive con su esposo y sus hijos D. 15 y 18 años D. edad; El negocio inicio cuando ella era muy joven y actualmente lo tiene en el mercado municipal D. Jucuapa, lo atienD. D. 6:00am a 4:00 todos los días.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar cerdos y queso, los cerdos para destazar y comercializar su carne y el queso igualmente, este préstamo le ayudara para adquirir lo que necesita para continuar en el negocio, y recibir ganancias para su familia.
Sus sueños en torno al negocio es crecer cada día, mejorar su mercadería y atender bien a los clientes. Con su familia espera mejorar su condición económica y estar unidos trabajando para que sus hijos tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Aracely is 54 years old and lives in Jucuapa in the department of Usulután.  She butchers pigs and sells cheese for a living.  She lives with her husband and their children ages 15 and 18.  She started her business when she was very young and it is currently located in the Jucuapa town market.  She works from 6:00 am until 4:00 every day.  

She is currently requesting a loan to purchase pigs and cheese.  She will butcher the pigs and sell the meat as well as the cheese.  With this loan she will be able to purchase the things she needs to keep her business running and earn an income for her family.  Her dreams for her business are to grow every day, improve her merchandise and to give her customers good service.  She hopes to improve her family's economic situation and to work together to give her children a better future.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and cheese

loans.name: Fe Compo's Group

texts.en:
Fe C. is from the village of Labo, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has  two school-aged and two adult children. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Fe C.’s Group". 


To make a living, Fe owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:  

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. 

About Group Loans
In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Eli Jose

texts.es: Eli José tiene 45 años, el negocio del Señor Eli es una pulpería donde ofrece arroz, frijoles, azúcar, golosinas, pan, jugos, refrescos naturales, detergentes jabón entre otros productos, son productos para el consumo del hogar. Además de esto Eli es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su medio de vida, la mayoría de sus clientes le solicitan una gran variedad de productos es por eso que muchos de sus vecinos recorren a su local en busca de la buena atención. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos y jugos. Su deseo es obtener la estabilidad económica necesaria para su familia.
texts.en: Eli Jose is 45 years old and has a grocery store business where he sells: rice, beans, sugar, candy, bread, juices, natural soft drinks, and laundry detergents amongst other domestic products.  Eli is also a very responsible person who enjoys his livelihood.  The majority of his clients demand a wide variety of products which is why many of his neighbors come to his location in search of great service.  The loan is to purchase basic grains, candies, soft drinks, and juices.  His wish is to become economically stable for his family.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Agustina

texts.es:
Maria Agustina R. R. tiene 37 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos solteros en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO ENMANUEL se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Juan  pertenece al Cantón Guaranda, esta ventanilla de 17 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, trigo, papas en grandes cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas. Compra sus productos en Comercial Silva cada fin de semana por la comida de los animales y los vende en la feria de los jueves en la Ciudad de Guaranda.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz trigo, papas y  compra de  animales además para insumos de alimentación e insumos para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un terreno para seguir sembrando para que los ingresos aumenten para dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta trabajar, descansar, salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Maria Agustina R. R. is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her single children in the Canton of Guaranda within the Province of Bolívar. She has six children.

The members of the Grupo Emanuel Communal Bank are located in the Precinct of San Juan, which belongs to the Canton of Guaranda. This bank has 17 members who work farming short-cycle crops like corn, wheat and potatoes in large quantities, as well as raising animals like pigs and chickens.

Maria works in agriculture growing corn and raising pigs and chickens. She buys her products every weekend at Comercial Silva and the animal feed. She sells them at the Thursday market in the city of Guaranda.

She is requesting the loan to plant corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals as well as food and farming supplies. The loan will help her financially to cover her needs. She faces challenges such as pests and diseases, as well as the change in weather. Her dream is to have a piece of land to continue farming so that her earnings increase and she can provide her children with an education.

She likes to work, rest, and go out with her family.

loans.use: to plant corn, wheat and potatoes, and to buy animals as well as food and farming supplies

loans.name: Manuel Jose

texts.es:
Manuel José C. C., tiene 58 años de edad, es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en San Miguel  en el Recinto Tangara perteneciente a la Provincia de Bolívar.

Esta Ventanillas se llama CAMPECINOS UNIDOS  esta ubicada en el recinto Tangara y se encuentra a unos 15 minutos del Cantón San Miguel, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura y al comercio.

Manuel se dedica al trabajo de campo en la agricultura en especial al siembra de maíz para vender en grano seco.
Comprar sus productos en San Miguel y los vende en la Feria del mismo Cantón.

El crédito lo solicita para la comprar de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes y semillas, el crédito apoyado en el negocio familiar ya que produce mas y se tiene que trabajar para pagar la deuda. Su sueño es tener animales para vender.

Los desafíos que se enfrenta son plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Le gusta hacer deporte y trabajar en la tierra.
texts.en:
Manuel José C. C. is 58 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel in the Tangara area, which belongs to the Province of Bolívar.

The name of this communal bank is “Campesinos Unidos” and it is located in the Tangara area, 15 minutes from the Canton of San Miguel. The members of the communal bank work in farming and in business.

Manuel works in the field of agriculture, especially in planting corn to sell dried. He buys his products in San Miguel and sells them at the market in the same canton.

He is requesting the loan to purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and seeds. The loan will help his family business, as he will produce more and he needs to work to pay off the debt. His dream is to have animals to sell.

The challenges he faces are pests and diseases among his crops. He likes to play sports and work the land.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Teresa Amparo

texts.es: Teresa tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos que son independientes. Vive en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío  San Isidro en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos de agua y luz. Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta de helados y gelatinas en su domicilio, contando con equipos y refrigerador necesario para su negocio. Por el calor intensa que hace en su caserío, sus productos refrescantes son de gran demanda. Ella lleva 4 años realizando este negocio. Desea seguir creciendo en su negocio y por ello, solicita un préstamo de 1600 nuevos soles para la compra de más insumos para preparar sus gelatinas y helados.  También pretende hacer mejoras en su las partes de su vivienda donde vende sus productos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old, single and has two grown children. She lives in her own home in the village of San Isidro in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone in the region of Piura, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the region of Lambayeque. She lives in the rural part of the district and they don't have basic services like water and electricity.

Teresa prepares and sells ice creams and jellos in her home, and has the equipment and refrigerator necessary for her business. Because of the intense heat in her village, her refreshing products are in great demand. She has been doing this for 4 years. She wants to continue increasing her business and for that reason has asked for a loan of 1600 nuevos soles to buy more ingredients to prepare her gelatin and ice cream. She also hopes to make improvements in the parts of her home where she sells her products.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare gelatin and ice cream

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen O. is from the village of Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 43 years old. Carmen is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Carmen owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income for the business comes from manufacturing & selling woven mats to local businesses and community members. Carmen has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Carmen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carmen is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture woven native mats. This will be the first loan taken out by Carmen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture woven native mats.

location.town: Bobongan, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sayfo

texts.ar: سيفو عمره 54 سنة متزوج واب ل 6 اولاد يعمل في بيع الدجاج له في عمله 7 سنوات له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث ساهم القرض السابق في دعم عمله وكان يلقى العم الكامل من العائلة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى شراء مولد للكهرباء و ماكينة للدجاج حيث يتمكن من زيادة مدخوله ودعم عمله وتطويره وهو طموح يريد ان يؤمن العيش الجيد له ولعائلته يعاني ضعف في الرأسمال في العمل حيث انه يتعرض لمنافسة قوية في العمل يمتلك مهارات عاليه في العمل وه ملتزم ومقصد من جيرانه اقاربه واهل منطقته
texts.en: Sayfo is a 54-year-old married father of 6 children. He works in the selling of poultry and has been doing this for 7 years. He has a good credit history with al-Majmoua and his last loan supported his business a great deal. He has the full support of his family. With this loan he wants to purchase a new electricity generator and a new machine for the chickens in order to increase his income and develop his business. He is ambitious and wants to secure a good standard of living for himself and his family. He suffers from lack of financial capital and strong competition in the market. He has distinguished skills and is disciplined. He is the local service provider for many of his neighbours, relatives and local residents.

loans.use: to purchase a new electricity generator and machine for the chickens

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child, who is currently in school.  Jane has a business of selling bread, which she has had for one year.         

To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more bread for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Jane hopes to go back to school and complete her studies.  Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her to make new friends.

loans.use: to purchase more bread for resale.

loans.name: Baktabu's Group

texts.en:
Baktabu is the leader of this group. She is 35 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she is raising two sons. The first son is in school, and the second is not yet, since he is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money to cover their daily needs, the family breeds livestock and resells it at a higher price after the animals have been fattened. Baktabu also sells milk and eggs to contribute additional money to the family budget. With money received from the loan, Baktabu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding. She dreams of purchasing a big house for the family in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Emelinda has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Emelinda is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Emelinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne, a 28-year-old married mother of an eight-year child, has been running her salon business for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 6,300, some of which she saves and some of which she uses for the business.

Everlyne is requesting her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD to purchase beauty/cosmetic products and hair extensions for sale and for use in the salon. She plans to use the anticipated profit to save and open her own salon, as she currently works from the house.

loans.use: to purchase beauty/cosmetic products and hair extensions for sale and for use in the salon.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 44 years old.  She is from the village of Nabakevi, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her husband, Longinoz, two sons (17 and 13 years old) and 69 year-old mother (retired). The boys study at school. 

Tsitsino and Longinoz work on the family farm. The family owns 2 milk cows and 2 calves. They produce approximately 40 kg of cheese per month. It is sold at Samtredia open market. Along with the dairy, Longinoz also works on one hectare of family-owned land, where nuts and tomatoes are grown.  On average, he sells 300 kg of nuts and 500 kg of potatoes per year. 

The average monthly income of the family is 460 Laris per month, including Tsitsino’s pension, she gets from the state because of her health problems. 

Tsitsino requested a loan for house renovations. She will purchase materials for the renovation. The biggest part of the renovation work will be done by Longinoz. The house will become more comfortable after the renovation and the living conditions of the family will improve.

loans.use: to purchase materials for house renovation

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es madre soltera y tiene cuatro hijo que ya son mayores de edad y tiene su propia familia, solo tiene un hijo bajo su responsabilidad que actual mente esta estudiando. 
Doña Alicia tiene ya más de dos años con su negocio de venta de dulces para las fiestas, y este tipo de negocio no hay en su colonia, así que tiene muchas ventas.
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en comprar de mercancía que es más variedad de productos que son artículos para fiestas de cumpleaños. 
También quiere invertir en comprar artículos escolares, como es cuadernos, lápices, colores, biografías y pegamentos, 
El negocio tendrá mas variedad de mercancía y mas ingreso, ya que sus clientes el están solicitando que tenga esto productos a la venta. 
La señora Alicia es clienta distinguida en FVP a pagados ya cinco créditos puntuales mente.
texts.en:
Señora Alicia is a single mother with four children who are now grown-up and have their own families. She only has one child  for whom she is responsible and that child is currently studying.

For the last two years, Señora Alicia has been running a  business selling candy for the holidays. This type of business is unique in her neighborhood, so she makes many sales.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise that includes a greater variety of products such as items for birthday parties.

She also wants to invest in buying school supplies, such as notebooks, pencils, crayons, pens and glue. The business will thus have a greater variety of merchandise and more income, as her customers are asking her to sell these products. 

Señora Alicia is a distinguished client of FVP; she has already punctually repaid  five loans.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to invest in and diversify her candy store business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for his herd of pigs.

loans.name: Las Triunfadoras De Huampani Group

texts.es:
Mariana es integrante D. la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras D. Huampaní” grupo conformado por 09 personas dedicadas a diversas actividades comerciales. 
Mariana asume el cargo D. secretaria en el grupo, tiene 43 años es casada con 04 hijos los cuales 02 todavía depenD. ella, viendo que los ingresos del esposo no alcanzaban Mariana toma la decisión D. apoyarlo, ella se inicio vendiendo productos D. belleza la cual poco a poco fue ganando clientes, y por consiguiente sus ingresos se vieron  incrementados, teniendo el deseo D. querer surgir emprendió un nuevo negocio comprado 2 maquinas para poder alquilarlas en la actualidad cuenta con 6 computadoras la cual las alquila en su vivienda, con el fin D. implementar su negocio ha solicitado un  préstamo para la compra una impresora donD. pueda brindar servicio D. impresiones. El deseo D. Mariana es D. seguir trabajando bien,  para así posteriormente comprarse un carro para servicio D. movilidad. La Alcancía Comunal “Las Triunfadoras D. Huampani” están muy contentos y agradecen al Programa- Prosperidad. La Sra. Sonia no pudo estar presente por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Mariana is a member of the communal bank "Las Triunfadoras D. Huampani" which is comprised of nine people who are involved in different commercial activities.  She is the secretary of the group.

Mariana, 43, is married and has four children, two of which still live with her.  Since her husband's income was not enough to cover expenses, Mariana decided she wanted to help out and started selling beauty products.  Little by little she was able to take on customers and her income began to grow.  She then started a new business and bought two computers for rental purposes.  Now she has six that she rents out in her home.  In order to continue growing she has requested a loan to buy a printer so she can add that to her services.  Mariana's dream is to continue working so she can buy a car and proviD. transport services.  

The communal bank "Las Triunfadoras D. Huampani" is very happy and grateful to the Prosperity Program.  Mrs. Sonia could not be present for the photo because of work.

loans.use: To buy a printer.

loans.name: Benedicta Albertina

texts.es:
Benedicta de 30 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene su propio negocio. Comenzó sola trabajando desde muy temprano. Poco a poco mejoro su pequeño negocio el cual es una tienda pequeña. Trabaja en la actualidad desde las 06h00am hasta las 21:00pm todos los dias. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso ella quiere con el préstamo comprar arroz, carnes, vegetales ya que son los que más se venden en el sector por donde vive. Tiene dos hijos que estudian en una escuela fiscal por eso ella quiere mejorar su negocio para darle una mejor vida a ellos.
texts.en:
Benedicta is 30. She is a hard-working woman who has her own business. She began working on her own from an early age. Little by little, she improved her small business, which is a small store.  Currently, she works from 6:00am to 9:00pm every day. 

She has a lot of ambitions for her business. That's why she wants to use the loan to buy rice, meats, and vegetables, as those are the things that sell the most in the neighborhood where she lives. She has two children who study at a public school, and that's why she wants to improve her business, in order to give them a better life.

loans.use: To buy rice, meats, and vegetables.

loans.name: Merissa

texts.en:
Merissa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
Merissa has a retail shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay like bed sheets. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell.

Merissa is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merissa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ukay-ukay (second hand clothing) to sell

loans.name: Marcial Salvador

texts.es:
Don Marcial, sigue con su puesto de venta de zapatos en variedad para dama, hombres y niños,  su especialidad es el zapato deportivo que se vende mucho, estos zapatos los vende nuevo y de  segunda mano, pero de buena calidad. asi mismo ha introducido ropa nueva, permitiendo tener mas ingresos.
Atravez de los años, ha logrado la captacion de los clientes, por mantener buenos precios. Su esposa le apoya con la venta y tambien vende productos lacteos.
Con este nuevo financiamiento comprara  cuatro cajones de zapatos en variedad, cada caja trae doce pares, lo mas demandado por sus clientes son  adidas, nike, reeboock. Comprando calidad.
texts.en:
Marcial continues with his shoe stand selling an assortment of shoes for women, men and children.  His specialty is athletic shoes which sell very well.  He sells both new and second-hand shoes but of good quality.  He’s also started selling new clothes to earn more income.

Throughout the years he’s managed to capture customers because his prices are good.  His wife helps him with the sales and also sells dairy products.  

He will use this loan to buy four cases of assorted shoes.  Each case contains twelve pairs.  What his customers demand most are Adidas, Nike and Reebok – they buy quality.

loans.use: to buy four cases of assorted shoes.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor, a 29-year-old housewife, started a small business at home selling kitchen items such as cups, plates, trays, etc., two years ago. The reason Noor started her business is to support her family of two kids and her husband, who is an employee at one of the Jordanian companies. Now Noor has applied for this loan to add new types of kitchen items, such as pans, and to include more home products like vases.

loans.use: to add new types of kitchen items, such as pans, and include more home products like vases.

loans.name: Jitta

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Jitta.  She is married, and has 4 children aged 20,14, 8 and 5.  She also has 4 additional dependents, who live with her.  

In 1996, Jitta established her Cosmetic and drinks business.  Working 7 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,300, 000 every month.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 to buy soft drinks and cosmetics for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, Jitta plans to build a house, open a bigger shop and educate her children to the university level.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic and drinks for her business.

loans.name: Yohanis

texts.en:
Yohanis, a 32-year-old man, is married to Yunita, a 26-year-old lady. They have a son named Alfa, 1 year old. Yohanis and family are living in a modest house.

Yohanis is a motorbike mechanic. Prior to running his own business, Yohanis  used to work in a repair shop for two years. As the breadwinner in his family, Yohanis is responsible for covering their daily needs. 

While running his business, Yohanis may have to hire some equipment as he has not not been able to buy his own. Yohanis is thinking to purchase a compressor, inner tubes, lubricant, etc. to support his business.  
 
Yohanis got information that TLM provides an Individual Lending Program to those who want to improve their businesses, particularly for micro and small entrepreneurs.  He is interested in joining the loan program and he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. He really hopes that TLM will approve his loan application so he can improve his business and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor, inner tubes, lubricant, etc.

loans.name: Guillermo Reinaldo

texts.es:
Guillermo de 33años, empezó con su negocio de confeccion desde hace 8 años atrás ya que antes trabaja como guardián y no ayudaba con los gastos de la casa.

En la actualidad trabaja junto a su esposa quien le ayuda mucho en su trabajo, trabajan desde las 7 de la mañana a 7 de la noche.Gracias a Dios no tiene ningún problema hasta ahora en su negocio.

Está casado y tiene 2 niños de 8 y 9 años que estudian en escuela fiscal.Su prestamo lo quiere para comprar hilos y telas. 

Su meta es poder incrementar mas su negocio, comprando maquinas industriales para poder producir más rápido y mejor su mercadería.
texts.en: Guillermo is 33 years old. He began his manufacturing business 8 years ago, and he previously worked as a guard and did not contribute to the household expenses. Right now he works along with his wife who helps him a lot with his work. They work from 7 in the morning to 7 at night. Thanks to God, until now he hasn’t ever had any problems with his business. He is married and has two children aged 8 and 9 who are in public school. He would like this loan to buy thread and fabric. His goal is to be able to further expand his business, buying industrial machines in order to work more quickly and make better products.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric.

loans.name: Cissy's Group

texts.en:
Cissy's group includes three hard-working women. Cissy is 18 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luweero Region of Uganda. For the past two years, Cissy has worked hard to manage her poultry farm from which she sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 450,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy chicken for resale and will help Cissy generate greater profits.  She will use the profits to buy food and cover other family expenses. Cissy hopes to expand her business in the future. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Cissy's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken for resale,

loans.name: Nyanchok

texts.en:
Nyanchok is 30 years old and is a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan, for five years.

Nyanchok is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Maria Silenia

texts.es: La señora Maria Silenia a sus 38 años de edad es madre de cuatro hijos de 18, 14, 7 y un años y medio de edad, con el ánimo de salir adelante con su familia, desde hace 4 años inicio su propio negocio de venta de mercancía tal como ropa interior, jeans, camisetas, cosméticos y cobijas en donde sus clientes son los habitantes del municipio de la Ceja ubicado al oriente de Antioquia. La señora Maria Silenia ha tenido dificultades debido a que varios de sus clientes se han quedado sin empleo por lo que no le han pagado sus cuentas, lo que se refleja en pérdidas para la señora Silenia. Con el ánimo de recuperarse la señora Silenia tiene la esperanza de que comprando más surtido puede tener nuevos clientes y así mejores ingresos y poder entonces aumentar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Silenia is 38 years old and the mother of four children (ages 18, 14, 7, and 1½). She is excited about moving forward along with her family. Four years ago, she started her own business selling merchandise such as undergarments, jeans, t-shirts, cosmetics, and blankets to her customers who reside in the town of La Ceja, which is located east of Antioquia. Sra. Maria Silenia has had difficulties because several of her customers have been without work, thus preventing them from paying their bills. This has resulted in losses.

Motivated to recover, Sra. Silenia has hope and wants to buy more inventory so that she can acquire new customers in order to generate more income. As a result, she will improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 7 years to 14 years. He describes himself as honest. He operates a stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located at a strategic place. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to pay the rent for a new room for the business. Within the next 5 years, John's business goal is to offer the best tailoring services in his town.

loans.use: To rent a new room for his business.

loans.name: Victor Leandro

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre de 57 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, lastimosamente por diversas razones desde hace varios años se separó de su esposa, desde entonces él se ha dedica a sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo Víctor pudo estudiar pequeños cursos de Gastronomía, los cuales le han servido de mucho para poder poner en marcha su negocio.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Víctor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, gracias a sus ahorros, Víctor pudo comprarse una cocina semi industrial y acondicionar su negocio, antes él vendía Ceviche, ahora ha ampliado su negocio y vende diversos tipos de alimentos.
Víctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mesas y sillas para acondicionar mejor su negocio y poder brindarles mayor comodidad a sus clientes, de esta manera Víctor espera seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder lograr su gran sueño de ver a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 57-year-old man. He lives in the city of Pisco with his son, whom he loves and who is his main concern in life. Unfortunately, for various reasons he separated from his wife several years ago. Since then he has dedicated himself to helping his family get ahead. Thanks to his efforts, Víctor was able to take small courses in Gastronomy, which have been very useful to him as he set up his business. 

On his own initiative, with great effort and dedication, Victor works day after day in his small business selling food. Thanks to his savings, Víctor was able to buy a semi-industrial stove and equip his business. Earlier, he sold ceviche; now he has expanded his business and sells diverse types of foods. 

Víctor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help provided to him, he will be able to buy tables and chairs to better equip his business and to provide more comfort to his customers. In this way, Víctor hopes to continue working and exerting himself so that he can fulfill his great dream of seeing his son become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for his business.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: This is 47-year-old Abdul. He is married and has four children aged 23, 19, 16, and 13. In 2001, Abdul established his drinks business to generate funds to support his children's education. His business is located in the outskirts of town and his main customers are local men and women. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about 1,000,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) every month from this business. Abdul has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan of 5,000,000 SLL in order to buy stocks of stout (1,500,000 SLL), star beer (1,000,000 SLL) and soft drinks (500,000 SLL). He hopes that this loan will increase his stock level and hence his income. In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children, succeed as a distributor for a brewery, and develop his business. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy drinks for his business.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena works hard to support her child. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ma. Elena requested a PHP 2,200 loan through NWTF in order to buy a water filter. She is getting the water filter because she wants to have safe drinking water and a healthy family without any diseases caused by contaminated water. 

Ma. Elena is aware that by using the water filter, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

loans.name: Nikolina

texts.en:
Nikolina V. is 59 years old from the village of Sokol. She is married and has two children. She has worked for more than 20 years as a librarian in the Community Center of the village. 
Her husband buys up milk from the farmers in the neighborhood. As she is unemployed for 10 years they both decided to open a shop for foodstuffs. For that purpose they reconstructed two rooms from their house. 
That loan will be used for basic repair of the car that is used for delivery of goods for the shop and the other part – for new shelf.

loans.use: Car repair and a new shelf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of wholesale grocery stock

loans.name: Edis Oneyda

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Edis Oneyda, and my principal activity is selling dairy products and treats. I have a business in my home, and two years of experience in this type of activity, which generates income to cover the expenses of my family since I am a single mother. At present, my greatest necessity is to buy chairs and tables in order to offer better service to my customers, because now I don't have the furniture to make them comfortable.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Hola mi nombre es Edis Oneyda, mi actividad principal es la venta de productos lactos y golosinas, cuento con un negocio en mi casa de habitación, con 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera. Actualmente mi mayor necesidad es la compra de sillas y mesas para poder ofrecer un merjor servicio al cliente ya que no cuento con el mobiliario para mayor comodidad.

loans.use: To buy 4 sets of plastic tables and chairs.

loans.name: Jorgelina

texts.en:
Jorgelina Ruiz Diaz D. Dure, 48, is married to Victor Mariano Duré. They have 10 children between 11 and 29 years of age. Her eldest son work for the press, two are studying, and one works at a hairdresser. Her husband is an employee in a factory of Coca-Cola as a truck loader. However, her husband's salary does not cover all of the family's expenses.

Jorgelina sells cosmetics so her children can continue studying. She travels to Clorinda, a city on the Argentina border, to buy her merchandise such as perfumes, creams, cosmetics to sell to stores in Villa Elisa. Jorgelina travels by foot or bus since she does not have a car or motorcycle. In order to insure she has enough income, she also sells food products such as onions, potatoes, rice, and oil that she buys from the central market to sell to other merchants. In addition, Jorgelina also sells raffle tickets and travels house to house to sell tickets.

Jorgelina took her first loan from Fundación Paraguaya few years ago to expand her business. Recently, Jorgelina had to put her work on hold for 3 months because one of her daughter spent three months in the hospital due to pregnancy complications. Fortunately, they are well now and Jorgelina wants to continue her work. She needs a loan to purchase perfumes and cosmetics for her business.

loans.use: Purchase perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irma Lorena

texts.es:
Irma is married and has four children. Her husband works in the city's social security hospital. She decided to start her business because her husband's salary did not cover the costs to support their four children. She started to sell refreshments and snacks over a year ago. She pays a little rent for the place where she sells her goods and hopes to increase her sales and improve her and her family's situation. She is hard-working and enterprising, which makes her business successful.

Irma is asking for a loan of $375 that she will pay back in four months. She will use the loan to buy merchandise and increase her stock of products so that she can increase her sales and profit margin to improve her family's quality of life. She and her family are very grateful for the support you give to continue their business.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Irma es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos y su esposo es trabajador en el hospital del seguro social de su ciudad, ella decidió poner su negocio por que con el sueldo de su esposo no cubría para mantener a sus cuatro hijos y entonces empezó a vender refrescos y botanas en un inicio y eso fue hace más de un año, ella paga una pequeña renta por el local en donde vende y desea poder incrementar sus ventas y poder mejorar su situación y la de su familia, ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, por lo que esta segura de poder salir adelante con su negocio.

Irma esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 que ofrece pagar en 4 meses, que lo utilizará para la compra de mercancía y mantener más surtido su negocio y así poder incrementar sus ventas y sus márgenes de utilidad para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Laxmi Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Kumari M. is a 52 year old lady who lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this area farm to make a living. Mrs. M. has seven members in her family including herself. Her husband Mr. Bal Mukunda M. is a laborer in home construction work. Her three older sons are engaged in traditional work making idols and her younger two sons are studying in grade 6 and 5, respectively.

Mrs. M. works as a gas boiler. She fills oxygen in gas cylinders. For her work she seeks a loan to buy carbon. She spends what she earns to pay the household expenses and also to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

loans.name: Lourdes 8 Group

texts.es:
Evangelina is 38 years old, married, with three children. Her husband works as a farmer and she has had a pharmacy for 5 years, as has another member of the group, Eluteria. They will buy medicinal supplies at the laboratories together which reduces the cost of the purchase for them. The both sell basic health and beauty products. Magdalena, on the other hand, has a bakery in her home and she sells to the neighbors in her community. All three hope to increase their income upon expanding the quantity of merchandise that they have in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

EVANGELINA , TIENE 38 AÑOS , CASADA CON TRES HIJOS , SU ESPOSO TRABAJA COMO AGRICULTOR Y ELLA TIENE UNA FARMACIA DESDE HACE 5 AÑOS AL IGUAL QUE LA OTRA MIEMBRO DEL GRUPO LLAMADA ELUTERIA . ELLAS COMPRARAN MEDICAMENTOS A LOS LABORATORIOS EN CONJUNTO LO QUE LES REBAJA EL COSTO DE COMPRA AMBAS VENDEN PRODUCTOS BASICOS DE SALUD Y COSMETOLOGIA .DOÑA MAGDALENA EN CAMBIO TIENE UNA PANADERIA EN SU CASA Y VENDE A LOS VECINOS DE SU COMUNIDAD .TODAS ELLAS ESPERAN INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS AL AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE MERCADERIA QUE TIENEN EN SUS NEGOCIOS

loans.use: Purchase products and supplies for their businesses

loans.name: Emelina De Los Santo

texts.es:
Nicaragua is known as a country with many working women, and among them we find Señora Emelina Martinez, who has dedicated herself to the sale of food and drinks for 7 years in the Mayoreo market in the capital. She began her business with an investment of C$6000 (six thousand cordobas), with which she obtained, with the support of her husband, the equipment she needed for this work. Later, as the years passed, sadly she separated from her husband and became primarily responsible for the care of two small children who today she struggles to provide with shelter, education and nutrition. As she is aware of the need to care for her little ones, Señora Emelina has acquired loans from Ceprodel, with which she has purchased raw materials to produce food and therefore to obtain greater income to care for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva translator

Nicaragua se caracteriza por ser un país lleno de mujeres muy trabajadoras, entre ellas encontramos a la señora Emelina M. quien desde hace 7 años se ha dedicado a la venta de comida y refrescos en el mercado Mayoreo de la capital. Comenzó su negocio con una inversión de C$ 6000 (Seis mil córdobas) que los obtuvo por medio del apoyo de su esposo para comprar los enseres utilizados en la actividad, luego por medio de que pasaron los años lamentablemente fue separada de su esposo y le quedo la responsabilidad de mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos quien hoy lucha por brindarles abrigo, educación y alimentación. Al estar consiente de que necesita mantener a sus pequeños, la señora Emelina ha realizado prestamos en Ceprodel el cual le han beneficiado en la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus alimentos y por ende obtener mas utilidades para darle la cobertura a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Mrs. Cheam M., 30, is married with 3 children, staying at home cooking food and looking after her children. After the housework, Mrs. M. uses her time to purchase bananas in her community and resells them to the market, earning around $3 a day of profit. Her husband, Mr. Me Moeun, 37, is also a banana seller. He purchases bananas from his community and resells them to the market, making around $2.50 a day of profit. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase bananas in large amounts to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.use: This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase bananas in large amounts to meet their growing customer demands.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en: Nazila lives in Khachmaz region. She has been in the bakery business for one year. Nazila, bakes "gutab", and sweets. Now she needs a loan of $850 to buy flour and other ingredients to bake bread that she can sell.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: to buy  flour and other products for baking  bread

loans.name: Delicias 3 Group

texts.es:
Josefina Flavia is 58 years old, the mother of 6 children and has worked preparing typical regional food-tamales- for ten years now, every weekend afternoon. With her loan, she will purchase corn, firewood or coal, because these are the primary ingredients needed to make tamales. She belongs to the group Delicias 3 (delights) along with Mrs. Francisca Rutila (who sells typical regional food), Josefa (who sells popcorn and fritters made from flour called Chicharrines), Susana Victoria (who sells sweets), Ana Maria (who sells fish) and Ylda de Jesus (who sells fruits and vegetables).

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

JOSEFINA FLAVIA TIENE 58 AÑOS, TUVO SEIS HIJOS, APROXIMADAMENTE POR DIEZ AÑOS SE HA DEDICADO A PREPARAR UN PLATILLO TIPICO DE LA REGION LLAMADO TAMALES QUE VENDE TODOS LOS FINES DE SEMANA POR LAS TARDES. CON SU PRESTAMO INVERTIRA EN LA COMPRA DE MAIZ, LEÑA O CARBON AL POR MAYOR YA QUE ES LA MATERIA PRIMA PARA ELABORAR LOS TAMALES. PERTENECE AL GRUPO SOLIDARIO LLAMADO DELICIAS 3 JUNTO CON DOÑA FRANCISCA RUTILA (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA DE LA REGION), JOSEFA (VENTA DE PALOMITAS Y DE FRITURAS DE HARINA LLAMADO CHICHARRINES), SUSANA VICTORIA (VENTA DE DULCES), ANA MARIA (VENTA DE PESCADO) E YLDA DE JESUS (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS).

loans.use: To purchase corn, coal or firewood, and condiments.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
A. Margaret sells used clothing. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase sales. She is running out of stock.

She is requesting a loan so she can buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Sobenty Group

texts.en: Ibrahim is the Sobenty group leader who has been with the program for 2 years. He is 29 years old and married with 3 children. He sells clothes in Magburaka town, and his business is the sole source of income for the family. Like other group members, he would like to increase his stock for more income. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le. 3,200,000 for the purpose.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to increase inventory

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim C., 37, lives in Kampong Cham with her husband, Len Em, and their four children. She works out in her field as a farmer and makes US $1.25 each day. Her husband is a traditional musician. Three of their children commute to Phnom Penh for work each day and high gas prices have made public transportation costs unbearable.

Kim C. has asked for a loan of US $300 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work each day and cut down on public transportation expenses. She believes this investment can improve her ability to support her family and can improve her standard of living through savings.

loans.use: Purchase motorbike for commute to work

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 27-year-old entrepreneur who lives in Kisumu, Kenya, with her husband and 4 children. She initiated her cereal and vegetable stall in 2000. Her hard work, determination, and excellent people skills have led to her success. Her profits pay for her household expenses. Elizabeth plans to use the funds from her next loan of US$350 to expand her current business and also to buy a stock of cereals in order to generate more income.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her current business and buy stock of cereals

loans.name: Jessyca

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 32 años, vive con sus padres. Es una joven con muchos deseos de superación, por eso, decidió hace 5 años dedicarse a la  venta de ropa, comenzó con poco capital, ahora ha visto, con el paso de los años, acrecentar su mercadería, debido a los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes.Durante varias horas al día se dedica a ofrecer sus prendas, viaja periódicamente a la ciudad para  adquirir nueva y variada mercadería.Además de esto, también cultiva la papa y maíz, entonces, mientras espera la época de la cosecha, vende ropa, aprovechando mucho más cuando hay ferias debido a celebraciones o festividades regionales.
Jessica quiere superarse y progresar en la vida, además de eso, retribuir a sus padres por lo que hicieron por ella.
Con el dinero que solicita, además de comprar prendas de vestir al por mayor, adquirirá zapatos, y también comprará sacos de abono y fertilizantes para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old, and she lives with her parents. She is a young woman with great desires to progress, and for this reason 5 years ago she decided to begin selling clothes. She started off with a little capital, and over the years she has been able to bring in more merchandise, thanks to her customers' orders. Throughout the day she works selling her wares, traveling to the city from time to time to get new and varied merchandise. Additionally, she grows potatoes and corn. While she is waiting for the harvest time, she works selling clothing. She takes advantage of sales opportunities at celebrations and regional festivals. Jessica would like to get ahead and progress in life. She would also like to repay her parents for all that they have done for her .With the money that she is requesting, besides buying clothing wholesales, she will buy shoes, and will also purchase bags of fertilizer and manure for her next crop.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Add to the clothing she offers for sale, and purchase fertilizer and manure for crops.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, chị Nguyễn Thị Thêm 50 tuổi đã qua 5 vòng vốn vay của Quỹ. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ đều được gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà vịt và thả cá. Với việc chăn nuôi vịt đẻ chứng gia đình chị luôn có thu nhập hàng ngày đều đặn là: 200.000đ, chị có 3 con hiện đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Thi Nguyen, 50 years old, joined the Fund in 2003 and has completed 5 rounds of funding. In every round of funding, her family has used the loans to invest in raising pigs, chickens, ducks, and fish farming. With daily income from the duck eggs, the family always has a steady daily income of 200,000 VND. She has three children who are currently attending school. In this round of funding the family is requesting 9,000,000 VND to invest in raising livestock. Their average income is 5,000,000 VND/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invest in various livestock

loans.name: Tum

texts.en:
Tum U. has owned a beauty salon in the Mwera neighborhood of Zanzibar since 2005. She begins work at 7:00 AM every day and is able to earn a profit of approximately $165 each month. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more of the goods necessary for her beauty salon.

Tum is 27 years old, widowed, and has 2 children.

loans.use: To buy more items to use in her beauty salon

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora es una señora de 38 años, vive con su pareja y sus 5 hijos menores de edad. Se dedica al cultivo de cítricos, actividad que realiza hace 18 años, siendo  la cosecha lo que más le  agrada realizar, ya que le parece entretenido  poder cosechar junto a sus hijos y su pareja. Además, dentro de su comunidad  tienen la ventaja de que sus frutos cítricos tienen gran acogida y demanda en el mercado, lo cual les da ventajas  para trabajar. Aunque lo difícil es poder sembrar y cuidar los terrenos, ya que con el clima caluroso pueden quemarse los productos o ser consumidos por los insectos. Este es su cuarto préstamo, no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en los pagos. Teodora  invertirá en la compra  de  insecticidas y de abonos para su terreno de  cítricos.
texts.en:
Teodora is a 38 year old woman, lives with her partner and their 5 young children. She is dedicated to cultivating citrus, an activity she has done for 18 years. The harvest is what pleases her the most because it seems fun to be able to reap alongside her children and her partner. Moreover, within their community they have the advantage that their citrus fruits are very welcome and in demand in the market, which gives them advantages to work. Although, it is difficult to sow and care for the land since the products can be burned by the hot weather or be eaten by insects. This is her fourth loan, she has not had any problem with payments. Teodora will invest in the purchase of insecticides and fertilizers for her citrus field.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
Фарход парень 28 лет женат , имеет 3 детей.Проживает в отдалёном кишлаке Хамровод, Гафуровском районе.
С малых лет он помогал отцу по уходу за скотом.Теперь став самостоятельным семьянином он ведёт свой бизнес по откорму и  продаже крупного скота.Он на сегодня имеет две большие коровы и 5 баранов. Фарход обратился в Микроинвест чтоб увеличить свой скот. Он рад кредитоваться в дальнейшем и продолжать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Farhod is a 28-year-old guy, who is married with three children. He lives in a remote village of Hamrovod, Gafurov. From an early age Farhod helped his father to care for the cattle. Now, an independent family man, his business is the fattening and sale of large-horned cattle. At present he has two large cows and five rams. Farhod has applied for a loan with MicroInvest in order to increase his herd, investing in the future to continue his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra A. est âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. Elle est revendeuse de céréales à Lomé, la capitale di Togo. Depuis 3 ans, abra exerce ce commerce et espère avec ce crédit accroître augmenter la taille de son activité en achetant des marchandises pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.
texts.en:
Abra A. is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who are all in school. She is a retailer of grain in Lomé, the capital of Togo. Abra has been in this business for three years. She hopes to use this loan to expand her business by buying merchandise in order to do better in meeting the needs of her ever-growing customer base.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain for resale

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 30 year old Zena M. from Mbeya. She is married with three  children, between the ages of 9 and 15. Zena has been running a clothes business since 1997. She purchases and resells clothing.

She works at the business for 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. Zena currently earns about 250USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 750USD in order to purchase more clothes in bulk for her business. In the future, she plans to start a new business. Zena thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing in bulk

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Mrs. J. is a bonafide resident of Barangay Sinian, Baliangao.  She is married to Mr. Ralp J. and they were blessed with two children. According to her, her rice production project is still in the growing phase.
  
She requests a PHP 7,000 loan amount to defray operating expenses for her rice growing land.  She needs to meet farm expenses such as fertilizers, medicines and labor expenses, especially for the harvesting of the rice.

Aside from her rice production project, she is also earning an income from her "sari-sari" (variety) store. She hopes and prays that her business would expand and earn enough savings for their retirement in the future.

She is thankful for the continued assistance and support of Paglaum, especially now that KIVA is helping MFI entrepreneurs.

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilizers and other farm expenses

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
CARMEN ROSA M. SANTAMARÍA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Rosas”, con su negocio ubicado en el Jr. Zavala N° 600, Distrito de Callería tiene 35 años de edad, 04 hijos menores ellos, su esposo traba en la agricultura.

Consiguió hace 4 años, el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, e implemento su mini restaurant, con el tiempo y la buena atención, así como el buen sabor de sus comidas ha hecho que su restaurant sea bien concurrido, por lo que fue necesario cada vez mayor inversión, y Manuela Ramos siempre la ha apoyado. El préstamo de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, y comprará un saco de arroz, azúcar 08 kg., aceite 12 litros, una docena de platos, vasos, una docena de cubiertos, ambientación de su local, ahora tiene mayor trabajo y requiere el apoyo de sus hijo.

Muy agradecida de Manuela Ramos por confiar en ella, se siente contenta porque las incentiva a salir adelante y colaborar con los ingresos familiares y no estar esperando solo al esposo, sin hacer nada en casa.
texts.en:
CARMEN ROSA M. SANTAMARÍA belongs to the “Las Rosas” (The Roses) Communal Bank, with her business located at Jr. Zavala N° 600, Callería district. She is 35 years old, has 4 young children and her husband works in agriculture. 4 years ago she received her first loan for S.300.00 Nuevos Soles, and she opened her mini restaurant. With time and good customer service, as well as the good flavor of her food her restaurant has become popularly frequented. So as her business has grown she has needed a greater loan, and Manuela Ramos has always helped her. The loan for S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles will be used to buy a sack of rice, 8 kg of sugar, 12 liters of oil, a dozen plates, glasses, a dozen place settings, decorating her locale, now she has greater work and she needs the support of her children. Grateful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in her, she feels content because she is motivated to succeed and help with the family income and not be just waiting for her husband with nothing to do at home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, oil, plates, glasses, place settings, and decorations

loans.name: Duong Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Dương Thị T. năm nay 47 tuổi, gia đình chị có hai con đã trưởng thành. Chị là thành viên của Quỹ Tình thương từ năm 1992. Ban đầu chị vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn T. chính cho gia đình chị là từ kinh daonh INTERnet  với T. nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. 
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm máy tính phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dương Thị T., 47 years old, has two grown children. She has been a member of the TYM Fund since 1992. When she first joined the Fund, she used her loans to raise pigs. Currently, the main source of income for her family is an internet cafe, earning them 3,000,000 VND (172 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to buy more computers for her family’s internet cafe.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Internet cafe

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel R. es padre de tres hijos a los que tiene que mantener y brindarle todas las condiciones para que ellos se desarrollen.

La problemática que atraviesa en su vivienda es que en su localidad no hay acceso a la energía eléctrica y por esto muy confiadamente ha adquirido un panel solar para beneficio propio y de su familia. Al haber adquirido el panel requiere pagar esta deuda a lo inmediato y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita cubrir esta deuda y así seguir adelante manteniendo su hogar y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Daniel R. is the father of three children who he supports, providing the conditions needed for good child development. A problem he came across in his residence is that in their town there isn't access to electricity and for this reason he has trustingly purchased a solar panel for the benefit of himself and his family. Upon having bought the panel he needed to pay the debt immediately, which motivated him to go to Ceprodel to request a loan that will allow him to cover his debt while supporting his home and his children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Solar panel payment

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To advance their businesses

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 23 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo en su casa propia. Desde su niñez se dedica a la agricultura, crianza y venta de animales, todos los días, junto a su esposa cuidan de sus tierras de cultivo, y llevan a sus animales al campo donde haya abundantes pastos frescos para alimentarlos. El producto que principalmente cultivan es la papa, por el momento, Juan siembra en tierras que le cedieron sus padres, y su experiencia como agricultor le dice que las mejores ganancias se obtienen de la venta directa de sus productos en los mercados locales, así como la venta de animales en las ferias ganaderas cada 2 meses. Para un futuro cercano, Juan planea adquirir sus propias tierras de cultivo para incrementar su producción. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, es un socio relativamente nuevo en su banco comunal, y ha demostrado responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que ha sido nuevamente considerado para este ciclo. Esto lo motiva a permanecer constante y comprometido con su grupo. Viene solicitando este dinero para la compra de sacos de fertilizantes y abono para sus próximas siembras.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old and lives with his wife and small son in his own home. Since his childhood he has worked in agriculture as well as raising and selling animals. Everyday, along with his wife, he takes care of his land and brings his animals to fields where there are abundant fresh grass to feed from. His principal crop is potatoes and for the time being, he is planting on land that his parents gave to him. His experience as a farmer tells him that he can gain more income by selling his product directly in the local markets, as well as selling his animals in the markets every two months. In the near future, Juan plans on adquiring his own farmland to increase his production. This is the second time that Juan has had a loan with MFP. He is a relatively new member of his communal bank and has demonstrated responsibility with his payments, which is why he has been considered again for a loan in this loan cycle. This in turn motivates him to remain committed to his group. With this loan he will purchase bags of natural and chemical fertilizers for his next crop planting.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: San Salvador Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal San Salvador son D. la comunidad D. Circamarca, Distrito D. Huancaraylla, Provincia D. Víctor Fajardo, las actividades principales D. la comunidad son la siembra D. cereales y la crianza D. animales.
Claudia es casada, tiene 6 hijos, Claudia desD. muy joven aprendió a comprar y vender animales en las diferentes ferias D. la región, la carne lo venD. en la feria D. la ciudad D. Cangallo, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. animales menores. Los sueños D. Claudia son que sus hijos menores culminen con sus estudios.
Mientras que Maria es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Maria tiene una Bodega en su casa en donD. abarrotes en general, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad D. Huamanga, su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y también surtirá su negocio con lencería. Los sueños D. Maria son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The members of Community Bank San Salvador are from the community of Circamarca, district of Huancaraylla, Víctor Fajardo Province. The main activities in the community are farming grains and raising animals.

Claudia is married and has 6 children. From a very young age, Claudia learned to buy and sell animals in the different markets in the region, and sell the meat at the market in the city of Cangallo. She undertakes this activity with the help of her husband, and her loan will be invested in the purchase of small animals. Claudia's dream is that her youngest children complete their studies.

Meanwhile, Maria is married and has 3 children. Maria has a small shop in her home offering general groceries. She acquires her inventory in the city of Huamanga, and her loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar, and she will also stock her shop with linens. Maria's dream is to educate her children so that they become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small animals, rice, sugar, oil, fruit and cheeses.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 35 years old,  married and mother of four children who are currently in school. Akua is a very hard working woman and the family depends on her so much for the family income. She is currently residing at Sefwi Bekwai in the western part of Ghana. She sells pastries like doughnuts in bulk. She prepares them and then sells them by herself through hawking. 

Akua has been doing this for nine years. She requests a loan to buy flour, sugar, margarine etc. used to prepare her pastry. She believes this can improve her profit margin within a very short time and repay the loan. She would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, margarine and firewood etc.

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario Antonio M. Sáenz tiene 54 años. Tiene la actividad económica de taller de carpintería. Hace más de 33 años que se dedica este negocio. Mario dio inicio desde muy joven a esta actividad. Por lo que tenía una familia que necesitaba de ingresos. Mario siempre ha sido un hombre muy responsable, y le ha gustado ganarse el dinero de una manera muy decente y trabajadora. El financiamiento solicitado es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como madera, broca, cepillos, destornillador, escuadras y martillos entre otras cosas. El sueño es mantener esta actividad económica para seguirle proporcionando a su familia el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Antonio M. Sáenz is 54. He has a carpentry shop. He has been in this business for over 33 years. He started this business when he was very young. He had a family that needed income. Mario has always been a very responsible man. He has enjoyed earning money in a decent way by working hard. He is asking for a loan for working capital to buy raw materials like wood, a drill bit, brushes, screwdriver, set squares, and hammers, among other things. His dream is to keep this business to keep providing his family with their daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a mother of two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently working. She is sixty years old and married. She lives with her husband in rented apartment in their community. She is a trader. She sells fresh fish in her community. She also supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community. Margaret buys cartons of fresh fish from the big cold stores in Accra. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. She desires to grow her business and and be able to provide her kids with quality education.

loans.use: To buy fish in bulk

loans.name: Rosas 1 Group

texts.en:
Ramona is the group coordinator of the group Las Rosas (the roses). The group is based in Los Alcarrizos, an industrial town north of Santo Domingo, where running water and electricity utilities are unreliable at best. It is here that she makes her home with her husband and four children in a simple structure comprised of wooden walls and a tin roof, a home she owns but to which she does not have the title.

With this loan, Ramona intends to continue expanding her business of selling shoes door to door to various customers in her neighborhood. She has over two years' experience in this business and will use her loan to purchase large quantities of merchandise at better prices. With the profits her business provides, Ramona intends to invest in school supplies for her children and continue investing in her business. Her long-term dream is that her children grow up to be important members of her community. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities of shoes at a better price

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una persona emprendedora y muy alegre, tiene 54 años de edad, madre de cuatro hijos mayores de edad, todos independientes, se dedica a la decoración de ambientes para todo tipo de agasajos, ella trabaja junto a su hermana en esta actividad donde ambas son socias y se esfuerzan para ser cada día mejor su trabajo prueba de ello es que sus servicios se han incrementado y requieren de personal para hacer las decoraciones, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al negocio de la madera. Empezó con un préstamo de 300 soles, que invirtió en la compra de infladores de globos, telas, tecnopor. Actualmente requiere un préstamos de 3000 soles, el cual invertira en la compra de sillas, telas, etc. La meta de Nancy es comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y tener un local propio para su negocio de decoración bien implementado.
texts.en:
Nancy is an enterprising and very happy person. She is 54, and she has four grown and independent children. She decorates places for all types of parties. She works and her sister work as partners in this activity . They put forth effort so that each day their work is better. The proof of this is that their services have increased, and they need to hire people to make the decorations. She counts on her husband’s support; he is in the wood business. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy balloon inflators, fabric, and Styrofoam. She currently needs a loan for 3,000 PEN, which she will use to buy chairs and fabric, etc. Nancy’s goal is to buy display cases to show her products and to have her own location for a well established decorating business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chairs and fabric, etc.

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Mrs. Yom O. is a villager in Prey Choeur Teal village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Aum Khum, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field which they use to cultivate both rice and vegetables to earn a living.

In this work, they face an obstacle because their field is far from the irrigation system. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Yom O. decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump to pump water to support her field.

Mrs. Yom O. is 50 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate her field

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 33 years old and married to Miriam, who is  27. They are blessed with two beautiful daughters. He was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, through an existing client. He is applying for his first loan with KADET.

He does carpentry work for learning institutions and individuals. He intends to increase his stock of wood and fabric materials for furniture making. With the extra profit he gets, he is planning to purchase a piece of land and build a house for his family.

His hopes and dreams are to expand his primary business of carpentry and open another workshop. He describes himself as a confident, hardworking man who makes quality products.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To increase stock of wood and fabric materials for furniture making

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam tiene 36 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos, con los que vive felizmente en su casa. Con mucha imaginación y creatividad se dedica al pintado de pequeños cuadros, los cuales envía a sus compradores de la ciudad de Lima. A la semana llega a elaborar entre 24 a 25 pinturas, pero en caso de ser cuadros más grandes, como de 1m por 90 cm se demora una semana en cada uno. Estas pinturas sólo las hace a pedido y las vende hasta en 60 dólares, por el tamaño y el trabajo. 
En el caso de no tener pedidos, apoya a su esposo en su telar para el tejido de mantas y frazadas, para que posteriormente ella las venda en los diversos mercados de su localidad. 
Para Miriam, el arte es muy hermoso, pues haciendo su trabajo pierde la noción del tiempo, pero lo malo es que hay temporadas, donde no hay mucha demanda de sus pinturas.

Miriam es la eficiente secretaria de su banco comunal y este es su noveno crédito con MFP, donde la han reelegido para el cargo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo planea invertir en la compra de pinturas y oleo para dar rienda suelta a su arte. Asimismo, comprará lanas y madejas para los tejidos que realiza su esposo.
texts.en:
