Miriam, 36, is married and has two children with whom she lives happily in her house. With much imagination and creativity she devotes herself to painting small pictures. She sends them to her buyers in the city of Lima. She makes between 24 and 25 paintings a week. But, when the pictures are much larger, 1 meter by 90 cm, it takes her a week for each one. She only makes these paintings by order. She sells them for up to $60, depending on size and the amount of work. When she does not have orders, she helps her husband weave shawls and blankets on his loom. Later she sells them at the various markets in her area. To Miriam, art is very beautiful. She loses the notion of time when she is working. The bad part is that there are times when she does not have much demand for her paintings. Miriam is the efficient secretary in her communal bank. This is her ninth loan with MFP, where she has been reelected for this duty. The money she is now asking for is to buy paints and oils to let her art have free reign. She will also buy wool and skeins for the weavings her husband makes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for her paintings and weavings

loans.name: Mariza

texts.en: Mariza is a 36-year-old married woman. She has four children. The oldest is 11. She is a rice farmer and works hard for her family. She makes sure she can send her kids to school everyday. She wants all her kids to finish college and find a decent job. Her 1-hectare rice field is her sole source of income, so she exerts extra effort to ensure her farm is in good condition. She also joined CEVI to help her in her need for capital. She requested a loan of PHP11,000. She will use this loan to buy fertilizer and other necessary inputs for her farm. This loan will help Mariza get a better income out of her farm and save for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni F. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell. Poni is 24 years old and married to a doctor. She has one child who doesn't go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana  tiene 49 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia.DesD. hace 28 años se dedica a la venta D.  leña al por mayor, abastece a una buena parte D. comunidades aledañas a la zona donD. vive,  para realizar esta labor utiliza  2 instrumentos básicos que son una  motosierra y un camión, los cuales  adquirió recientemente  para transportar su  mercadería ; su esposo es el copiloto en el transporte y  siempre esta pendiente D. la extracción D. madera y también D.  la comercialización, D. esta forma  toda su familia participa  en el negocio que permite mantener la estabilidad económica . Ana desea tener  más capital D. trabajo para  abastecerse D. mercadería  y  así almacenar gran cantidad D. madera  para tener D. reserva en las épocas D. escasez.Es la  décima vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP y es una D. las socias más colaboradoras D. su banco comunal.El dinero del préstamo  lo utilizará  para abastecerse D. mayor cantidad D. madera y empezar a ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 49 years old, and lives with her husband and four children in their own home. For 28 years she's been selling timber wholesale, supplying a good part of her neighboring communities in the area where she lives. To do this work she uses 2 basic pieces of equipment: a power saw and a truck, which she recently bought to transport her merchandise. Her husband is the co-pilot in transporting the wood, and he is always keeping an eye on removing the wood as well as selling it. In this way the entire family participates in the business and maintaining their economic stability. Ana wants more working capital to stock up on merchandise and thereby maintain a reserve quantity of wood in storage during periods of scarcity. This is the tenth time she has received a loan from MFP and she is one of the most collaborative members of her community bank. The money from the loan will be used to purchase the majority of wood to begin to expand the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock up on timber wood for her business

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo C. A. es un señor que vive en un ejido cerca de la ciudad, como se encuentran a varios kilómetros las tiendas quedan lejos y es por ello que desde hace 15 años puso un negocio de abarrotes llamado “Mini Súper C.” donde se puede encontrar variedad de mercancía como refrescos, botanas, comida enlatada, carnes, artículos para el hogar, regalos y más. En este momento el quiere invertirle mas a la tienda para tener mas ingresos y brindar el mejor servicio a sus clientes vecinos.
texts.en:
Rodolfo C. A. lives in an ejido (piece of land farmed/owned by a cooperative) near the city. Because they are located several kilometers away, stores are far. Therefore, 15 years ago he opened a small grocery store called "Mini Súper C.” where one can find a variety of products like soft drinks, snacks, canned food, meats, home supplies, gifts, etc. Currently, he needs to invest more in his inventory in order to increase sales and offer better customer service.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B., 38, is a tenant of a small parcel of rice farm in Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She is also the mother of a 3-year-old child. Evangeline desires for her business to be prosperous to be able to save money for the future of her family. 

Currently, they are planting rice seedlings. She would like to grow her harvest so that she will be able to get more rice grain. Deep inside, she desires to have her own farm. She would like to ask for a loan of 6,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 21 años, vive al lado de sus padres, hermanos y su único hijo.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos de una reconocida marca, le gusta mucho esta actividad porque su capacidad de persuasión y su buen gusto logran que pueda recomendar a sus habituales clientes, amigas y conocidas el producto ideal, motivo por el cual prefieren comprarle a ella antes que a otra vendedora. 
Esta actividad le parece muy tranquila y rentable, pues ofrece sus productos durante el tiempo que tiene disponible y luego que llegan los productos los reparte y cobra, sin tener ningún contratiempo. 
Para el futuro, tiene pensado instalar un bazar donde pueda vender sus productos en un lugar fijo y con mayor comodidad.

Este es el 4to préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser cumplida en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas, además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal. Cecilia tiene planeado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en productos cosméticos para incrementar su stock.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 21, lives with her parents, siblings and her only son. For the past 3 years she has sold a well-known brand of cosmetics. She enjoys her work very much because her salesmanship and her good taste permit her to recommend the ideal products to her customers, friends and acquaintances. For this reason, they prefer her over other salespeople. She considers this activity to be profitable and peaceful because she can offer her products during her free time. Once she receives the products, she distributes them and collects her fees without any obstacles. For the future, she is planning to open a store where she can sell her products in a fixed locale more comfortably. This is her 4th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is also very satisfied with her communal bank's work. Cecilia plans to use the money to buy a larger amount of stock items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ayawoavi

texts.en: Ayawoavi B. is a 48 year-old single mother of one child. She works in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, Togo selling pharmaceuticals to her community. She began this business in 2007 and is now asking for her first loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to restock her shelves full of the pharmaceuticals that are in high demand. This loan will help support Ms. B.’s family and keep her customers in good health.

loans.use: To buy more stock of pharmaceuticals.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria Margarita tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida en donde ofrece diversos platillos como gallo pinto, cuajada, maduro, queso frito y pollo pues siempre ha disfrutado de este negocio pues la mayoría de sus clientes son su vecinos y ciertas personas que llegan a disfrutar de sus platillos. Esta mujer ha logrado aprender a mejorar la situación económica de su familia pues siempre le ha gustado administrar muy bien su negocio. Sus inicios se dan porque Maria sabía cocinar muy bien y decidió establecer un puesto de comida en su vivienda. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima y así elaborar sus comidas. Ella sueña con seguir manteniendo este negocio que es su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Margarita, 52, sells prepared meals. Her specialties are: gallo pinto (rice and beans), cuajada (a type of cottage cheese), maduro (fried plantain), queso frito (fried cheese), and chicken. She has always enjoyed her work because most of her customers are her neighbors plus some folk that come especially to enjoy her dishes. She has learned to manage her family's finances because she has always liked to run her business well. Her business started because Maria knows how to cook very well and she decided to set up a food stand in her home. She is asking for financing to buy ingredients and supplies with which to make her meals. She dreams with continuing with the business which is her only means of support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Celia's Group

texts.en:
Celia S. is from the village of Baculud, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 48 years old and the leader of a 4-member group loan offered by ASKI.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, each is collectively responsible for paying back the entire loan if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Celia is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Celia owns and operates a service-based business, primarily from providing photography services to local community members.  Celia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

Celia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Celia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to expand her services. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Celia from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 
---------------------------------
About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to expand her business.

loans.name: Lonah

texts.en: Lonah is married to a businessman. They have three girls and one boy between the ages of 11 and 3. Her children attend school. Lonah owns a stall where she serves food and plans to use her loan to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, and milk. She has been in this business for three years and her customers are mainly students and masons, who work nearby. Her main challenge is that the food she has prepared spoils when she does not have enough customers. She joined Yehu because the interest rates are low and she's in their target group. She rents her home which has electricity but no piped water. Lonah's biggest monthly expenses are rent and electricity. She hopes to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil and milk

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie A. is from the town of Guisiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Margie runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $100 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Margie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. She used it as additional working capital. Margie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Бобиева Шамигул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Вдова, имеет 4 детей. Сын, на заработках в России. Сама Шамигул не имеет высшее образование. После смерти мужа занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет земельный участок, где сажает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 17 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en:
Shamigul B. lives in the region of Yavan. She is 42 years old. She is a widow and has four children. Her son works in Russia. Shamigul has high education. After her husband's death she started doing agriculture. At home she has a plot of land where she sows vegetables for resale. She has been in this business for seven years now. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds

loans.name: Savuth

texts.en: Mrs. Savuth S., 41, lives in Sambuor village, Kandal province, taking care of the household, while her husband, Mr. Saren Sor, works as a laborer and a cow breeder.  Mr. Sor's income is essential for supporting the family's financial needs, in particular, the needs of the couple's three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the third one earns money selling desserts. Although all of Mrs. S.'s family members work hard, even their combined income is still very low. To improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. S. is therefore applying for a loan to be able to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow for breeding

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SABALI sont des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, et  en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  des articles divers tels que les  savons (avec SITAN M.), les condiments alimentaires,  les habits pour enfants, les fruits et légumes etc.
SITAN M. compte acheter avec son  prêt  10 cartons de savon auprès des grossistes du grand marché de Sikasso.
Elle vend sa marchandise au  marché de Hamdallaye et en famille à une clientèle composée de femmes au comptant et  souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 29.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et d’entreprendre des voyages à l’extérieur.
texts.en:
The members of the SABALI group are married women, on average 42 years old with four children, and living for the most part in polygamous families in the Hamdallaye borough of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of Mali). This is the group’s first collaboration with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers’ needs. This group of women is active in the retail commerce of various articles such as soap (as with Sitan M.), food condiments, children’s clothing, fruits and vegetables, etc. With her loan, Sitan M. wants to buy 10 cartons of soap from wholesalers at the main market in Sikasso. She sells her products at the Hamdallaye market and through home delivery to women customers, for cash and often for credit. She hopes to reach average monthly earnings of 29,500 FCFA of which part will be used for family expenses and the remainder invested in the commercial activities. Her ambition is to increase her turnover to improve customer satisfaction, and undertake foreign trips.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials such as sand, blocks and cement

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras quienes han formado y desarrollado sus negocios con la ayuda de Adim tanto en la oferta de créditos como con  los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. 

La coordinadora del grupo es la joven Neysi Rebeca C. V. tiene una pequeña librería y comercializa cosméticos y ropa nueva y usada. Esta joven de 25 años inicio con la ayuda de la Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura donde estudio operador en computación  y como forma de apoyarlos les dio un financiamiento para que iniciaran su negocio.

C. decide poner una librería y luego para aumentar el negocio empezó a prestar e invirtió en otro negocio  que es en ropa y cosméticos. Ella actualmente desea aumentar su librería negocio muy bueno especialmente en la época escolar y  con el préstamo comprara  productos para la librería y pacas de ropa.

Las otras integrantes son Idalia U. quien vende frescos, gaseosas y comida casera, y Karla C. de 21 años la cual para poder costear sus estudios y lograr ser una enfermera empezó hace dos años y medio a vender nacatamales, platillo típico que se consume generalmente los fines de semana.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucía group is composed of three hard working, enterprising, tenacious women who have formed and developed their businesses with Adim’s help both through loans and training workshops in Human Development with an emphasis on Gender, Business Development with an emphasis on Gender Focus, Business Interchange and Intercommunication. The group coordinator is Neysi Rebeca C. V.. She has a small bookstore and also sells cosmetics and both new and used clothing. This young 25-year-old started out with support from the Cultural Promoters Association where she studied to be a computer operator and as a way of helping them got financing to start the business. Ms. C. decided to establish a bookstore and later, in order to increase business, invested in a second line of work which is clothing and cosmetics sales. She wants to expand the bookstore which is a very good business especially during the school year. She will use the loan to buy stock items for the bookstore as well as bundles of clothing. The other group members are Idalia U. who sells juices, soft-drinks and home-cooked meals and Karla C., 21, who started to sell nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales, a typical food consumed mostly on weekends) two years ago in order to earn money to pay for her nursing studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, paste, pencils, erasers, scissors, etc. and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Personal expenses (investing in the business that he has, buying basic grains, oil, chicken, snacks, etc.)

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna So (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Thy Chann, have been were married in 1990 and have three children; one son and two daughters. The son and one of her daughters are garment factory workers and another daughter attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers from the capital. 

Vanna has been selling roasted corn for more than five months. Her husband has been a mason since 1999. She has asked for a Kiva loan one time before to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get work. Now her son is a garment factory worker, so she is applying for her second loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas, como empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne etc.
 La  mayoría  son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. 
 Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su primer ciclo en donde se puede mencionar la responsabilidad y unión entre ellas. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amandine, ella trabaja como recepcionista en una empresa y se unió a la grupo de mujeres ya también quiere invertir en un negocio con el que pueda obtener ingresos adicionales a su trabajo. 
La señora Amandine solicita el préstamo para la compra de  ingredientes como carne, verduras, harinas, condimentos y otros, para comestibles ya que los fines de semana elabora varios tipos para vender en su barrio en las actividades que el comité realiza como por ejemplo ferias de comidas y otros.
texts.en:
The members of this committee are involved in a variety of activities among which we can mention: sale of clothes, snacks like turnovers, tortillas, croquettes, roasted meats, etc. Most are mothers and heads of household who sacrifice daily to get ahead. The committee is in its first cycle and they show responsibility and unity among themselves. One of the members is Amandine. She works as a Receptionist at a firm and joined this group of women because she wants to invest in a business to earn extra income besides her salary. Amandine is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, flours, condiments and others for food items that she makes on weekends to sell in her neighborhood during activities the committee undertakes like food fairs and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina con 62 años de edad, se dedicada a la siembra y venta de alfalfa, papas y habas, lo distribuye al por mayor y menor a diferentes mercados,  lleva casi 40 años dedicada a este negocio.
Marcelina empezó esta actividad a raíz de que su esposo fue despedido del trabajo en una empresa minera, es así como ellos salieron de la Ciudad, y fueron a vivir a una  zona rural donde compraron sus chacras para el sembrío de diversos tubérculos y frutos, como también flores; hoy en día, son propietarios de un terreno que lo adquirieron en Lima, lograron construir su casa de material rustico (adobe), compraron sus cosas para su uso domestico.
 El préstamo que se le ha otorgado lo invertirá para comprar semillas de papa, ya que requieren mayor capital.
 Marcelina testifica que con la ayuda de EDAPROSPO ha podido mejorar en su negocio,  los créditos recibidos han sido un apoyo para el progreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 62, is an alfalfa, potato and lima bean farmer. She sells her product at wholesale and retail in various markets. She has been in this business for almost 40 years. Marcelina started this activity because her husband was fired from his job at a mining company. That led to their leaving the city and moving to a rural area where they bought farmland to grow various tubers and fruits as well as flowers. Today, they own a lot in Lima, they built their adobe home and bought items for home use. The loan she got will be used to buy potato seed because they need more capital. Marcelina states that EDAPROSPO’s help has made it possible for her to improve her business. The loans she has gotten have been a support to her family’s progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is from the village of Malinao, Gingoog City. She is 45 years old. Jocelyn is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she buys and resells bananas in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth O. is 47 years old. She is from Migori town and is married with six children. Her husband repairs watches in Migori town and helps in the family's upkeep. For the past 20 years, Ruth has operated a cereals business. Through the years, she has created a huge clientele.

Ruth is an old client of KADET LTD and is now applying for her fourth loan with us. She really wants to buy several sacks of maize, especially in this peak season (normally in the months of October and November) when most farmers are harvesting. She will invest the profits she makes back into the business. Her main desire is to be able to build a house for her family in the next two years.

loans.use: To buy several sacks of beans and maize to add to her stock.

loans.name: Bwambara Women's Progressive Group-Rukungiri

texts.en: K. Jackson is 58 years old and belongs to Bwambara women's progressive group-Rukungiri. He is married with 11 kids and to take care of them he has for the last 10 years been running an agro-produce sales business in Rushaya. He has mostly been selling coffee, maize and rice. 500,000 shillings is the amount his business generates for him on a monthly basis. Prior to starting his business, he was a civil servant. He likes to describe himself as trustworthy. With this loan he says he is going to revamp his business with substantial purchases of bags of coffee and rice that he says he will at length resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more bags of coffee and rice for resale

loans.name: Krissia Masiel

texts.es:
Krissia, es una joven de 21 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de ropa y reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán,  ella alquila vivienda y vive con su hijo Brandon de 3 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de ropa visitando casa por casa a sus clientes y también de forma ambulante en el centro de la ciudad, no tiene horario para salir a la venta y lo hace desde hace seis meses.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería, este préstamo le ayudara a adquirir ropa de estilos de moda y tendrá la oportunidad de ofrecer más variedad a los clientes, ella espera que sus ventas le aumenten con esta inversión.
Para Krissia su sueño es tener un negocio bien establecido que le de las ganancias suficientes para dar a su hijo los cuidos necesarios y que crezca sanamente.
texts.en:
Krissia is 21 years old and works selling clothing. She lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazán department. She rents housing and lives with her son Brandon, who is 3 years old. Her business is door to door sales visiting her clients and selling clothing as well as a street vendor downtown. She does not have a set schedule for selling and she has done this for the past 6 months.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise. This loan will help her to get fashionable clothing and she will have the opportunity to offer a greater variety to her customers. She hopes that her sales will increase with this investment. Krissia's dream is to have a well established business with sufficient earnings to provide her son with necessary care so that he can grow healthily.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Antonia de 46 años, tiene una tienda de confites y snack. Vive en una zona periurbana en la perimetral de Guayaquil rodeada de un estero.

Empezó hace 6 años atrás vendiendo confites en su casa para mantener a sus tres hijos ya que no está casada. Tiene su tienda en la casa y trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta 23h00pm.  Como sus hijos ya son mayores de edad ahora ella se dedica solo a trabajar para sus nietos. Vende dulces, galletas, bebidas, arroz, confites. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar confites e implementar tarjetas para teléfonos celulares. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar mas su negocio y hacerlo más visible para los vecinos nuevos del sector.
texts.en:
Antonia is 46 years old. She has a store where she sells candy and savoury snacks. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Guayaquil, on the edge of the estuary.

Six years ago, she started selling sweets from home in order to support her three children, because she is not married. She has her store in her house and works from 6 am until 11pm. Because her children are grown up now, she dedicates herself to her work for the benefit of her grandchildren. She sells sweets, cookies, drinks, rice and candies. With the loan she wants to buy candy and start selling cellphone calling cards.

In the future she wants to expand her business more and make it more visible to neighbours moving into the area.

loans.use: Candy, cellphone top-up cards

loans.name: Praxides

texts.en: Praxides N. W. is fifty years old. She is married and has five children between ten and thirty years old. Her business is located in Kakamega. She owns a grocery store in which she sells such items as cabbages, kale and other vegetables. She has been in this business for twenty years now and has one employee. She sells to the local people. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is that there are very many people in the area doing the same kind of business.  Hence, customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 35,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business and use some of it to pay her children's school fees. Actually, Kes 15,000 will be used on vegetables and the rest will be used for school fees. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and even open a retail shop. She also hopes that in five years time,she will have educated all her children. She describes herself as a determined lady.

loans.use: Vegetables and school fees

loans.name: Jorge Benedicto

texts.es:
Jorge Benedicto M. Z. tiene 23 años de edad, Es soltero vive con su padre en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.


Los miembros de la V.R.C. TRES DE NOVIEMBRE, Esta compuesta por 28 socios y esta a 90 minutos de  la oficina se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Jorge Benedicto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en Mata de cacao y sus ventas se realizan en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de arroz, plátano, maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus padres.

Le gusta el deporte con sus amigos.
texts.en:
Jorge Benedicto M. Z. is 23 years old.  He is single and lives with his father in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.  He doesn't have any children.

The TRES DE NOVIEMBRE community bank has 28 members and is located 90 minutes from our office, in Chillanes canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Jorge Benedicto is a farmer who grows rice, bananas, corn, cacao, oranges and cassava.  He buys his products in Mata de Cacao and makes his sales in the Matilde Esther shopping center and in Bucay.

He is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his rice, banana, corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working so that he can help his parents.  He enjoys taking part in sports with his friends.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Abed Al-Karim

texts.ar:
عبد الكريم في عمر 40 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في بيع الساعات والفوبيجو له في عمله 20 سنة سحي مصلحته يسعى الى
تطوير نفسه وعمله يريد تعليم اولاده ويحلم بان يصبح صاحب مؤسسة مستقلة له لبيع الاجهزة الكهربائية له تاريخ جيد
مع المجموعة يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى دفع الاقساط الجامعية والمدرسية للأولد خاصة ان حلمه هو تعليمهم وتوصيلهم
الى اعلى المراكز الاجتماعية يتميز عمله بالقدة وقلة المنافسة في محيطه خاصة انه استطاع ان يوسع عمله الى البيع بالجملة
ايضا
texts.en: Abed al-Karim is a 40-year-old husband and father of three who has been selling watches and imitation jewelry for the past twenty years. He is determined to develop himself and his business and dreams of one day owning his own electronics store. By converting to a wholesale format, Abed al-Karim’s business has been able to keep ahead of the competition. Going beyond work, Abed al-Karim wanted to ask for a loan from Al Majmoua to pay his children’s tuition, since he is hoping that they will be able to use their education to move up the social ladder.

loans.use: To pay children's tuition

loans.name: Selvin Armando

texts.es:
Selvin de 21 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, se dedica a vender sorbetes, vive con su esposa y su madre, no tiene hijos, y todos trabajan por los gastos del hogar.
El negocio de Selvin es vender sorbetes en una motocicleta, a todos los alrededores de la zona, este negocio es el que le provee los ingresos para ayudar en el hogar con los gastos. Por el momento solicita un préstamo para comprar sorbete y continuar trabajando en la motocicleta.
Selvin quiere lograr un mejor nivel en las ventas siendo mayorista y distribuir para la zona, además de aportar para su familia lo necesario para tener una mejor condición económica.
texts.en:
Selvin, 21, lives in San Rafael Oriente, San Miguel department.  He sells sorbets (ice-cream treats).  He lives with his wife and his mother; he has no children.  They all work to meet household expenses.

Selvin’s business is selling sorbets from a motorcycle throughout the neighboring area.  This   business provides the income to help meet household expenses.  For the moment he is asking for a loan to buy sorbets to continue working with his motorcycle.

Selvin wants to attain a better level of sales becoming a wholesaler for the zone.  He also wants to provide his family with everything necessary to have a better economic condition.

loans.use: To buy sorbets.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch H. is a 54-year-old widower who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. To earn a living, Touch H. drives a motor taxi. Usually, he makes a profit of approximately $3 per day to help meet the whole family’s needs. He was married but his wife died many years ago. He lives with three married children and one who is single. Touch H. says his single son is going to get married soon and he doesn’t have enough money to help him hold the wedding ceremony. To solve this problem, Touch H. is requesting a loan from Kiva to arrange his son's wedding ceremony which will be coming soon.

loans.use: For his son's wedding ceremony

loans.name: Las Sirenitas Group

texts.es:
Grupo “Las Sirenitas” se llama así porque al inicio que formaron el grupo estaba integrado por mujeres y les llamo mucho la atención ese nombre y es por ello que le pusieron así; este grupo esta localizado en la población de Pinotepa Nacional Oaxaca, en la Colonia Cuauhtémoc. Todas las personas que integran este grupo son muy trabajadoras capaces de realizar cualquier actividad por tal de tener ingresos y poder tener una buena calidad de vida. Los integrantes de este grupo son personas de la misma colonia es por ello que se conocen bien; esta integrado por 12 personas 10 mujeres y 2 hombres.  
La representante de este grupo es la señora Ines L. H. tiene 36 años es madre soltera es una mujer muy trabajadora que a sacado adelante a sus dos hijos de tan solo 10 y 7 años de edad ambos niños estudian la secundaria, ella se dedica a la venta de colchas por catalogo, de igual manera a la venta de antojitos, Ines realiza estas actividades debido a la necesidad que tienen para poder mantener a sus hijos y darle una buena ecuación. Ines solicito el préstamo para poder comprar mas colchas y venderlas para tener ganancias y poder sobrevivir económicamente.
La señora Carmen X C. forma parte del grupo tiene 48 años es viuda desde hace 12 años ella tan solo estudio la primaria ya que sus padres eran muy humildes y solo le pudieron dar hasta ese grado de estudio desde entonces se ha dedicado a realizar diferentes actividades para poder mantener a sus hijos, ella tiene 4 hijos: Alfonso de 26 años de edad quien esta casado, Pablo de 22 años de edad es soltero y trabaja, Perla de 20años de edad esta casada y Alma de 18 años de edad esta casada. Carmen tiene un local en donde vende refrescos, sabritas, jugos, entre otras cosas, el local de la señora Carmen esta a 15 minutos de su casa, sus clientes de Carmen por lo regular son los operadores de los diferentes camiones que pasan cerca de su local, ya que su local esta ubicado en la salida de la población. A demás de la venta de refrescos los fines de semana se dedica a vender tamales a los vecinos de su colonia.
Su sueño de Carmen es tener un local en su propia casa y vender más productos para así poder tener más ganancias. Carmen comenta recibido préstamo de otro banco para la inversión de los insumos para la elaboración de antojitos.
Carmen agradece todas las personas que hace posible los préstamos y que apoyan a las personas de bajos recursos.
Las personas que integran este grupo son las siguientes:
Aurelia A. X: De 56 años de edad se dedica a la compra de mercería para la venta.
Ines M. R.: De 54 años de edad se dedica a la compra de ropa para la venta.
Ana Martha G. L.: De 27 años de edad se dedica a la compra de maíz para la venta.
Carmen X C.: De 48 años de edad se dedica a la compra de refrescos para la venta.
Juana Catalina L. C.: De 39 años de edad se dedica a la compra de material para la elaboración de ropa tipica para la venta.
Yuridia M. R.: De 28 años de edad se dedica a la compra de pollo para la venta.
Ines L. H.: De 36 años de edad se dedica  a la compra de colchas por catalogo para la venta.
Rosaelia D. M.: De 33 años de edad se dedica a la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas para la venta.
Alberta C. H.: De 52 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Nestor L. X: De 73 años de edad se dedica a la compra de abarrotes para la venta.
Marcelina G. V.: De 54 años de edad se dedica a la venta de antojitos.

Moises L. H.: De 32 años de edad se dedica a la compra de herramientas para el servicio de albañileria.
texts.en:
The “Las Sirenitas” (The Little Mermaids) group is so named because at the beginning all the members were women and they liked the name so named the group like that.  The group is located in the town of Pinotepa Nacional, Oaxaca, in the Cuauhtémoc neighborhood.  All the members of the group are hard working and capable of doing whatever is necessary to earn income and have a good quality of life.  The members are from the same neighborhood so know each other well.  It has 12 members: 10 women and 2 men.

The group representative is Mrs. Inés L. Hernández, 36.  She’s a hard working single mother who has raised her children who are 10 and 7 years of age and in school.  She sells comforters via catalogue and also sells fast food.  Inés does these things because of the need she has to support her children and provide them with a good education.  Inés asked for the loan to buy more comforters to sell in order to have profits and be able to survive economically.

Mrs. Carmen X. C., 48, is also a group member.  She’s been a widow for 12 years and only finished elementary school because her parents were very humble and were only able to afford that level of schooling for her.  Since then she has been in a variety of activities to be able to support her children; she has four: Alfonso, 26, who is married, Pablo, 22, who is single and employed, Perla, 20, who is married and Alma,18, who is married.

Carmen has a locale where she sells soft drinks, Sabritas brand snacks, and juices, among others.  Her locale is located 15 minutes from her house.  Carmen’s customers for the most part are truck drivers that pass by her locale since it’s located at one of the town’s exits.  In addition to the refreshment sales, on weekends she sells tamales to her neighbors.

Carmen’s dream is to open a locale in her very house and sell more products in order to have more profits.  Carmen comments that she got a loan from another bank to buy ingredients to make the fast food.

Carmen thanks all those who will fund the loan and who support people of limited resources.

The group members are:

Aurelia A. X, 56, buys merchandise to sell.
Inés Martínez Rendón, 54, buys clothes to sell.
Ana Martha García López, 27, buys corn to sell.
Carmen X C., 48, buys soft drinks to sell.
Juana Catalina López C., 39,  buyos fabric to make traditional costumes to sell.
Yuridia Marroquín Ramírez, 28, buys chickens to sell.
Inés L. Hernández, 36, buys catalogue comforters to sell.
Rosaelia Damián Mejía, 33, buys corn to make tortillas to sell.
Alberta C. Hernández, 52, buys groceries to sell.
Néstor L. X, 73, 73 buys groceries to sell.
Marcelina Gómez V., 54, sells fast food.
Moisés L. Hernández, 32, buys bricklaying tools.

loans.use: To buy catalogue comforters to sell.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
don Rene C. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el caserio el Obraje Namasigue Choluteca, Rene es señor trabajador y muy dedicado a su negocio, Rene se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion.
Rene es padre de 4 hijos, los cuales los tiene en la escuela de la comunidad, cuenta con la ayuda de su
esposa cuando el no esta en la casa.
don Rene se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para atender su clientela.
su tiempo libre lo dedica ala crianza de gallinas y cerdos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
la meta de Rene es que sus hijos se graduen de la universidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Rene C. is 45 years old and he lives in the community of Obraje Namsique Choluteca. Rene is a hardworking man who is very dedicated to his business. Rene sells every day products from a small store located in his house. 

Rene is the father of 4 children, who all attend the community school. He is able to depend on his wife for support when he is not at home. 

Rene starts his day every day at 5 in the morning in order to attend to his clientele.  In his spare time he raises poultry and chickens.  The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to stock his grocery store. Rene's goal is to see his children graduate from university.

loans.use: to purchase general store merchandise to stock his business

loans.name: Irene Maria

texts.es:
Irene Maria  nació en Barranquilla y a la edad D. 17 años se casó y se dedicó al hogar para lograr un buen cuidado D. sus 4 hijos, hoy en las edades D. 34 a 43 años y  13 años mas tarD., comenzó a trabajar en una empresa D. confecciones, a quien le debe su experiencia  emprendedora que inició 11 años después y que aun no se ha detenido. Ella comenzó su negocio D. modistería  en su propia casa, mientras su esposo   fabricaba  muebles D. madera, actividad que aun ejerce D. manera independiente.  Irene ha recibido 17 financiamientos D. la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo durante 16 años D. estar vinculada a esta organización, con los que ha logrado formalizar su actividad, crecer y ampliar los ingresos D. su hogar porque adicionó venta D. cosméticos mediante guías especializadas; con su credikiva financiamiento #18 comprará telas, e insumos D. confección así como colonias y ropa interior, que se encuentra en descuento en la revista a través D. la que promociona su mercancía. 
Su sueño a largo plazo es conocer Alemania, país D. donD. es oriundo la familia D. su esposo, mientras a mediano plazo planea continuar trabajando, para  tener un almacén bien dotado D. la mercancía que mas se venD. en los alrededores D. su vivienda , porque su gran desafío es la competencia que responD. rápidamente los pedidos D. los clientes, pero enfatiza que sus  productos  son D. mejor calidad, que los que su s competidores ofrecen y por eso se sostiene en el mercado; ahora sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 5 días, sus inventarios cada 9 y su rentabilidad sobre las ventas no es menor D. un 30%.
texts.en:
Irene was born in Barranquilla and at the age of 17, she married and dedicated herself to the home to give good care to her 4 children, today 34 to 43 years old. Thirteen years later, she began to work in a clothing manufacturing enterprise, to which she owes her enterprising experience, which began 11 years later and which has not ended. Irene began a dressmaking business in her own home. Her husband continues to make wooden furniture, and does so independently.  

Irene has received 17 loans through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo during her 16 years of  association with this organization. Through those years, she has formalized her activity, and increased household income, and she has added sales of cosmetics by means of specialized guides. With this “credikiva” loan #18, she will buy cloth and sewing supplies, plus cologne and underwear, currently at a discount during a merchandise promotion.

Irene's long-range dream is to visit Germany, the country of her husband's family. At medium-range, she plans to continue working, in order to have a store well stocked with the merchandise that sells best in her neighborhood. Her great challenge is competition that responds rapidly to customer orders. But she emphasized that her products are of better quality than her competitors offer. For that reason, she holds onto her market. Now, her accounts must be paid every 5 days, her inventories sell each 9 days, and her profitability on sales is no less than 30%.

loans.use: TO BUY CLOTH AND SEWING SUPPLIES, PLUS COLOGNE AND UNDERWEAR,NOW AT A DISCOUNT

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian M. S. has been selling household goods in Kariobangi south for seven years.  She is married to Boniface, and they have two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend.  She is applying for her second loan to enable her to buy more stock of household goods for sale. The generated income she will plow back into the business.
 
In the future, Lillian hopes to grow her business and to offer her children better education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods, like plates, spoons

loans.name: Makumbusho

texts.en:
Makumbusho is a married man with two children, both of whom attend school. He lives in his own house that has electricity and piped water. Makumbusho’s greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past eight years, Makumbusho has operated a motor vehicle public transport business. His passengers are his customers. In addition, Makumbusho also operates a water-selling business which contributes to income.  

Makumbusho decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase seat covers and repair his vehicle seats. In the future, Makumbusho would like to own another motor vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase seat covers for his vehicle

loans.name: Salome Wangoi

texts.en:
Salome has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 49 years old, and a single mother of four school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan. She repaid her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time. She plans to use the new loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Salome hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco y tiene 49 años edad. (Paucartambo se encuentra a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco). Actualmente, ella vive en la ciudad de Calca y está casada y fruto de esta unión tiene tres hijos. (La ciudad de Calca caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes por ser una zona turística, ganadera y agrícola). Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Clorinda Matto de Turner” de la Asociación Arariwa.  
  
Asunta se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, ella comprar maíz de diferentes lugares como por ejemplo de Calca, Urubamba y Lares. Ella con el maíz elabora jora de maíz para vender a sus vecinas o compañeras del banco comunal que tienen como actividad principal hacer Chicha de Jora. Ya son 12 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que realiza en su trabajo. Con este préstamo de USD. 500 dólares aumentara el capital del negocio, comprará maíz.  

Asunta es una mujer luchadora y su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio. Está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Asociación Arariwa por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Asunta was born in the city of Paucartambo, Cusco Department.  She’s 49 years old.  (Paucartambo is located three hours from the city of Cusco.)  She currently lives in the city of Calca.  She’s married and has three children.  (The city of Calca is noted for its beautiful scenic spots, for being a tourist destination, for its cattle raising and for its farming.)  She is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Clorinda Matto de Turner” communal bank.

Asunta is a corn merchant.  She buys corn in various places like Calca, Urubamba and Lares.  She uses the corn to make “jora de maíz” (fermented corn) to sell to her neighbors or to fellow communal bank members whose main occupation is making “Chicha de Jora” (beverage made from fermented corn.)  She’s been in this business for 12 years now and does very well thanks to the effort she puts into it.  With this USD500 loan she will increase her working capital and buy corn.

Asunta is a tenacious woman whose dream is to make her business grow.  She is very grateful to the Asociación Arariwa Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 67 years old and married with seven children. She earns a living by running a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Emma is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Emma has been in business for 41 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane and selling bananas. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to  grow and expand her business to secure her future.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Joséphine est  salariée, né au Rwanda. Elle est veuve, âge de  49 ans, Elle a 4 enfants entre 15 ans et 28 ans, tous 4 enfants vont  à l’école,  elle n’a aucune personne en charge. Elle  a le niveau des études universitaire de licence en Science économique. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des peintures, des portes, les frais d’installation électriques   et payer la main d’œuvre. Elle n’a aucune difficulté attendue de non-remboursement de son prêt. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son affaire est d’agrandir sa maison pour augmenter sa valeur en vue de gagner les frais de location plus élevé. Sa vision est de construire d’autres  maisons. Pour sa famille, elle voudrait assure l’éducation de ses enfants et payer les frais médicaux pour sa famille. Elle fait aussi les études des projets.
texts.en:
Joséphine is salaried and was born in Rwanda. She is a widow and 49 years old. She has four children, aged 15 to 28 years of age, and all four go to school. She has no dependents. She has a university education in economics. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to buy some paint and gates or doors and to pay for electrical work, as well as labor. She expects no problems at all repaying her loan. 

Her strategy for business growth is to expand her house in order to increase its value with the aim of earning higher rent income. Her vision is to build other houses. For her family, she would like to ensure her children’s education and to cover the medical costs for her family. She also does planning.

loans.use: to buy paint and doors, and to cover the cost of electrical installations and of labor

loans.name: Emmelia

texts.en: Emelia has two years in the business of selling fruits like soft drink, mangoes and pineapple. she request a loan from BRAC south sudan to expand her business. She is 37 years old and married with a husband who is businessman. She has five children; three of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: She want more income to able her purchase more fruits likes mangoes pineapples for sale

loans.name: José Aníbal

texts.es: José Aníbal de treinta y nueve años de edad  vive en casa propia junto a su familia,  posee un negocio de venta de repuestos de bicicleta; es muy conocido en la localidad pues vende mercancía de muy buena calidad y a un buen precio  además  les ofrece un servicio muy especial trata de agradar a todo cliente que lo visita, José es un hombre emprendedor con ganas de salir adelante. Para él, solo una cosa vuelve posible un sueño y es el no tener miedo a fracasar es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar repuestos como llantas, cadenas, aceite, asientos, frenos entre otros; de esta forma tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes y es una buena manera de que su negocio crezca. José Aníbal tiene la confianza de que su arduo trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José Aníba is 39 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He owns a shop where he sells bicycle parts and is well known in his area since he sells high quality merchandise at a good price.  In addition he offers his clients a unique service and tries to please his customers. José is a hardworking man with a drive to succeed in life. For him, there only exists one thing that can make a dream come true and that is to not have any fear in failing. This is why he decided to request INTEGRAL a loan to buy tires, chains, oil, seats, brakes, etc. He will then be able to better satisfy his clients and this will be a way for his business to grow. José Aníbal has confidence in that his hard work will permit him to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: buy tires, chains, oil, seats, brakes, etc.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Ayélé est une femme  âgée de 45 ans. Elle est célibataire. Elle a 02 enfants. 
Ayélé travaille comme couturière et revendeuse de bazins depuis 1996. Elle achète les produits à LOME et au MALI.
Ayélé a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des bazins.
texts.en: Ayélé is 45 years old, single and the mother of two children. She has been a seamstress and retailer of basins since 1996. She buys her supplies in Lomé and in the Republic of Mali. Ayélé came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan to buy basins.

loans.use: to buy high-quality basins.

loans.name: Hernina

texts.en:
Hernina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Hernina has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Hernina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Hernina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy second hand baby cloths to sell.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José, 53 años de edad, originario de la ciudad de Granada esta casado, padre de 4 hijos, el es comerciante, el vende queso tiene 7 años tener este negocio. Anteriormente ya tenia experiencia en el comercio trabajando junto con su esposa, pero decidieron dedicarse a vender un producto de consumo diario, el vende el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Granada y además ese lugar es buen punto para su venta de queso, fue con este negocio que ha ayudado a mantener a su familia y sus hijos con sus estudios. 
Solicita el crédito para compra inventario de queso. Esta inversión le ayudara a poder adquirir inventario más fácilmente y la oportunidad de ofrecer mayor cantidad de queso, satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en diferentes lugares, mejorar sus ingresos. El desea vender más producto derivados de la leche como crema, yogurt, quesillos y cuajadas. Esta es parte de su  meta y ampliar más su negocio.
texts.en:
José is 53 years old. He is from the city of Granada, married, and the father of 4 children. He is a merchant. He sells cheese and has been working in this business for 7 years. Prior to this he already had experience in sales, working together with his wife, but they decided to sell a product of daily use. He sells in the market in the city of Granada, which is a good place to sell cheese. It is with this business that he has helped to provide for his family and help his children with their studies.

He is requesting a loan to buy more cheese inventory. This investment will help him to buy inventory more easily and he’ll have the opportunity to offer a greater quantity of cheese, satisfy the demand of clients in different places, and improve his income. He wants to sell more dairy products, such as cream, yogurt, quesillo cheese, and cheese curds. This is part of his goal to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more cheese inventory

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Mercedes has a retail shop that sells coconut charcoal by the sacks. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy coconut shells for charcoal making.
Mercedes is a new member of HSPFI and hopes to improve her business in future.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Berkis' Group

texts.es:
Berkis es L. coordinadora del Grupo Mujeres en victoria 1 & 2. Este grupo está compuesto por 10 mujeres y hombres empresarios dedicados a las ventas D. ropas, zapatos, cosméticos, entre otros, algunos D. modo ambulante y algunos tienen sus negocios en sus casas. Berkis lleva 13 años con su negocio, el cual es una cafetería, donD. venD. snack o refrigerios, refrescos y comidas rápidas como sandwiches. Inicio este negocio con un préstamo que tomo, y desD. entonces se ha mantenido primero reinvirtiendo siempre parte D. sus ganancias, y desD. hace unos 3 años invirtiéndole los prestamos que toma en Esperanza Internacional, siendo este su séptimo préstamo. 


Berkis invertira este prestamos en L. compra D.  refrigerios, refrescos, pan, jamon, queso, entre otros. Con L. reinversion D. sus ganancias, y otros prestamos, espera poder tener un negocio estable, con buenos ingresos, que le ayuD. a comprar un solar y construir su casa, y despues descansar mas y trabajar menos. Berkis es madre D. 3 hijos, D. los cuales dos viven con elL..
texts.en:
Berkis is the coordinator of Grupo Mujeres en Victoria 1 & 2, a group of 10 businessmen and women who sell clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and other things.  Some sell on foot and some have their businesses in their homes.

Berkis has had her business for 13 years, a cafeteria where she sells snacks, soft drinks, and fast foods like sandwiches.  She started this business with a loan she got, and since then she has supported herself, first always reinvesting part of her profits, and for three years, investing in her business the loans she got from Esperanza Internacional.  This is her seventh loan.

Berkis will use this loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, ham, cheese, and other things.  With the reinvestment of her profits and with other loans, she hopes to be able to have a stable business with good earnings that help her buy a piece of land and build her house, and, later, rest more and work less.

Berkis is the mother of three children, two of whom live with her.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, bread, ham, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, six of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (sisters). Rose has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 4 years, and she works 7 days a week. Rose sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Rose has requested a loan of 100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Rose include the ever-increasing price of charcoal and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going to villages for charcoal and to sell at wholesale only.  Rose lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Tembiapo Pora Group

texts.es:
Tembiapo pora se denomina el excelente grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita, gracias a que la Sra. Luz contactó con la asesora en una de las  reuniones que esta tenía en la zona para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, y una vez asesorada juntó a 16 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando ya en el noveno ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La señora Luz se dedica a la venta de ao po’i (ropas típicas paraguayas, bordadas), nos comenta que tiene muy buena venta, ya que es muy solicitada la ropa de ao po’i. Muchas personas, en especial turistas lo admiran mucho. Ella sueña con poder expandirse y que sus prendas vayan al exterior.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y bastidores, los cuales son esenciales para la elaboración de las prendas que vende. Agradece por la oportunidad que se le da a ella y también a su comité.
texts.en:
These excellent women are members of the Tembiapo Pora group in the city of Ita, thanks to Sra. Luz, who got in touch with an advisor to the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras at one of the meetings she had in the area in order to become better informed about the work the Comité was doing. Once informed, Sra. Luz brought 16 women together, who are now working supportively, in their ninth loan cycle within the program.

Sra. Luz sells ao po’i (typical embroidered Paraguayan clothes) and tells us that she has very good sales since ao po’i  clothing is in high demand. Many people, particularly tourists, admire it greatly. She dreams of being able to expand so that her clothing items are sold abroad.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy thread and embroidery frames, which are essential in making the items she sells. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and also to the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, a program of Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy thread and embroidery frames to make ao po’i  (traditional Paraguayan clothing).

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba. She is married and has two children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells assorted groceries and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Gemma has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Marcelina Teresa

texts.es: Marcelina es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras, tiene 48 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, venD. salchipollos y es feriante venD. cereales, esta en Finca 3 años, durante el tiempo que esta en Finca logró ampliar su capital D. trabajo, con los primeros préstamos que saco se compró su carrito para vender sus salchipollos, ahora tiene buena cantidad D. ahorros, con esfuerzos y esmero logró juntar dinero y cumplió una D. sus metas que fue abrir su recreo, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra D. gaseosas y cerveza.
texts.en: Marcelina is a member of the communal bank Alondras. She is 48 years old and the mother of 5 children. She sells chicken sausages and is a grain merchant. She has been working with Finca Peru for three years. During that time she’s been able to increase her working capital. With her first loans she bought a cart to sell chicken sausages. Now she has plenty of savings. With effort and dedication she’s been able to raise money and achieve one of her goals which was to open a stall. She will invest the loan she’s asking for today into the purchase of sodas and beer.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer.

loans.name: Mulimani Group

texts.en:
.Greetings from Mulimani Group in Western Kenya! Juliana is the facilitator of the Mulimani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Juliana takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Juliana had a very good maize yield harvesting 20 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Juliana was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Juliana and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Juliana will educate her children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Mulimani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows Juliana with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Achol

texts.en:
Achol is 30 years old and is a married woman with six children. All of them are in school. She has had a small restaurant in Bor South Sudan for four years.

Achol is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and beans for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 chickens and build a chicken coop

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tuimarike Ilela Group

texts.en:
Yansint is a 23-year-old married man with one child. He is good at farming activities. He has been producing maize, beans, coffee and cassava for over 15 years. He experiences agricultural problems including the lack of fertilizers and crop diseases.

Yansint is seeking working capital that can be used to pay for fertilizers and insecticides. Again, he has a future plan to expand his crop production from 6 to 15 acres in five years in expectation of earning more income for improving his standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en:
Nduku is 42 years old. She is married to Muinde and they have two children. She has run a dairy farming business for the last 11 years, earning a monthly income of KES 6500.

She is requesting for her first loan with KADET Ltd in the amount of KES 5000. She will use the loan to purchase feeds for her dairy cows. With the anticipated profits she will save to increase her stocks of dairy feed.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale dairy farmer and to become financially stable.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cows.

loans.name: Leoncie

texts.en:
Leoncie aged 32 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 8 years. 2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 6 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and pay school fees of her children and to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en: Donald is 34 years old and married with four children living in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. To make a living, Donald owns and operates a transportation services business. Donald has engaged in his business for many years and earns PHP 10,000 a month from these activities. In 2010, Donald joined GDMPC. Donald is now requesting a loan of PHP 60,000 that will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. Donald wishes that someday his  children will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Jorge Alonso

texts.en:
Jorge is a very friendly and hard-working man. He lives in Monclova Coahuila and is the father of 4. Jorge would like for his business to grow so that he can help to educate his children. He would like to be able to offer them the chance to go to college. He began his business a few years ago, and it is currently growing little by little. However, he would like to give it a boost by buying new material so that his work, such as products from gold, is more efficient. He works repairing jewelry, a trade that his uncle taught him. It helps him to pay for the family\\\'s expenses. He needs a $475.00 USD loan which he plans to repay within 5 to 10 months.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un hombre muy amistoso y trabajador, vive en Monclova Coahuila y es padre de 4 niños. Ha Don Jorge le gustaría crecer en su negocio y prepararse con la educación de sus hijos, ya que le gustaría poderles ofrecer a cada uno la oportunidad de ir a la universidad. Por lo que inició su negocio hace ya algunos años y actualmente va creciendo poco a poco, sin embargo quiere impulsarlo comprando nuevo material que le permita hacer mas eficiente en su trabajo y en productos como oro.

Su trabajo consiste en la reparación de joyería, oficio que aprendió por parte de su tío y que en la actualidad le ha permitido cubrir con los gastos de su familia; el necesita un préstamo de $475 USD y en un término de 5-10 meses planea retornar el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Esther Wanjiku Juma intends to pay school fees for her child

loans.name: Thom

texts.en:
Mrs. Thom L. is 40 years old and is married with 5 children. She makes her living by growing rice crops and some kinds of vegetables in her field which scarcely makes enough money to support her five children 
(one of whom sells live pigs in and to a nearby village, while the rest are in school). To service all the family needs, her husband (pictured here with his business) helps to make additional income by selling live pigs from one village to another. Thom L. is asking for $1000 loan to invest in her husband's business by purchasing more pigs and a motor-bike to transport them for outdoor selling. With this business activity, Thom L. thinks it is possible for her and her family to meet their needs.

loans.use: To buy pigs and a motor-bike to run  a business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 50 years old. She has 6 children. Mary’s wish is to educate all her children. She believes that education, good guidance of our children is a very importance foundation to our future generation. Mary has set a rule for all her children to take education very seriously. One of her children is studying in a local university. Mary operates a small bakery in Thika. She makes doughnuts and sells to the kiosks and retail shops in Weteithie area of Thika. Mary intends to increase her income generation by expanding of her business. Being a member of Muthaiga women group, she has trained on book keeping. This has assisted her to run her business well and to focus on its growth. Mary has applied for a loan of USD 150. She plans to buy ingredients for baking. She intends to employ one more work hand who will assist her in her business. She will repay her loan in 12 monthly instalments

loans.use: Mary would like to buy ingredients for baking

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Mrs. Celestina is 45 years old; she’s married to Melchor Sosa. He is a technician for electronic equipments and they have a 27 year old son. Their son is a university student and he also helps his parents in his micro-enterprise. Celestina and her husband manage two businesses where they provide maintenance, repairs and also sell electronics and auto equipment. They started out as employees and they saved enough capital to start their own business and become independent professionals. They achieved this 20 years ago, and their income multiplied so they opened a new store in the neighboring city of Mariano R. Alonso, which was also well received by the local market. Mrs. Celestina comments that she is very proud of her job and that the most important thing is to give the opportunity to 6 young professionals to have a job. Her dream is to open another store where her son will be manager and create more job opportunities to her family members. She is asking for a loan to buy radios, speakers, loudspeakers and other electronic equipment replacements.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Celestina tiene 45 años, está casada con Melchor Sosa, el es técnico en equipos electrónicos, tienen un hijo de 27 años, es estudiante universitario y también ayuda a sus padres en su microempresa. Celestina y su marido manejan dos negocios en donde prestan servicios de reparación, mantenimiento y venta de productos electrónicos, así también como equipamientos para autos. Se iniciaron como empleados y poco a poco juntaron un capital propio para ser un profesional independiente, esto lo lograron hace 20 años, como los ingresos fueron multiplicándose decidieron dar apertura a una sucursal en una ciudad vecina de Mariano R. Alonso que también fue bien recibida por el mercado local, la sucursal cuenta con 5 años de antigüedad. Comenta la Sra. Celestina que está orgullosa de su trabajo y lo más importante es poder dar la posibilidad a 6 jóvenes a acceder a un puesto laboral. Su sueño es crear una segunda sucursal en donde su hijo manejaría este negocio y así dar más fuentes de trabajo y generar ingresos al núcleo familiar. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de mercaderías tales como: radios, parlantes, bafles, repuestos varios para equipos electrónicos.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías tales como: radios, parlantes, bafles, repuestos varios para equipos electrónicos.

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.en: Omolayo J. is married with 2 children, 30 years of age and has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She sells films, albums, frames. She is also a photographer. She has been in her business since 1996 and she needs the loan of $400 to buy more films, albums, frames for sale.

loans.use: To buy films, albums, frames and others

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa belongs to the Mujeres Virtuosas communal bank, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 54 years old, the mother of 5 children who are grown but who always support everything she does. She was widowed many years ago.
