Thanks to the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she started a business buying and selling milk products.

Currently she has a stand where she sells fresh milk, cheese, manjar blanco (a milk-based dessert) and ingredients for preparing cheese. She also sells bread with cheese, hamburgers and warm milk. She gets up a 4 in the morning to sell her products at the No. 2 market in the city.

With another loan from Manuel Ramos, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will invest in the purchase of packaging to keep the milk fresh, and in fresh cow´s milk and cheese.

Carmen is content to have been working with Manuela Ramos during these 7 years.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Carmen Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Virtuosas, del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 54 años de edad, es madre de 5 hijos ya independientes pero que siempre la apoyan en todo, enviudó hace muchos años. Gracias el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos puso un negocio de compra y venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad cuenta con un puesto de venta de leche fresca, queso, manjar blanco, e insumos para la preparación de quesos, también vende pan con queso, hamburguesas, leche caliente, se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para vender sus productos en el mercado Nº 2 de nuestra ciudad.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos, el cual será pagado en 6 meses, invertirá en compra de embaces para mantener fresca la leche y en leche fresca de vaca y queso.

Carmen está muy conforme en estos siete años que esta trabajado con Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of packaging. Purchase of cow´s milk and cheese.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Tỵ, 52 years old, lives with her husband and 4 children at Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa province. She’s been a member with the TYM Fund for 4 years. The main family’s income comes from fishing and selling fish activiT.. While she sells fish at the open market all her children go out to sea fishing. She takes out loans from the Fund. Income from selling fish is used for repayments. Sometimes, fishing becomes hard due to weather, her husband’s veteran pay is used. She is discussing with her husband about taking out a loan of 375USD to buy fishing equipment. The family’s monthly income is 125USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Tỵ, 51 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 4 người con tại Quảng Xương, Thanh Hóa. Chị là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm thứ 4. Thu nhập chủ yếu của gia đình hiện nay là từ đánh cá. Công việc của chị Tỵ là bán cá ngoài chợ. 4 người con của chị Tỵ đều đã trưởng thành và là lao động chính trong việc đánh bắt cá. Những khi biển động lượng cá đánh bắt được giảm, nguồn hoàn trả tiền tuần trông vào lương bệnh binh của anh. Đây chính là nguồn đảm bảo cho vốn vay của gia đình. Để việc đánh bắt được thuận lợi chị Tỵ bàn bạc với gia đình và xin vay thêm 375USD để mua phương tiện, đồ nghề đánh cá tăng lượng cá đánh bắt. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình là 125USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy set of tools to catch fishes

loans.name: Tweyimbe B Group

texts.en:
Monic N. is a 41-year-old mother of six children who range in age from 6 to 25. She makes a living by running a poultry business in Kamuli, Uganda, and wishes to buy more merchandise to expand her store. Currently, she earns $25,0000 Ugandan shillings, or $12 U.S. dollars, each week; with the extra profits, she plans on covering basic needs like shelter.

Monic has applied for a loan of $1,300 U.S. dollars along with three other women. In this type of group loan, the money is divided among each woman to invest in her own business. They guarantee each other's loans, so that if one woman can't repay it, the others will cover her share. Veronica M. wishes to grow her retail store, while Jackie N. hopes to expand her sweet potato company. With her portion, Olivia N. wants to buy a poultry feeder for her poultry business. Monic has taken out a loan before and paid it back on time, so she is confident that she will be able to repay this one as well.

loans.use: To buy chicks to grow her poultry business

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru:
Malika Gafurovna R. is 38 years old, has a high school diploma, is married and has 3 children. For the last 10 years she has been raising and fattening cattle for sale. Her children help her take care of the animals and this is Malika's sole source of income and main occupation. Her husband works as a mechanic in the kolhoz (farming co-op) and earns a minuscule salary of 10 dollars a month. The family owns a small plot of land where they grow wheat and potatoes, while Malika also owns 30 rams and several heads of cattle. The animals are taken out to pasture by her oldest son and to make the trip easier Malkia used her first loan from Microinvest to buy a horse. She is now planning to use her loan money to increase the number of animals in her herd and so increase the income the family earns from fattening and selling the animals.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Рабиева Малика Гафуровна - 38 лет, образование среднее, замужем имеет 3-х детей. Откормом скота клиентка занимается более 10 лет. Ее в этом помогают дети. Это ее единственный источник дохода. Муж Малики работает механизатором в колхозе , получает мизерную заработную плату около 10$ в месяц. Имеет семя небольшой земляной участок где они сеют зерно и картошку. Малика имеет 30 баранов и несколько голов крупно рогатого скота. Их на пастбище на корм ведет старший сын и чтобы не было трудно она на первый полученный кредит от МЗФ «Микроинвест » купила коня. Она планирует на получаемый кредит увеличит количество скота и тем самим увеличить доход семьи получаемый от откорма скота.

loans.use: Purchase of several more heads of cattle.

loans.name: Chicas De La Raza 1 Group

texts.es:
Esmeralda del Carmen sells catalog products such as shoes, clothing, quilts and other home items. She began her business five years ago with some of her friends and neighbors and now many people know her and ask her for her products. She is 30 years old, the mother of two and belongs to a group called Chicas de la Raza (Girls of Race) 1, along with Mrs. Candelaria (who sells typical Mexican food), Teresa de Jesus ( who runs a grocery store) and Francisca de Jesus (who runs a butcher shop). With their loans, they will invest in the growth of their businesses and in this way be able to contribute to the household economy.

Translated from Spanish to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

ESMERALDA DEL CARMEN SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE PRODUCTOS POR CATALOGO COMO: ZAPATOS, ROPA, EDREDONES, ARTICULOS PARA EL HOGAR. SU NEGOCIO LO INICIO HACE CINCO AÑOS CON AMIGOS Y VECINOS, ACTUALMENTE MUCHA GENTE LA CONOCE Y PREGUNTAN POR LOS PRODUCTOS QUE VENDE. ELLA TIENE 30 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS Y PERTENECE AL GRUPO LLAMADO CHICAS DE LA RAZA 1 JUNTO CON DOÑA CANDELARIA (VENTA DE ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO), PETRA JOSEFA (VENTA DE FRUTAS Y VERDURAS), YULIANA DEL CARMEN (VENTA DE COMIDA TIPICA), TERESA DE JESUS (TIENDA DE ABARROTES) Y FRANCISCA DE JESUS (TIENE UNA CARNICERIA). CON SUS PRESTAMOS INVERTIRAN PARA EL CRECIMIENTO DE SUS NEGOCIOS Y DE ESTA FORMA CONTRIBUIR PARA LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of home products, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Vin

texts.en:
Mrs. Vin R. and her husband, Mr. Savet Soung were married in 1993 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Vin has been a weaver for over ten years. It is a skill she learned from her parents. She sells their finished products to a middle man in the village who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. 
Her husband has been a mason for fifteen years and he also raises cows. 

Mrs. Vin is requesting a loan of US$700 to purchase silk material for weaving and to buy another cow for raising. According to her business so far we are sure that she will have no problem in paying back the loan.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving and to buy a cow for raising.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan E. is a Khmer cake seller in Tie Buon Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She usually buys Khmer cakes to resell for income. Aside from this business, Mrs. Chan E. is a subsistence farmer. Her husband, Mr. Bora Long, is a cart horse driver in the village, but his business has faced a small problem because his horse had died of a disease. In order to make Mr. Bora Long’s business start again, Mrs. Chan E. decided to ask for a loan to buy a new horse to work with her husband's business. Mrs. Chan E. has two children, both of whom are too young to work or attend school. Previously, Mrs. Chan E. obtained a loan from AMK to fuel for her pump to water her rice field. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new horse to work with her husband's business.

loans.name: Bibinor

texts.en:
H. Bibinor is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. In order to improve the family situation, Bibinor started her own business 7 years ago. She began by baking a national bread, lepeshka, from her home. Her daughter helps her with the business. She is able to sell the majority of her products from her own home, but is also looking to expand and sell in the local markets.

Bibinor would like a loan of $450 in order to purchase the necessary ingredients required for her business. She dreams of sending her children to the University and giving them a good education, and would use the profits from her business to acquire that goal. Bibinor would be grateful, and promises to return her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchasing the flour as a wholesale for baking the national bread “lepeshka”.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 39 years,She is a married woman with 2 children aged 18 and 12. She became a bites seller in 2008. Every day, she works from 6am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Farida has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business.Farida now hopes for a loan to buy and to makes more bites products for her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Elida

texts.es: La señora Elida T. T., tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera, madre de tres hijos, de los cuales solo a uno tiene a su cargo y actualmente cursa el tercer año de secundararia, su sueño ha sido poder acondiconar su casa, sacar adelante a sus hijos, y contiuar con su negocio siendo este la venta de tortillas, venta de frijoles cosidos, cuajada, actividad que tiene desarrollar desde hace 11 años, en su casa de habitacion, su actidad da inicio como una alternativa al desempleo y a la necesidad de obtener un ingresos digno para el hogar, su proposito es poder mas adelante vender refrescos, gaseosas aperturar un pequeño sañon de comida pero requeriria mejorar sus condiciones de vida y local para ofrecer a su clientela razon por la cual trabaja con creditos.-
texts.en:
Elida T. T., 46, is a single mother of three. Only one of her children is still at home, attending middle school. Elida's dream has been to have a good home, provide for her children and continue with her business. She sells tortillas, cooked beans and cuajada (fresh, dry-curd cheese) out of her home. She began her business 11 year ago after becoming unemployed and needed to support her family. Elida wants to add sodas to the food she sells, and eventually open a small diner. She knows that a small diner requires a better place for her customers and better living conditions for her family. This is her reason to work with loans.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Florentina Alexandre

texts.pt:
Florentina Alexandre L. nasceu na província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, com 38 anos de idade é divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos, com idades entre 17, 15, 13, 10 e 3 anos de idade respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os seus filhos.

Florentina estudou ate 8ªclasse e nao continuou por falta de condições, 1989 se casa maritalmente e em 2000 se divorciou e assim com tinha que sustentar os filhos optou pelo negocio vendendo roupas desde 2000 ate hoje.

Florentina  vive basicamente de negocio e nao observa o horário variando por dia segundo a demanda de clientes, tem a destacar como produto mais rentável e com mais saída os fatos de homens que os adquira na Africa do sul por (R250) equivalente a 750,00mt e revende por 2000,00mt. Assim tem um rendimento mensal de 8000,00mt liquido e consegue poupar algum mensalmente.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo na hluvuku e já teve noutras instituuiçao chamada cooperativa de credito Tchuma no valor de 10.000,00mt o primeiro e 20.000,00mt o segundo e ambos aplicou no negocio. Assim com este empréstimo no valor de 13.000,00mt pretende reforçar o negocio dado que neste momento esta fazendo a reforma da sua casa e muito do seu rendimento esta destinar nesta. Assim sonho comprar um carro e conta com ajuda do credito.
texts.en:
Born in the city of Gaza, in southern Mozambique, Florentina Alexandre L., 38, is a divorced mother of five children ages 17, 15, 13, 10 and 3. Due to her family's lack of money, Florentina's education was interrupted after middle school. She got married in 1989, and since her divorce, in 2000, she has been in the business of selling clothes to support her family. Buying and reselling clothes is her main source of income, and her business hours vary according to demand. The best selling, and most profitable item in her inventory are men's suits from South Africa, which she buys for 750,00 and resells for 2.000,00 MT. With a current net income of 8.000,00 MT, she is able save some money every month. This is the first time Florentina is applying for a loan from Hvuluku. Her previous two loans, in the amount of 10.000,00 and 20.000,00 MT, were from Tchuma Credit and Savings Cooperative. She will use her loan from Hvuluku to invest on the clothing sales business, since most of her current income has been going toward improving her house. In the future, with some credit help, she hopes to be able to buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothes for reselling

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es: Isolina tiene 50 años, está casada con Flavio, quien es profesor y sus hijos son Marlene de 24, Maribel de 21 y José Luis de 15. Hace 5 años Isolina se viene dedicando a la venta de artículos de cristalería, ollas a presión, viandas, vasos de vidrio, etc. con lo que ha podido ayudar al aporte familiar, ya que el sueldo de su esposo no alcanzaba a cubrir los gastos de vestido y educación de sus hijos. Es así que realiza la venta de su mercadería en algunos de los mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca de forma ambulatoria, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde, gustándole su trabajo, ya que le gusta sentirse útil ayudando a la economía familiar. Isolina quiere que sus hijos prosperen y se dediquen a lo que más les guste para que sean felices con su profesión. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará más ollas, vasos, etc., para incrementar sus ventas y hacer en el futuro un negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Isolina is 50 years old. She is married to Flavio, who is a professor, and their children are 24 year old Marlene, 21 year old Maribel, and 15 year old Luis. Since 5 years ago, Isolina has worked selling glassware, pressure cookers, food, glasses, etc. with which she has been able to help support the family, since the salary of her husband is not able to cover the costs of the clothes and education of their children. It is in this way that she carries out the sale of her merchandise in some of the city of Juliaca markets through traveling sales. From 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon, she enjoys her work, since she likes to feel useful helping with the family finances. Isolina wants her children to prosper and work in what they like the most so that they are happy with their professions. With the money from the loan she will buy more pans, glasses, etc., to increase her sales and make her business more profitable in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Tatman Montgomery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos. Ella es profesora de primaria, en horas de la mañana trabaja en un colegio particular  y en horas de la tarde se dedica a realizar manualidades para diversos eventos, dependiendo de las campañas y las épocas en que se realicen diversas actividades, ella esta ahí presente, de pasada les da trabajo a sus hermanas en la producción de sus manualidades, cuando tiene grandes pedidos. Esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años y le agrada mucho, por ello que en vacaciones viaja a Lima para capacitarse en este arte y regresa ofreciendo novedades a sus clientes. Este es su préstamo nº5 con MFP, ha sido puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero comprará materiales para sus diversas manualidades.
texts.en:
Ana, 33, lives with her common-law husband and their two children. She is an elementary school teacher and works at a private school in the mornings. In the afternoons, she makes crafts for different occasions. No matter the season, Ana is always crafting and when she has large orders to fill, she hires her sisters to help. She has had this business for 20 years, ans she enjoys it very much. She travels to Lima when school is out to take arts and crafts classes, and she always comes back with new things to offer. This is Ana's fifth loan through Kiva partner Microfinanzas Prisma. She has made her payments on time. With this loan, Ana will purchase materials to make different crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for crafts

loans.name: Shafoat

texts.ru: Шафоат женщина в возросте 37 лет имеет 4 детей.Сама работает учительницей в средней школе.Преподаёт начальные классы.Она со старшим сыном занимается откормом скота ,поэтому она в сезон хочет увеличить свой скот .Сейчас у неё три коровы.Взяв займ она хочет купить баранов.Она благодарна за поддержку инвесторов в первую очередь KIVA
texts.en:
Shafoat is a 37 year old woman with 4 children. She works as a school teacher at an elementary school. With help of her older son, she also keeps livestock. During this season, she would like to purchase a few more animals. Currently, she has 3 cows. Using this loan she wants to buy 3 sheep. She thanks KIVA and all of the investors for their help.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora de Nombre Sandra del Carmen Ríos Hernández tiene la edad de 48 años, su estado civil es acompañada Doña Sandra tiene 3 hijos sus edades son las siguientes un varón de  22 años de edad y trabaja por cuenta propia su otro hijo de 17 año de edad trabaja por cuenta propia y su hijo menor de 14 años que trabaja por cuenta propia, su compañero de vida labora como comerciante, sus propósitos son incrementar en su negocio para expandirlo mas en su casa de habitación y obtener mas ingresos para su familia sus deseos son conseguir mas clientes para su negocio para que este incremente por la demanda de sus productos que sean necesaR. para uso diario sus sueños son que sus hijos estudien una carrera profesional ya que desde muy pequeños han tenido que trabajar para salir adelante y es por eso que ellos no han recibido estudio y en sus sueños le gustaría que sus hijos fueran unos profesionales pero debido a la situación se vieron obligados a trabajar para aportar dinero para su Mama y salir adelante.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es venta en general en la que ofrece: ropa calzado, perfumes y además de este negocio tiene una pulpería en la que ofrece golosinas, sopas y granos básicos, la ubicación de su negocio es  en su casa de habitación, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, Doña Sandra dio inicio a esta humilde actividad con el apoyo de sus hijos y su esposo y decide establecer en su casa de habitación con pocos productos por lo que sus clientes empezaron a recurrir a su pulpería y mas tarde decide establecer otro negocio como lo fue la mercadería en general en la que inicio ofreciendo ropa y cosméticos por lo que su negocio consiguió mas afluencia de clientes con esta nueva idea y fue así como obtuvo ambos negocios ya que establecerlos le ha costado mucho esfuerzo por lo que necesita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo por lo que tiene que realizar la compra de cosméticos, ropa y productos escolares ya que se acerca la entrada de clases y así ofrecerá a sus clientes una variedad en productos escolares por lo que agradece a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones que se preocupan por las necesidades del negocio de cada uno de los clientes.
texts.en:
Sandra del Carmen Ríos Hernández is 48 years old and married. Sandra has 3 sons, a 22 year old , a 17 year old, and a 14 year old, all of whom work on their own. Her husband works as a merchant. Her goal is to increase his business, which is located in his house, so that she can expand it and thus earn more money for the family. Her desire is to obtain more clients for her business so that it grows due to demand for her products that are staple items. Her dream is that her children are able to study to become professionals, since they have had to work from since they were very little to get ahead and contribute money for the household expenses and thus haven't been able to study. She works in sales generally, offering clothing, shoes, perfumes. In addition to this business, she has a small grocery store in which she sells sweets, soup, and basic grains. The location of the business is her house and has had it for 12 years. Sandra started this modest business, with the support of her children and husband, in her house with few products. She later started the other business with more merchandise, through which obtained more clients, and thus came to have the two businesses. They have cost her a lot of money which is why she needs the loan, to be used as work capital to purchase cosmetics, clothing and school products since the beginning of school year is approaching. She will thus be able to offer her clients a variety of school products, for which is grateful to Fundación León 2000 and the organizations that concern themselves with the necessities of each client's business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Laeah

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Laeah L. from Mbeya. She is married with one 3-year-old child. Laeah has been running a medical store business since 2008. She purchases human drugs and sells them in her medical store.

She works at the business for 12 hours per day, six days per week. Laeah currently earns about $320 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $625 in order to purchase more drugs to expand her store. In the future, she plans to start a new medical store. Laeah thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more drugs to expand her store

loans.name: Medelii A Group

texts.en:
Gladys Z. has been a vegetable seller in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for one year. Gladys is married with four children, aged 2 to 17. Gladys also cares for two additional dependents. Gladys works every day at her business for 12 hours and earns an average monthly profit of $225 dollars.

Gladys is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more vegetables for her business. Gladys is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and pay school fees for her children.  Gladys will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Mariam:  Who has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business.

loans.name: Brunilda Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Brunilda del carmen, tiene la edad de 63 años habita en las pilas Oriental ubicado en la cuidad de Masaya junto a su esposo el cual trabaja para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar , ello tiene 10 hijos  todos están casados y le apoyan con los gastos de la casa , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las vivienda , doña Brunilda tiene 40 años trabajando como en agricultura el rubro que ella maneja son los granos básicos  y establecimiento de plátano , ella inicio con el apoyo de su esposo , los planes futuros para sus tierras es diversificar . Ella con el financiamiento va a compra fertilizantes, material vegetativo para obtener un resultado de calidad en cuanto al cultivo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brunilda del Carmen is 63 years old and lives in Las Pilas Oriental in the city of Masaya. Her husband works and helps her with the expenses of the home. She has 10 children, all of whom are married and help support the home. Her plans are to improve her living quarters. Mrs. Brunilda has worked for 40 years as a farmer of basic grains and plantains. She began with her husband's help. She plans to diversify her land in the future. With the loan she will buy fertilizer and plant supplies to obtain higher quality crops.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertlizer and supplies to improve crops

loans.name: Casimiro

texts.es: Casimiro tiene 60 años, vive al lado de su esposa. Desde niño se dedica a las tareas agrícolas, mientras espera la cosecha, cada día por las mañanas sale a pastear a sus  vacas junto a su esposa, a lugares lejanos de hasta 3 horas de caminata, durante todo el día. Casimiro cultiva los principales productos de su región, tales como; la papa, el maíz, entre otros, una vez que cosechan una parte la de sus productos la venden al por menor y otra parte, al mayor, a comerciantes específicos. Casimiro y su esposa desean seguir trabajando en esta actividad hasta donde sus fuerzas les alcancen, ambos están inmensamente agradecidos a la vida por estas actividades que les sirvieron para sostener a sus hijos que hoy son personas adultas. Es la segunda vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y se siente contento de formar parte del grupo que es su banco comunal porque le han enseñado el gran valor de prevenir para el futuro. El dinero que Casimiro ahora necesita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Casimiro is 60 years old and lives with his wife. He has been a farmer his entire life, having started working in agriculture as a child. While he waits for the harvest, he gets up every morning to put his cows to pasture. His wife accompanies him on the long walks to the pasture, which is 3 hours away on foot. Casimiro grows crops traditional to the region, like potatoes, corn etc. The majority of his crops are sold directly to specific vendors but he also sells a small part of his harvest himself. Casimiro and his wife would like to continue with this work until their strength fails them. Both of them are very grateful for all that life has given them and especially that their work has allowed them to care for their children, who are now grown. This is their second loan from MFP and they enjoy being part of the communal bank because it has taught them the value of planning for the future. Casimiro will use the money to buy fertilizer for his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Renacer esta integrado por tres personas las cuales se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y todas se dedican al comercio.
la Sra. Arlis N. tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Gesler Philips quien labora en la compañia nacional Pepsi y Co., con el han procreado 3 hijos de los cuales dos estan en la escuela, ella se dedica a la vena de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, tambien vende lacteos. ella necesita el credito pra comprar al por mayor la carne y los lacteos, ya que asi son mas baratos y se tienen mejores ganancias.
La Sra. Eyla montalvan tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Julio N. quien se dedica a la albañeleria, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, charamuscas y agua en bolsas, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos y agua al por mayor.
La Sra. Francis B. tiene 33 años de edad y vive en union libre con el Sr. robin Martirez el se dedica a la albañileria y ella vende donas, refrescos y charamuscas, esta actividad tiene de realizarla desde hace 3 años, ella necesita el credito para comprar harina, leña, azucar y refrescos.
todos ellos son personas muy responsables y unidas, tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Solidario Renacer group is made up of three people who have known each other for a long time, and all are business people. Mrs. Arlis N., 33, is married to Mr. Gesler Philips. He works for the national Pepsi and Co. They have 3 children; two are in school. She sells beef, pork and chicken. She also sells dairy products. She needs a loan to buy wholesale meat and dairy products. They are cheaper that way, and she can have better earnings. Mrs. Eyla Montalvan, 24, is married to Mr. Julio N.. He is a brick layer. They do not have children. She sells soft drinks, popsicles and bagged water. She needs a loan to buy more soft drinks and water wholesale. Mrs. Francis B., 33, lives in a common law marriage with Mr. Robin Martirez. He is a brick layer. She sells doughnuts, soft drinks, and popsicles. She has been doing this for three years. She needs a loan to buy flour, wood, sugar and soft drinks. All of them are very responsible and united. They have great desires to get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, soft drinks, bundles of bagged water, flour.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old and is married to Armando T.. They live in the village of Minallo Naguillan, Isabela. They are blessed with 4 children who have all graduated from high school. None of them pursued studies in college because they could not afford the cost.

Marilyn has been selling vegetables for many years. Since she does not have enough capital to grow her business on her own, Marilyn is asking for the support of ASKI. She wants to borrow PHP 7,000 to help expand her business. She also admits that her weekly income from her vending is not enough to support her family's needs and she is hoping to increase her capital to generate an income that can fully support her family.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La señora Juana vive en casa propia en la calle Tocopilla de la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, la actividad que ella tiene es la venta de chompas las cuales lleva de  de La Paz a varias comunidades en otros departamentos del país; con esta actividad ella mantiene a su familia y es su única fuente de ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital, comprar más chompas  e incrementar sus ingresos y poder seguir trabajando.

En Febrero de 2008 ella obtuvo un crédito via Kiva y su historial de pagos fue muy bueno; esto hace posible que Juana pueda acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana lives in her own home on Tocopilla Street in the zone Pasankeri in the city of La Paz, Bolivia. Her commercial activity consists of selling sweaters, which she takes from La Paz to various other communities in other counties. She is able to support her family through her sales, which is also their only source of income. With the loan she is asking for, she will buy more sweaters which will in turn increase her returns and will help her to continue working.

In February 2008, she obtained a loan through Kiva and was consistent in her payments. Her reliability has made it possible for Juana to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more sweaters to satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Francisca Yessenia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, la señora Francisca Yessenia R. se dedica a su negocio de venta de accesorios para vehículos como parabrisas, cubiertas de neumáticos, alfombras, antenas, cojines, empaques, entre otros.

Ella se ha dedicado arduamente a su negocio y ha logrado salir adelante manteniendo a su hija que por ser muy pequeña debe de mantener. Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los accesorios y así ofertarlos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Francisca Yessenia R. has a business in the city of León. She sells vehicle accessories such as windshields, tire covers, rugs, antennas, cushions, seals, and others. She has worked arduously at her business. She has been able to get ahead taking care of her daughter, who is very small and needs support. She has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy the accessories and sell them at her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy vehicle accessories

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr:
K. Françoise est née le 24 Janvier 1972 à Porto-Novo et réside depuis 20 ans au quartier Kowegbo à Cotonou, Bénin.  Françoise est mariée à GOUSSANOU A. Jacob qui est fonctionnaire de la mairie de Cotonou.  Elle est mère de six enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.  

Françoise vend à domicile du maïs, de la farine d'igname en gros et en détail, des condiments, des cartons de sucre, du savon.  Elle s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, le marché le plus grande du Cotonou, et à d’autres marchés situés de l'intérieur du pays.  Pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle qui ne cesse de s'agrandir, Françoise n'a d'autre issue que de recourir au prêt. C'est dans ce contexte qu'elle sollicite un crédit d’Alidé.
texts.en:
Françoise K. was born on 24 January, 1972 in Porto-Novo, and has been living in the Kowegbo area of Cotonou, Benon, for 20 years. Françoise is married to Jacob A. Goussanou, who is a municipal civil servant in Cotonou. She is the mother of six children, all of whom are in school. At her home, Françoise sells maize, yam flour in bulk and at retail, condiments, boxes of sugar, and soap. She supplies herself in Dantokpa, Cotonou's largest market, and at other markets situated in the interior of the country. To satisfy the demands of her constantly growing clientele, Françoise has no choice but to resort to a loan. It is in this context that she is seeking a loan through Alidé, one of Kiva's field partners.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments and various other products

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn A. is a 46-year-old mother of three children. She hails from the busy town of Angono, Rizal province, in the Philippines. She is married to Samuel, who is 46 years old and her business partner. She believes that to get out of poverty, you yourself should take steps to unleash yourself from being tied to the poor situation.

With her desire to uplift the status of her living, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008. Having access to capital through ASHI has brought her courage to continue what was her dying business of hog raising. Now on her second loan, she is excited to receive a loan of 10,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. This will be used to pay for four piglets, two sacks of feed and vitamins for the hogs.

She is optimistic that her business will bring them proceeds for their living expenses. She dreams of sending her children to school until they find jobs for a better way of life.

loans.use: To pay for four piglets, two sacks of feed and vitamins for the hogs

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is 45 years old and married with four children. Her children assist her in her trade business when they are not in school. Iyabo sells drinks and has been in this business since 2004. She buys drinks from big distributors and sells to retail. Iyabo says she is requesting the loan of N140,000 in order to purchase directly from the company at a reduced rate. She says thank you to all who consider her situation and request.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell directly from the company.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca started selling fish 15 years ago. She takes delivery of fish from Yeji in the eastern region of Ghana. With her very tasty and good quality fish, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 46 years old and is married with six children. All her children are currently in school in the community where they live. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of assorted fish to increase sales and income to support her children’s education and grow her business. She is grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish

loans.name: Filomena Eulalia

texts.es: Doña Filomena Eulalia B. con residencia en la comunidad D. Juchanep Totonicapan ella es madre soltera con  tres hijos su actividad principal es la tejeduria en la elaboracion D. cortes tipicos D. diferentes diseños D. lo mas sencillo a lo moderno ya que es un traje muy utilizado por la mujeres D. del occidente del pais D. Guatemal principalmente el altiplano por ser un lugar muy frio y sus lindos bosques naturales, ella necesita D. un credito que sera invertido en la compra D. Hilo, labores, tintas. ella manifiesta que quiere aprovechas el timpo D. vaciones D. sus hijos para incrementar su produccion.

loans.use: Compra de Materiales

loans.name: Madonna Gale

texts.en:
Madonna Gale is running her own village store located in Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is 34 years old and married to Marvin, a farmer in their village.  They are blessed with one child named Maria Christine.  

Madonna opens her store everyday.  She opens it very early in the morning and closes around 9:00 in the evening.  Her income from the business is utilized as revolving capital to maintain her store and somehow sustain it for stability. In this regard, Madonna wanted to ask for a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10, 000 that will be used in purchasing stocks of merchandise to retail in her store. With the amount she is requesting to avail, Madonna believes that this will be a good start towards the fulfillment of her business goals someday.

loans.use: Additional capital for her geneal store business

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is 36 years old, married and blessed with four children. His business is located at Mautuma (Makutano) in Eldoret.

He was introduced to KADET, a Kiva partner, by a friend.

With the loan he is intending to receive from KADET, he will buy maize to sell to customers. In the future he hopes to start a transportation business to bring maize to places that are far away. With his profits, he hopes to be able to continue educating his children.

About KADET: 

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve the living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy maize to sell to customers

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Mrs. Chok C. is a villager in Trapaing Sdok village in Takeo province. She is 50 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a seller while the others attend the local school. She is a snack seller.

Her husband, Mr. C. Han, on the right in the photo, is a farmer who owns 1.2-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.

Although this couple tries to work hard they still earn little income to provide a better living for their family.

Thus, Mrs. Chok C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a motorbike for her family

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.name: Angique

texts.en:
Angique is a 34-year-old mother. She is married to Jeffrey and they have two children.

Living in Agusan Del Sur, she has the advantage of having a livelihood as a farmer. She plants rice because it is one of the major agricultural crops there. It is also a basic need for every Filipino family. To sell quality rice, she works hard to keep her crops in good shape.

Angique has asked for financial assistance from a micro-financial institution. She applied for a loan of Php 12,000 which she will use to purchase farm inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has a stall where she sells cooking utensils at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is 40 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. She is a LAPO client and hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cooking utensils to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders. About LAPO: Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to achieving the goal of economic empowerment of their clients through access to affordable financial services delivered in a cost effective and innovative manner.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking utensils to sell

loans.name: Min

texts.en: Mrs.S. is a humble villager who lives in Kompong Tom province. She was born in 1966 and is raising a family, which has seven other members. To make a living, S. sells a few groceries in front of her home and earns an average of $2 a day. She is married, and two of her children work while the other four attend school. Her husband earns a living as a military policeman in Cambodia's Ministry of the Interior. She has been very busy at her business because many clients want to buy her products. To meet the needs of her customers, S. has applied for a loan to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Antonia es casada, tiene 49 años y 1 hijos, Antonia tiene una tienda de repuestos en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Antonia vende cosméticos por catalogo.
Antonia necesita un prestado de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de focos y micas.
Los sueños de Antonia son levantar el segundo piso de su casa y que su hijo se case.
texts.en:
Antonia is a member of Banco Comunal Obreras (Workers Community Bank). Antonia is married. She is 49 years old and has one child. She has a spare parts shop in a rented location, which she goes to every day. In addition, Antonia sells cosmetics by catalogue. Antonia needs a loan of $350 (1000 PEN), money which will be invested in the purchase of light bulbs and lenses. Antonia’s dreams are to raise the second floor of her house and for her son to get married.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of light bulbs and lenses.

loans.name: Kimchheng

texts.en: Mrs. Kimchheng S. is 52 years old and she lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Miech Van, are farmers who own a small piece of land where they cultivate rice. In the rice field, this family faces some problem because they don't have enough rice seed and the soil is infertile. Thus, Mrs. Kimchheng S. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed and fertilizer to increase the rice yield. She is a mother of six children. Two of the children are laborers, two are employed in a garment factory and two attend a local public school. Her husband is presented in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Julia tiene un Kiosco ubicado al frente D. un grifo en donD. venD. golosinas, gaseosas, panes, actividad que realiza todos los días desD. la madrugada hasta la noche.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas y panes.
Los sueños D. Julia son construir su casa con material noble y abrir una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Tarpuy (or Siembra, in Quechua) Communal Bank. Julia is married, 48-years-old, and has five children. She has a kiosk where she sells candy, soft drinks, and bread. She works seven days a week from morning until night. Julia needs a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles ($700) which will be used to buy soft drinks and bread. She dreams of building her own house with fine materials and of opening a winery in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and bread

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin sells groceries like laundry soap, bathing soap, toothbrushes, and beverages. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She loves her business because of the opportunity to meet one-on-one with her customers. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is a hard-working woman. She opens her stall daily to sell her goods. She is 40 years old and married with 2 children. Her children are making progress in school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Juana Aurea

texts.es: Juana tiene 38 años, es separada D. su esposo y vive con sus 6 hijos en su casa que es propia.DesD. hace un año decidió generar sus propios ingresos, así empezó a trabajar en la elaboración D.  prendas D. vestir hechas a base D. lana. Le agrada mucho confeccionar chompas, faldas, gorros, chalinas, tapetes y colchas, además le gusta porque el negocio es tranquilo ya que  pueD.  trabajar en la comodidad D. su casa, D. esta manera  no descuida la crianza D. sus hijos. Juana esta muy satisfecha porque venD. muy bien sus creaciones y le pagan un buen precio por cada una D. ellas, además comercializa toda  su mercadería en su ciudad natal. En el futuro tiene planeado aumentar sus  ventas y mejorar sus diseños, ya que desea vender sus prendas a mejor precio.Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con  MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible el préstamo que le permitirá continuar trabajando.Juana tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. variedad D. lana que utiliza  para tejer, y también destinará  otra parte en la compra D.  útiles  escolares  para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, is separated from her husband and lives with her 6 children in a house that she owns. She has operated her own business for a year, making and selling knitted products from wool and earning her own income. She makes sweaters, skirts, hats, tablecloths and bedspreads, among other things, and she´s happy with the work. It´s very relaxed work and work that she can do at home, an important point for her because she can care for her children at the same time. Juana is happy, too, with the progress of the business. Her creations sell well and she´s paid well for them. Furthermore, she can sell everything she makes in her hometown. For the future, she plans to increase her sales and improve her designs because she wants to sell her clothing at an even better price. This is Juana´s third MFP loan and she is very grateful to everyone who makes the loans possible and helps her to continue working. Juana is thinking of using part of the loan to buy wool for her business and part to buy school supplies for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wool supplies for knitting business.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina T. is from the village of Poblacion, Damulog, Bukidnon. She is 62 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Carolina owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling seafood products including dried fish, chorizo (pork sausage), and other items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Carolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. Carolina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el sector Barrio Nuevo Santa Rosa, una zona rural y de bajos recursos del distrito Cura Mori, perteneciente a la provincia de Piura en la región del mismo nombre, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos estable con la cual sacar adelante a los suyos hizo que hace un año incursionara en el negocio de crianza y venta de animales, el cría animales menores y aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado en la parte podterior de su vivienda, cuando estos ya se han desarrollado completamente los vende a los negociantes que visitan la zona en donde vive.

La demanda que se presenta en la zona han hecho que el piense en ampliar su negocio, por ello desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para acelerar su desarrollo, siguiendo su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles. De esta manera el podrá incrementar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos.

Jorge es un padre bastante responsable y que siempre se esfuerza para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El es una persona muy conocida y estimada en la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 24-year-old father who lives with his wife and their two young children in Barrio Nuevo Santa Rosa, a low-resource rural zone of the Cura Mori district, which is in the Piura province of Piura region, located three hours from the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the Lambayeque region. The need to obtain a stable source of income with which he can help his children get ahead in life led him to begin a business a year ago raising and selling animals. He raises small animals and poultry behind his house. When the animals have developed completely, he sells them to businessmen who visit the area in which he lives. The demand present in the area has led him to think of expanding his business. For this reason he wants to buy more animals to expand his business and balanced feed to speed their development. He has therefore found it necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa for his first loan of 500 new soles. In this way, he will be able to increase his sales and earn a higher income. Jorge is a very responsible father who always tries to help his family get ahead. His greatest desire is to give them a better quality of life. He is well-known and liked in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small animals, poultry and balanced feed for expansion of business

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden R. runs a sari-sari (variety retail shop) and her primary source of income is derived from selling canned goods. Eden also sells detergent soap both bar and powder to local community members. She is a 45-year-old woman from the village of Benoni, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. Eden is married and has four school-age children. Eden has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month.

In 2009, Eden joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was better able to engage in business activities and, in turn, to improve her standard of living. Eden has recently successfully repaid a loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This prior loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Eden is now requesting another loan, also in the amount of 11,000 PHP ($250), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase her working capital. Notably, this loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eden from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory and increasing her working capital

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Рачабов Нуриддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Нуриддин более 5 лет занимается растениеводством. Имеет большой земельный участок, где сеет пшеницу и овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Nuriddin R. lives in the Yavan district. He is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. His wife is a homemaker. Nuriddin has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He has a large plot of land, where he grows wheat and vegetables. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Dally

texts.en:
Dally S. is from the village of Barangay Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. She is 36 years old. Dally is married and has 3 infant children. To make a living, Dally raises pigs for fattening and sale. Dally has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP whenever she sells a mature pig.

In 2009, Dally joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Dally is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Dally from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her farming land and to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Naseem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Naseem akhtar lives in the city of Vehari in Pakistan where she operates a grocery shop. She is the mother of three children who all work.

 
Naseem is out of stock these days and desperately needs investment in her business to meet customer demand. Therefore, she has applied for a loan from Asasah to invest in her grocery shop so that she can meet demand and increase her income.

 
She thinks that she can make more income from her shop which will help her to cover her family's expenses. She will also save money from the profit for her oldest son’s marriage.

Note: "Naseem's shop is located in the market".

loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Akpéné

texts.en: Madame Akpéné E. is 38 years old and lives in Lomé, Togo. She is married to a man in the military and they have two children. Madame E. sells medicines out of a basket that she carries with her throughout Adidogomé Quartier of Lomé. She purchases her merchandise mostly at the Grand Market in Lomé or in Accra in neighboring Ghana. She’s been in business since 2005. Madame E. is now taking her third loan from WAGES of 500,000 CFA. She will use the loan to purchase different kinds of local and imported medicines to sell.

loans.use: To purchase medicine and other health products.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura de papa en terrenos propios, sus productos los venden en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades los lleva a la ciudad de Lima, dependiendo de la producción.
Irene es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Irene es socia del Banco Comunal Bonanza y lo que mas le agrada son la facilidad de los prestamos y la puntualidad. Solicita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de abono.
Irene sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y construir su casa de material noble porque la que tiene es de material rustico.
texts.en:
Irene and her husband work in agriculture, growing potatoes on their land. They sell the potatoes at a wholesale food market in the city of Ayacucho and sometimes even sell them in Lima, depending on the production. Irene is married and has four children in school. She is a member of the community bank Bonanza, and what pleases her most are the ease and punctuality of loans. She is asking for a loan of 600 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer. Irene dreams of her children becoming professionals and constructing a house of durable material because hers is very rustic.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny P., 50, (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Thina Leng, 52, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1981 and have six children--five sons and one daughter. 

Vanny is a silk weaver. Her husband is a carpenter. She is applying for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio, de 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijas, Luz  y Madrid de 12 y 8 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su techo propio. Prudencio es una persona decidida, es por ello que incursionó en la actividad agrícola, específicamente, cultivando y comercializando cacao. Él agradece a sus padres, que le enseñaron las técnicas del cultivo y cosecha. Es por ello que está volcando toda la experiencia vivida en sus campos agrícolas, los resultados se ven cuando su producto tiene mucha demanda en el mercado, ante esto piensa sembrar plátano, por ser un fruto que tiene también más demanda en el mercado. Hoy tiene dos productos en la cual puede sostener a su familia, ya que para clave del éxito está en la diversificación de productos, es por ello que percibe buenos ingresos económicos, en donde sus compradores potenciales se sienten satisfechos por la calidad de los productos. Normalmente trabaja con sus peones, en donde les facilita la extracción de su producto final, y su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producción agrícola, para ello adquirirá terrenos de cultivo, con la finalidad de que pueda producir a gran escala. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además asevera que existe un buen clima cordial en su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, para que le pueda dar un mantenimiento exhaustivo a sus plantaciones de cacao y plátano.
texts.en:
Prudencio, 38, is single and has two daughters, Luz and Madrid who are 12 and 8 years old. They live together in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle in the town of Santa Rosa where they own their own house. Prudencio is a determined person. This is why he went into farming, specifically cacao farming. He is grateful to his parents who taught him farming and harvesting techniques. For this reason he is putting all his life experience into his fields. The results are made palpable by the high market demand for his crops. In light of this, he plans to plant bananas because it also is in high demand in the marketplace. Today, he has two products with which he can support his family because the key to success is crop diversification. This is why his income is good; his potential customers are satisfied with the quality of his products. He usually works with help from laborers who assist him with the final extraction of product. His point of sale is the local gathering centers and his daily routine starts at 7am and goes until 8pm. His future plan is to expand his agricultural production and for that he needs more farmland in order to produce al a large scale. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to continue to repay on time. He also states that there is a cordial atmosphere in his communal bank. He will use the requested loan to buy manure and supplies to provide exhaustive maintenance to his cacao and banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and supplies to care for his cacao and banana crops.

loans.name: Elvira De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Elvira de Jesús T. es socia del banco comunal El Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también salen a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas como en la construcción, en fabricas etc.

Doña Elvira tiene 46 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años  a los cuales ella sola los ha educado y les ha sacado adelante. Su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente y su último hijo estudia en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa que le dan donde trabaja.

La Señora. Elvira trabaja hace 6 años cuidando una finca y criando animales como ganado, cuyes, chanchos y borregos, labora de domingo a domingo sin horario. También tiene tiempo para criar chanchos, cuyes, gallinas que son de su propiedad y vende en su comunidad.
 
Este  es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación, fue invitada por su sobrina a formar parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras, lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio de  animales.
texts.en:
Elvira de Jesús T. is a member of El Tocte communal bank, she lives in a community that goes by the same name. She belongs to the Jadan parish whose members mainly work in agriculture and raise livestock but they also work in different sectors in the city like construction, factory work, etc.. Elvira is a 46 year old single woman with three children of ages: 22, 15, and 9 years old whom she has personally educated and has helped them get ahead. Her eldest son is married and lives on his own, her second son works and helps out financially, and her youngest is still in school. She doesn't own her home it is provided to her by her employer. Elvira has been working at an estate raising cattle, guinea pigs, hogs, and sheep for 6 years. She works everyday without a fixed schedule and still has time to raise her own hogs, guinea pigs, and chickens that she sells to the community. This is her third loan with the organization and was asked by her niece to form part of this group of fighting women. She will invest the loan to purchase guinea pigs. Her goal is to continue to grow her animal business.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
K. Harriet is 34 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the Hoima region of Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Harriet has a restaurant, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Harriet has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase and stock more food.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Harriet hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Harriet hopes to educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: buying food for restaurant inventory

loans.name: Lucrecia Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Lucrecia Mercedes tiene 37 años, tiene  1 hijo menor de edad. Cabe señalarse. La señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía. A pesar de los desafíos que enfrenta como es el medio de transporte para trasladar los diferentes productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Este negocio ella lo inicio por sus abuelos que le enseñaron este medio de vida y que ella lo obtuviera como medio de trabajo y con el tiempo fue invirtiendo poco a poco hasta que le brindo ganancias mayores. Su crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima pues tiene algunos pedidos. Su sueño es llegar a comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercancía.
texts.en: Señora Lucrecia Mercedes is 37 years old, and has one son of school age. She knows how to stand out from the crowd, and dedicates her time to selling her craft work. She overcomes the challenges she faces, such as finding means of transport to take her different products to her customers. She started this business because of her grandparents, who taught her this way of life and work. Over time she has invested in it, so that little by little it has come to provide her with good earnings. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials, as she has various orders to fill. Her dream is to buy a pickup to transport her goods.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah O. is 48 years old and from Katito. She is a widow with five children; Bob 20 years, Samuel 17 years, Minnie 13 years and Valentine 11 years old.

Sarah has a basketry business that she has operated for the past two years and has seen her business grow during that time. She has orders for  making more baskets and is in need of the raw materials. She is applying for a loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use the profits made to pay school fees for her children and also cater for the family's upkeep.

Her desire is to see her business grow further and be able to have as many clients as possible.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for making baskets

loans.name: Cpk Ii Plus Group

texts.en:
John B., aged 41 and married, was elected as the president of the Community Bank named “CPK II Plus”, which consists of 19 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

John sells iron bars, pipes, etc. at the market located west of Kinshasa. He started his business in 1990 by selling duplicating paper. John is happy right now as he is going to be able to buy iron bars and water pipes with the loan, have a greater range of stock, and be able to meet his customers' demand. 

John makes a profit of US$100 per week. With the money he earns, he hopes to provide financial support for his family. His dream is to someday open a hardware and a clothing store. John has four children aged between 3 and 11 years. Three of them go to school. He also takes care of five children left by his relatives.

loans.use: To buy iron bars, pipes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Stephen  Makanyanga

texts.en: Stephen Makanyanga M. is 28 years old and married to Judy M.. He is a sign painter who works together with his wife in this business of painting in Kitale town.  Has been in this business for four years and he earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.This will be Stephen's first loan from KADET.  He plans to buy paint worth fifteen thousand shillings, also to buy paint brushes and other materials worth five thousand shillings. With the income he is going to get he plans to expand his business by employing more people to help him. Stephen hopes that with the profits he will earn that he can raise his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase paint, painting brushes etc

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 28 years old, married, and has a 3 year old child. To make a living, Jean owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jean wishes for her business to succeed.

Jean joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jean is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Maria Milagros

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ÑAUPASUNCHIS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Maria Milagros; ella tiene 23 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el estudio de la carrera profesional de Historia, ella estudia en la universidad para que así pueda trabajar en alguna institución y sacar adelante a su familia, la socia quiere seguir mejorando en sus estudios. La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal y comprarse algunas cosas que necesita para la universidad.                                     
                   
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Laura Aida is a member of the “ÑAUPASUNCHIS” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Laura Aida is 23 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her work.  She is a retired teacher and through her work she gets her children ahead in life.  She would like to own a grocery store.  She is requesting this loan for personal use, to support her household.

Laura Aida is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: For personal use.  To support her household

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie B. is from the village of Poblcaion 2, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 58 years old. Rosie is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosie owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from making and selling specialty food like "arrozcaldo" or chicken porridge in the local community. Rosie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rosie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make specialty foods like "arrozcaldo". This will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make specialty foods like "arrozcaldo"

loans.name: Ruth Aidee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL MOLINITO II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Aidee; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de hielos, ella tiene una proveedora donde vende hielo para diferentes negocios como bares y restaurants, ella trabaja dese las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de hielo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar una congeladora para el negocio de venta de hielo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to El Molinito II Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Ruth Aidee; she is 31 years old and is married with three children. She combines her daily activities with the ice sales business. She has a supply shop where she sells ice for different businesses such as bars and restaurants. She works from 6 am to 7 pm, and through this business, she helps her children succeed. The member wants to grow and improve her ice sales business. The member is requesting this loan to purchase a freezer for the ice sales business.

The member is happy to get this loan and promises to maker her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase a freezer for her ice sales business

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida M. is from Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Aida is married and has three children. To make a living, Aida owns & operates transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating pick-up transport services. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for her "carenderia" (small restaurant). Aida is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to repair existing engine. This will be the third loan taken out by Aida from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing engine

loans.name: Marina Lizbeth

texts.es: Marina es una mujer muy alegre y además responsable. Hace 5 años que se dedica a la venta recargas, accesorios de celulares y celulares, dicha actividad la realiza de una manera permanente porque cuando comenzó a trabajar fue por razón que como madre comprometida y responsable decidió ayuda a los ingresos de la familia ya que tenía que sacar adelante a su familia, ya que por las mañanas realizaba la lo quehaceres del hogar. Actualmente solicita un financiamiento para la compra de recargas, accesorios, calcomanías entre otros.
texts.en: Marina is a very happy woman who is also responsible. Five years ago she started selling prepaid cards, cellular phones, and accessories. She now runs this business on a permanent basis because when she first started she wanted to help with the family's expenses, as a committed and responsible mother. She needed to provide for her family and in the mornings she would do some household chores. She requests a loan to purchase prepaid cards, accessories, decals and other products.

loans.use: To purchase cellphones and accessories.

loans.name: Maribel Alejandra

texts.es:
Maribel de 31 años, es una mujer trabajadora que elabora y vende sandalias a un precio muy económico. Comenzó hace 13 años atrás con ayuda de su ex esposo elaborando sandalias. 

Poco a poco ha mejorado sus ingresos ya que la han conocido como vendedora de sandalias. En la actualidad trabaja con ayuda de dos personas que confeccionan las sandalias desde las 08h30am hasta las 19h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar plantillas, suelas, pegamentos. En el futuro quiere incrementar mas la producción de las sandalias para mejores ventas.
texts.en:
Maribel, 31, is a hardworking woman who makes and sells sandals at a very affordable price.  She started this business making sandals 13 years ago with the help of her ex-husband.

Gradually, her income has improved, since she has become known as a sandal seller.  Now she works with the help of 2 employees who make sandals from 8:30am until 7pm every day.  She has a lot of ambition for her business, and so she wants a loan to buy insoles, soles and adhesives.  In the future, she wants to increase her production of sandals so that she can have higher sales.

loans.use: to buy insoles, soles and adhesives

loans.name: Angela Yolanda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal La Sequita se reúne en La parroquia Sequita que pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, su gente es muy trabajadora, dedicada a sus familias y muy orgullosa de sus raíces.

Aquí conocimos  a la señora Angela, ella tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y tiene cinco hijos, dos de ellos  ya son mayores e independientes, sus tres hijos menores viven  con ella los mismos que estudian en colegio. Su marido se dedica a la albañilería.
