Ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa donde vende carne, pollo, arroz, azúcar, detergentes entre otras muchas cosas de primera necesidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00. Nos cuenta que su tienda es pequeña pero que tiene de todo y esto le ha permitido ganar algo de  dinero para el sustento de su familia y también se distrae con sus amigas que llegan hasta su local. Su mercadería la compra en Manta y Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos, carne, entre otros productos. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y  le gusta por las facilidades que brinda tanto para conseguir los créditos como también para  pagar las cuotas.

 Su sueño es tener una gran despensa.
texts.en:
La Sequita Communal Bank meets in the Sequita parish, which belongs to the Canton of Montecristi in the Province of Manabí. Its people are very hardworking, dedicated to their families and very proud of their roots.

Here we met Angela, who is 42 years old and married. She has five children, two of which are adults and are independent. Her three younger children live with her and are in high school. Her husband works in building.

She has a small grocery store where she sells beef, chicken, rice, sugar, detergents, and other basic needs items. She works every day from 6am to 8pm. She tells us that her store is small, but she has everything and this has allowed her to earn money to support her family. She is also distracted by her friends that come to her store. She buys her merchandise in Manta and Portoviejo.

She will use this loan to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, cold cuts, meat, and other items. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes the credit facilities as well as the payment terms.

Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, detergent, oil, meat, cold cuts, etc.

loans.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina belongs to Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in the area of Shakar Gunj with her family for the past five years. She is 43 years old, married to M. A. who is involved in a scrap business. He provides scrap to different factories and to other scrap dealers on order. 

Robina supports her husband financially by doing sewing for her neighboring clients. She learnt this art before her marriage and earns good profits from her skills now every month.  She is the mother of two sons and two daughters. Her elder son works in a vegetable market as a vegetable vendor while her younger son works in a welding shop for a low income. Both of her daughters are getting an education. 

Robina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy scrap such as plastic bottles, used paper, etc. in bulk to fulfill the demands of his clients and to make more profits. 

Robina is hopeful that her husband who just started this business a year ago will be able to establish it with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary, a 40-year-old single mother of two, runs a salon to earn a livelihood for her family. In business for five years, she joined Faulu Kenya in a group in order to save her money and get loans easily, as the group members guarantee each other's loans. Through training conducted by Faulu Kenya, Rosemary has also learned how to manage her finances.

She has applied for a loan of 50,000 Kes to buy two steam dryers and a flat iron. Rosemary hopes to one day run a wholesale cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to buy two steam dryers and a flat iron.

loans.name: Teona

texts.en:
Teona comes from the village of Merjevi, Sachkhere District. She is 25 years old and lives with her husband Zviad, their one-year-old son and Grandma. The main income of the family comes from agricultural activities, which are led by Teona and Zviad. They have a small dairy farm – two cows, whose milk is used for cheese production. The cheese is sold on the local market. Also, they have 1.5 ha of agricultural land, where different types of vegetables are grown. Also, Zviad has a vineyard and sells grapes and wine. 

Along with the above-mentioned, Teona earns money by selling vegetables. She sells the vegetables on the local open market. 

With the requested credit, Teona plans to purchase an additional milk cow and three sheep. She will be able to sell more cheese and increase the income of the family. For the future Teona and Zviad plan to expand their sheep-breeding activities and expand their herd of sheep. 

The increase in income will allow Teona to purchase new household goods, especially for his little son.

loans.use: to pay for a milk cow and sheep.

loans.name: Las Cien Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Cien Flores lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Ana Lorena de 26 años quien se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace seis años inicio con ½ quintal de maíz actualmente compra un quintal de maíz diario para la producción de tortilla. 
Ella tiene tres  hijos de 10 y 9 años y un bebe de 5 meses. Ella invertirá el crédito en maíz, leña y cal.  
Las otras integrantes son Marina del Carmen  de 39 años quien se dedica a reciclar ella compra las pichingas y las lleva a vender a un centro de reciclaje y Aide Mariela  de 34 años tiene una fritanga restaurante popular a base de comida frita y refresco desde hace 8 años.
texts.en:
The group Las Cien Flores is made up of three hard-working and enterprising people.  One of them is Ana Lorena.  She is 26 years old and has been selling tortillas for six years.  She started with 1/2 quintal [1 quintal = 100 lbs] of corn.  Now she purchases a quintal of corn daily for the production of her tortillas.  She has three children ages 10 and 9 and a 5 month old baby.  She will use the loan to buy corn, firewood and lime.

The other members are Marina del Carmen who is 39 years old and recycles for a living.  She buys diposable containers and sells them to a recycling center.  Aide Mariele is 34 years old.  For 8 years she has been running a popular fritanga [a restaurant that specializes in home cooked Nicaraguan foods]  that serves fried foods and soft drinks.

loans.use: purchase corn, firewood and lime for making tortillas.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and married with four children. She has been raising pigs for two years and also earns income from the buying and selling of livestock.

Victoria is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is a 54-year-old businessman. He is married to Rose, who is also a businesslady. They are blessed with 4 adult children. Amos has been running a hotel as his primary business with the support of the wife. He is also in quarry mining and has also employed a worker who offers motorcycle transport as his secondary businesses. He has been in the business for the past 16 years with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, which he uses to support his family members.

He is applying for his fifth loan with KADET after successfully repaying the previous loans. Amos will use the loan to pay laborers to work in the quarry and add stock in his hotel, i.e. wheat flour, cooking oil and rice. 

With the anticipated profit from his businesses he intends to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business. His hope and dream is to purchase a piece of land, construct a permanent home, and relocate his family from an urban to a rural area.

loans.use: to pay laborers to work in the quarry and add stock in his hotel

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has 3 children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Mustafa has a grocery business selling food.  He has had this business for 1 year.         

To help expand his business, Mustafa has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda.  He will use the loan to purchase food for resale.  With the help of this loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees.  In the future, he hopes to be able to complete his rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase food for resale.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 33 years old. He is married to Nancy who does some farming to earn additional income for the family. Their children are aged eleven years, eight years and four years. He has a business buying and selling milk. He has been in business for six years and his monthly income from the business is KES. 20,000.

Edwin is requesting a loan of KES. 50,000 which he will use to buy a cow for milk production. He plans to use the anticipated income from the business to buy another cow. This is his second loan and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

Edwin's dream and hope is to buy more dairy cows and to purchase a plot of land. He also wants to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fortunata Marcela

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 43 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos la cual la última de sus hijas dependen de ella. Fortunata  se dedica al tejido de chompas, colchas, chalinas, entre otros accesorios, que son elaborados  en hilo y lana,  gracias a su trabajo Fortunata ha podido ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que actualmente  no cuenta con un trabajo seguro, también seguir ayudando a su última hija con sus estudios de enfermería. A futuro a Fortunata le gustaría poner un taller donde pueda enseñar a tejer y así obtener más ganancias para seguir apoyando a su familia. Con el préstamo solicitado piensa comprar en mayor cantidad hilo y lana ya que por esta  temporada tiene varios pedidos. Fortunata agradece a los prestamistas KIVA.
texts.en: Fortunata, 43, lives with a partner and has 3 children, the youngest of whom is dependent upon her.  Fortunata has a business knitting sweaters, bedspreads, scarves and other accessories from yarn and wool.  Thanks to this work, Fortunata has been able to help her husband with the household expenses, since at this time he does not have steady work.  She is also helping her youngest daughter with her nursing studies.  In the future, Fortunata would like to set up a workshop where she could teach knitting and in this way have more income to continue supporting her family.  With the loan requested, Fortunata will buy yarn and wool in bulk, since in this season she has a number of orders.  Fortunata thanks the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy yarn and wool

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is 49 years old, is married, and has six children.  She has a retail shop where she sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy detergent, noodles, and canned goods to restock her store.  Merlinda is a new member of Kiva field partner HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy detergent, noodles, and canned goods

loans.name: Tommy Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Tommy tiene grandes deseos de superación y cuenta con su entusiasmo para lograrlo, el joven Tommy se dedica a prestar el servicio de taxi en una moto taxi alquilada, en la cual trabaja todos los días y tiene capacidad para ahorrar, el vive con sus padres, los cuales también trabajan para la prosperidad de su hogar, el señor Tommy va a invertir el crédito en la comprar de su propia moto ya que él alquila a  un amigo la moto taxi para trabajar, su gran sueño de Tommy es llegar a tener una casa propia y el sueño para su negocio es tener una empresa de transportes de moto taxi y autos. Tommy está muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado, ya que con el va poder surgir más rápido para lograr sus metas.
texts.en: Mr Tommy desperately wants to succeed and can count on his enthusiasm to do so. Tommy is a young man who runs a taxi service in a rented motorbike taxi. He works every day and is able to save. He lives with his parents who also work so that the home can prosper. Mr Tommy is going to use the loan to buy his own motorbike taxi as the one he currently uses is rented from a friend. Tommy's great dream is to own a house of his own and grow his business into a car and motorbike taxi company. Tommy is very grateful for the loan he has been granted as with it he can reach his goals sooner.

loans.use: to buy his own motorbike taxi.

loans.name: Dyna Rose

texts.en:
Dyna Rose is 35, married and lives with her three children who are of school-age. Her husband is a chainsaw operator while she manages her home-based store.

Dyna Rose has been selling groceries for one year. She sells all types of daily-use products such as milk, cooking oil, canned goods, eggs and soft drinks. With the profits she is able to cover all their household expenses.

To maintain her business, she is applying for a loan of P8,000 to buy more groceries such as sugar, bar soap, ingredients, soft drinks, snack foods and biscuits for her store. Her wish is for her business to grow and to have more products to offer her customers. She hopes that her loan request will be granted so that she will be able to improve her business and support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy stock for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Ruthchel

texts.en:
Ruthchel is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Ruthchel buys and sells t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy clothing like t-shirts and blouses for resale.

Ruthchel is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ruthchel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing like t-shirts and blouses to sell.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El Grupo la unión esta conformado por ocho integrantes cada uno con una diferente actividad económica, este grupo se caracteriza por ser muy  entusiastas, alegres y con muchas ganas de trabajar. Ellos han llamado la a su grupo la unión porque ellos son muy unidos y les gusta siempre a poyarse unos con otros, ellos viven en una región donde la principal actividad económica es la siembra de caña para la producción de azúcar.

La Señora Florian es uno de los miembros de este grupo , ella tiene la edad de 33 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor Raul que trabaja como albañil con el cual tiene dos hijas una que estudio el bachillerato y una pequeña que  aun no estudia. Ella dice que desde muy pequeña su madre le enseño a bordar y tejer y hace un poco mas de tres años inicio atrabajar en la elaboración y venta de sus manualidades para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijas.

ella platica que como ya tiene clientes  que le hacen pedidos de servilletas bordadas para los xv años, bautizos y bodas o algunas ocasiones le encargan fundas para cojines con una figura bordada y la orrilla tejida , manteles o blusas tejidas y bordadas, poco a poco se ha dado a conocer en su comunidad y en otras comunidades cercanas y gracias ha esto las ventas son buenas y su negocio va creciendo.

Ella invertirá este crédito en la compra de telas, variedad de hilos, listones, ahugas, pinturas textiles, encajes, pinceles y ganchos para la elaboración de sus productos.

"Muchas gracias por la confianza y el credito que me dieron" Ella desea que este crédito le ayude a dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y continuar expandiendo su negocio.


Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Alejandra venta de hot-dog y hamburguesas
Odali venta de cosmeticos
Silvia Venta de Antijitos Mexicanos
Concepcion venta de cosmeticos
Florencia venta de catalago
Anabel venta de catalago
Daniel taller mecanico
texts.en:
The La Union Group if made up of eight members, each of whom are in different businesses.  This group stands out for being very enthusiastic, upbeat, and motivated to work.  They have named their group "la unión" because they are very united and they always like to support each other.  They live in an area where the main economic activity is growing sugar cane for sugar production.  

Florian is one of the members of this group.  She is 33 years old, she has a high school education, and she is married to Raul, who works as a bricklayer.  They have two daughters, one who graduated high school and a young one who hasn't started school yet.  She says that since she was very young, her mother taught her how to embroider and knit and a little over three years ago she started to work in making and selling her handicrafts in order to help her husband out with their household expenses and with their daughters' educational expenses.

She says that since she has customers now, they place orders with her for napkins for 15th-birthday parties, baptisms, and weddings, or sometimes they order cushion covers, tablecloths, or knitted blouses, and she makes them.  Little by little, she has become known in her community and in surrounding communities and, thanks to that, her sales have been good and her business is growing.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of fabrics, different threads, ribbons, needles, fabric paints, lace, paintbrushes, and pins to make her products. 

She says, "Thank you for trusting in me and giving me the loan."  She wants this loan to help her offer her family a better quality of life and to continue to expand her business.

The other group members are:
Alejandra - hot dog and hamburger sales
Odali - cosmetics sales
Silvia - typical Mexican snacks sales
Concepción - cosmetics sales
Florencia - catalog sales
Anabel - catalog sales
Daniel - mechanic

loans.use: to sell embroidered blouses, napkins and tablecloths.

loans.name: Asylbek

texts.ru:
Асылбек  40-летний фермер, живущий в с .Талды-Суу (северо-восточная часть Кыргызстана). С 1992 года семья Асылбека успешно занимается разведением скота и перепродажей сельхоз продукции. Особое внимание  он уделяет культивированию и выращиванию особого сорта картофеля, пользующийся  повышенным спросом у местного населения. Упорный и неустанный труд в бизнесе позволяет Асылбеку покрывать расходы своей семьи и поддерживать своих престарелых родителей и их хозяйство.   
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Асылбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Асылбек намерен использовать для реконструкции сарая  в целях обеспечения хороших условия для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Asylbek is a 40 year old farmer who lives in Taldy-Suu village (north-east part of Kyrgyzstan).  Since 1992 Asylbek's family has been successfully growing livestock and reselling agricultural produce.  He pays special attention to cultivating and growing a specific type of potato, that has had an increase in demand from the local population.  Stubborn and hard work on his business allows Asylbek to pay for his family's expenses and to support his elderly parents and their household.  

In order to continue to increase his livestock headcount Asylbek turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) in order to purchase additional livestock for fattening.  Asylbek plans to use the expected profits to rebuild his shed in order to provide good conditions for raising livestock.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
La señora Zunilda tiene 37 años D. edad, está casada hace 20 años con el señor Santiago D. 42 años D. edad,  tienen tres hijos D. 20, 12 y 3 años respectivamente, la mayor está cursando el primer año D. Contabilidad en la universidad,  el otro está en el séptimo grado, y el menor D. todos aun no va a la escuela.
La sra. Zunilda tiene una despensa,  se dedica a este negocio desD. hace 4 años gracias a un capital que le había dado su marido que es empleado. Ambos, por medio D. sus ingresos ayudan en la casa. La idea D. la pareja es que sus hijos sigan estudiando, y puedan terminar una carrera universitaria y que pueda cada uno contar con una profesión que le permita salir adelante en la vida. Solicita este préstamo para la compra D. productos para su negocio como ser arroz, fideos, azúcar, gaseosas, galletas, tomate, cebollas y otros artículos que le permitirá aumentar su stock y D. esa forma poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Zunilda, 37, has been married to Santiago, 42, for 20 years; they have three children who are 20, 12 and 3 years old respectively.  The oldest is in first year of Accounting in the university, the next one is in 7th graD. and the youngest still hasn’t started going to school.

Zunilda has a grocery store, a business she’s had for four years thanks to capital her husband, who is employed, gave her.  Both of them help support the household with their income.  The couple’s plan is that their children continue with their studies so that they can complete university careers so that they can count on having professions that will allow them to get ahead in life.

She’s asking for this loan to buy stock merchandise for her store like: noodles, rice, sugar, soft-drinks, cookies, tomatoes, onions and other items that will allow her to increase her stock to earn better monthly income.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 26 years old, married and has one child. He is married to a bookkeeper who is his partner in supporting their family. 

Virgilio has managed a rice farming business for four years. He earns approximately an income of PHP 50,000 per crop in his three hectares of rice field. Due to an unexpected typhoon that destroyed his crops, Virgilio earned just PHP 25,000 last crop.
  
Virgilio’s earnings last crop went for their household expenses. Some leftover amount will be used to pay the labor costs of farming. 

Virgilio is currently facing a financial shortage to maintain his farm. He is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds to grow, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care. He knows the loan will help him to maintain his farming business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Nidia Lucia

texts.es:
Nidia mujer emprendedora a logrado mejorar su vivienda, su negocio mediante los prestamos realizado. Cumpliendo así con la necesidad de tener mayor comodidad para su familia. Le agrego al negocio la venta de carne de res, cerdo y pollo además de mantener su venta de variedades.
El préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercaderías como: carnes, productos de cosméticos, perfumes, ropas, zapatos, bisuteras, prendas de oro laminados siendo un nuevo producto a ofrecer a sus clientes. Trabaja también mediante encargos por catálogo. Obtendrá ganancia que será para mayores comodidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Nidia, an entrepreneurial woman, has managed to improve her home and business through the loans she has made, creating greater comfort for her family.
She has added the sale of beef, pork, and chicken to her business, as well as continuing to sell other varieties of items.

The loan will be invested to purchase goods such as meats, cosmetics, perfumes, clothes, shoes, imitation jewelry, and gold plated articles as new products to offer to her customers. She also fills catalog orders. She will obtain increased profits which will be used for better comforts for her family.

loans.use: to purchase meats, cosmetics, perfumes, clothes, shoes, imitation jewelry and gold plated items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 42-year-old married woman with six children between the ages of twenty and four. All of them are in school. For eight years she has had a business selling ice cream in Buluk, South Sudan.

Grace requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use the extra income she gains as a result of this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for sale.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 54-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband and one child who is still attending school. She cooperates with her husband, who works on his own, to be able to cover her child’s educational fees. Fatmeh began giving private lessons from her home in 2000. She has also been a teacher in a local school for the past 21 years. 

Fatmeh is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from the Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate her house and prepare a special room for giving educational lessons. In that way, she will be able to improve her family's living standards. In the future, Fatmeh plans to retire and receive her retirement compensation in addition to continuing her private lessons.

loans.use: to renovate her house and create a room for giving lessons

loans.name: N’To

texts.fr:
Monsieur  N’TO  est âgé de 44 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DIENFING, un des villages de la sous - préfecture  de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
N’TO n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après avoir correctement rembourser les cinq prêts précédents, il est à son sixième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales (maïs, haricot, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DIENFING et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
N’TO espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
N’To is 44 years old and lives with his five children and his spouse in a traditional family in Dienfing, one of the villages of the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, Koulikoro region.

N'To did not have the chance to go to school. Very early he became interested in income-generating businesses, notably buying, storage and selling of cereals. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who was formerly a great businessman of cereals.

Due to the worry of satisfying his clearly growing clientèle, he decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso.

After having correctly repaid his five previous loans, he is on his sixth individual loan which will serve to buy 5 tons of cereals (corn, bean, mil [African cereal], fonio [African cereal]) from the farmers of Dienfing and surrounding areas which he will keep for at least three months. He sells essentially wholesale to a clientèle consisting of resellers from the large cities such as Bamako.

N'To hopes to make an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA which will be used to repay the loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 44 years old and married to Kawinzi. She has 4 children. She has been operating a retail food stall for the past year, earning a monthly income of KES 11,700.

She is requesting her first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000. She will use the funds to purchase stocks of maize, flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat. With the anticipated profits she will educate her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to have the shop fully stocked and to have a stable family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize, flour, sugar, rice, and cooking fat to sell.

loans.name: Aiah Prince's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are teachers of a primary school in Seidu, Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. These teachers want a loan of 3,300,000 Sierra Leonean Leonean in order to solve their immediate financial needs. And at the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries.

Pictured on the left is the leader of the group, Aiah. Aiah is fifty-seven years old. He is a native of Gandorhun, in eastern Sierra Leone. He is married to a trader and the couple has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary. Aiah has been a professional teacher for ten years now. He has requested for this loan in order to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house building materials – iron corrugated zincs, cements, etc. for the construction of a family dwelling house

loans.name: Qorxmaz

texts.en:
Qorxmaz is a 21-year-old single man. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. Qorxmaz never went to school because of his parents' financial situation and the war. 

He is a worker, but his salary is low. Because of that, he chose gardening as an additional source of income. They have a big amount of land, but he doesn't have money to supply crops, trees and garden tools. He hopes that Kiva will be able to support him. He needs a loan of 1,200 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat), and this is going to be his first loan. Qorxmaz plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Jose Leopoldo

texts.es:
José, es casado,  vive con su familia integrada por su esposa y un hijo de 10 años, los cuales dependen económicamente de él; se dedica a trabajar en el campo cultivando granos básicos, tiene su negocio propio desde hace 15 años, su padre le enseño el oficio, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Opta por trabajar con créditos para poder mejorar su negocio, en esta oportunidad invertirá el capital en la compra de abono, semilla y herbicidas, estos materiales le serán de ayuda que sus cultivos tengan un mejor desarrollo y le den una cosecha más abundante, la esperanza que alberga es tener mejores ingresos para darle a su familia una vida más confortable.
Sus sueños son continuar trabajando de la mano con Padecomsm y Kiva para progresar junto a su núcleo familiar.

loans.use: compra de abono, semilla y herbicidas, estos materiales le serán de ayuda que sus cultivos tengan un mejor desarrollo
